<s> my interviews with teen-agers confirmed this portrait of the weakening of religious and ethnic bonds </s>
<s> jewish identity was often confused with social and economic strivings </s>
<s> when i pressed for a purely religious definition i encountered the familiar blend of liberal piety interfaith good will and a small residue of ethnic loyalty </s>
<s> you can communicate in your own way </s>
<s> this accords with the study by maier and spinrad </s>
<s> nevertheless most of the teen-agers i interviewed believed in maintaining their jewish identity and even envisioned joining a synagogue or temple </s>
<s> the reason offered for clinging to the ancestral faith lacked force and authority even in the teen-agers minds </s>
<s> intermarriage which is generally regarded as a threat to jewish survival was regarded not with horror or apprehension but with a kind of mild clinical disapproval </s>
<s> most of the teen-agers i interviewed rejected it on pragmatic grounds </s>
<s> it appears that an orthodox girl in the community disrupted plans for an outing sponsored by one of the jewish service groups because she would not travel on saturday and in addition required kosher food </s>
<s> this is no doubt inaccurate but it does convey how isolated she feels among the vast army of the nonobservant </s>
<s> the older teens </s>
<s> one of the significant things about jewish culture in the older teen years is that it is largely college-oriented </s>
<s> sixty-five per cent of the jewish teen-agers of college age attend institutions of higher learning </s>
<s> this may help explain a phenomenon described by a small-town jewish boy </s>
<s> in their first two years in high school jewish boys in this town make strenuous exertions to win positions on the school teams </s>
<s> however in their junior and senior years they generally forego their athletic pursuits presumably in the interest of better academic achievement </s>
<s> it is significant too that the older teen-agers i interviewed believed unlike the younger ones that jewish students tend to do better academically than their gentile counterparts </s>
<s> the percentage of jewish girls who attend college is almost as high as that of boys </s>
<s> the motivations for both sexes to be sure are different </s>
<s> the vocational motive is the dominant one for boys while jewish girls attend college for social reasons and to become culturally developed </s>
<s> one of the significant developments in american-jewish life is that the cultural consumers are largely the women </s>
<s> in upper teen jewish life the non-college group tends to have a sense of marginality </s>
<s> however among the girls there are some morale-enhancing compensations for not going to college </s>
<s> she is even prone to regard the college girl as immature </s>
<s> the lower-middle class college student </s>
<s> one of the reasons for the high percentage of jewish teen-agers in college is that a great many urban jews are enabled to attend local colleges at modest cost </s>
<s> this is particularly true in large centers of jewish population like new york chicago and philadelphia </s>
<s> what is noteworthy about this large group of teen-agers is that although their attitudes hardly differentiate them from their gentile counterparts they actually lead their lives in a vast self-enclosed jewish cosmos with relatively little contact with the non-jewish world </s>
<s> there is to begin an important sex difference </s>
<s> typically in a lower-middle class jewish family a son will be sent to an out-of-town school if financial resources warrant it while the daughter will attend the local college </s>
<s> there are two reasons for this </s>
<s> second the attitude in jewish families is far more protective toward the daughter than toward the son </s>
<s> most jewish mothers are determined to exercise vigilance over the social and sexual lives of their daughters by keeping them home </s>
<s> the consequence of this is that the girls at brooklyn college outnumber the boys and do somewhat better academically </s>
<s> one can assume that some of the brightest boys are out of town </s>
<s> brooklyn college students have an ambivalent attitude toward their school </s>
<s> on the one hand there is a sense of not having moved beyond the ambiance of their high school </s>
<s> this is particularly acute for those who attended midwood high school directly across the street from brooklyn college </s>
<s> they have a sense of marginality at being denied that special badge of status the out-of-town school </s>
<s> for most brooklyn college students college is at once a perpetuation of their ethnic attachments and a breaking away from the cage of neighborhood and family </s>
<s> brooklyn college is unequivocally jewish in tone and efforts to detribalize the college by bringing in unimpeachably midwestern types on the faculty have been unavailing </s>
<s> however a growing intellectual sophistication and the new certitudes imparted by courses in psychology and anthropology make the students increasingly critical of their somewhat provincial and overprotective parents </s>
<s> and the rebellion of these third generation jews is not the traditional conflict of culture but rather a protest against a culture that they view as softly and insidiously enveloping </s>
<s> for girls the overprotection is far more pervasive </s>
<s> parents will drive on friday night to pick up their daughters after a sorority or house plan meeting </s>
<s> the domestic tentacles even extend to the choice of a major field </s>
<s> this means that a great many academically talented girls are discouraged from pursuing graduate work of a more demanding nature </s>
<s> a kind of double standard exists here for jewish boys and girls as it does in the realm of sex </s>
<s> the breaking away from the prison house of brooklyn is gradual </s>
<s> first the student trains on his hapless parents the heavy artillery of his newly acquired psychological and sociological insights </s>
<s> then with the new affluence there is actually a sallying forth into the wide wide world beyond the precincts of new york </s>
<s> the great world beyond beckons </s>
<s> although brooklyn college does not yet have a junior-year-abroad program a good number of students spend summers in europe </s>
<s> in general however the timetable of travel lags considerably behind that of the student at harvard or smith </s>
<s> and acculturation into the world at large is likely to occur for the brooklyn college student after college rather than during the four school years </s>
<s> brooklyn college is marjorie morningstar territory as much as the bronx or central park west </s>
<s> there are hordes of nubile young women there who prodded by their impatient mothers are determined to marry </s>
<s> these announcements are in effect advertisements for themselves as thriving marriage marts </s>
<s> there are boxed proclamations in the newspaper of watchings pinnings ringings engagements and marriages in a scrupulously graded hierarchy of felicity </s>
<s> the brooklyn college student shows some striking departures from prevailing collegiate models </s>
<s> the ivy league enjoys no easy dominion here and the boys are as likely to dress in rather foppish continental fashion or even in nondescript working class manner as they are in the restrained button-down ivy way </s>
<s> among the boys there is very little bravado about drinking </s>
<s> brooklyn college is distinctive for not having an official drinking place </s>
<s> the fort lauderdale encampment for drinking is foreign to most brooklyn college boys </s>
<s> for galled breasts the mother should shave into half a cup of fresh unsalted lard enough white chalk to make a paste </s>
<s> this could also be used for any other skin irritation </s>
<s> or she might place cornstarch in the oven for a short time and then apply this under her breasts </s>
<s> at least i have only one remedy for anything of this kind in my collection one for hastening delayed menstruation </s>
<s> the sufferer drinks tansy tea </s>
<s> bruises burns cuts etc occurred frequently on the frontier and folk medicine gave the answers to these problems too </s>
<s> bruises and black eyes were relieved by application of raw beefsteak </s>
<s> many people agreed that burns should be treated with bland oily salves or unsalted butter or lard but one informant told me that a burn should be bathed in salt water </s>
<s> the burn oozed watery fluid for many days and finally the healing was completed by bathing it with epsom salts </s>
<s> another swore by vinegar baths for burns and still another recommended salted butter </s>
<s> this was made by putting butter in a pan of water and allowing it to boil </s>
<s> when it was cool the fat was skimmed off and bottled </s>
<s> one man badly burned about the face and eyes by an arc welding torch was blinded and could not find a doctor at the time </s>
<s> later the doctor used mineral oil on the burns </s>
<s> the results were good but which treatment helped is still not known </s>
<s> to stop bleeding cobwebs were applied to cuts and wounds </s>
<s> one old-timer said to sprinkle sugar on a bleeding cut even when on a knuckle if it was made by a rusty tool </s>
<s> this would stop the flow and also prevent infection </s>
<s> my lawyer told me that his mother used a similar remedy for cuts and wounds </s>
<s> she sprinkled common sugar directly on the injury and then bound it loosely with cotton cloth over which she poured turpentine </s>
<s> he showed me one of his fingers which had been practically amputated and which his mother had treated </s>
<s> there is scarcely a scar showing </s>
<s> tobacco was common first aid </s>
<s> or a thin slice of plug tobacco might be laid on the open wound without chewing </s>
<s> one old man told me that when he was a boy he was kicked in the head by a fractious mule and had his scalp laid back from the entire front of his head </s>
<s> his brother ran a mile to get the father </s>
<s> when they reached the boy the father sliced a new plug of tobacco put the scalp back in place and covered the raw edges with the slices </s>
<s> then he put a rag around the dressing to keep it in place </s>
<s> there was no cleaning or further care but the wound healed in less than two weeks and showed no scar </s>
<s> veronica from the herb garden was also used to stop bleeding and rue was an antiseptic </s>
<s> they would feed on its surface leaving it clean so that it could be medically treated </s>
<s> tetanus could be avoided by pouring warm turpentine over a wound </s>
<s> one family bound wounds with bacon or salt pork strips or if these were not handy plain lard </s>
<s> another sprinkled sugar on hot coals and held the wounded foot or hand in the smoke </s>
<s> another cure for hydrophobia was to suck the wounds then cauterize them with a hot knife or poker </s>
<s> while nowadays we recognize the fact that there are many causes for bleeding at the nose not long ago a nosebleed was simply that and treatment had little variation </s>
<s> since a fall or blow might have caused it a cold pack was usually first aid </s>
<s> or the victim could chew hard on a piece of paper meanwhile pressing his fingers tight in his ears </s>
<s> old sores could be healed by the constant application of a wash made of equal parts vinegar and water </s>
<s> blood blisters could be prevented from forming by rubbing a work blister immediately with any hard nonpoisonous substance </s>
<s> felons were cured by taking common salt and drying it in the oven pounding it fine and mixing it with equal parts of spirits of turpentine </s>
<s> this mixture was then spread on a cloth and wrapped around the affected part </s>
<s> insect bites were cured in many ways </s>
<s> many an old-timer swore by the saliva method </s>
<s> this was used also for bruises </s>
<s> yellow clay was used as a poultice for insect bites and also for swellings </s>
<s> chiggers were a common pest along streams and where gardens and berries thrived </s>
<s> bathing the itching parts with kerosene gave relief and also killed the pests </s>
<s> ant bites were eased by applying liquid bluing </s>
<s> for mosquito bites a paste of half a glass of salt and half a glass of soda was made </s>
<s> for wasp stings onion juice obtained by scraping an onion gave quick relief </s>
<s> a handier remedy was to bathe the painful part in strong soapy water </s>
<s> mud was sometimes used as well as soap </s>
<s> just plain old black dirt was also used as a pack to relieve wasp or bee stings </s>
<s> bedbugs were a common pest in pioneer days </s>
<s> bed slats were washed in alum water legs of beds were placed in cups of kerosene and all woodwork was treated liberally with corrosive sublimate applied with a feather </s>
<s> kerosene was very effective in ridding pioneer homes of the pests </s>
<s> at times pioneer children got lice in their hair </s>
<s> a kerosene shampoo seems a heroic treatment but it did the job </s>
<s> a cinder or other small object could be removed from the eye by placing a flaxseed in the eye </s>
<s> as the seed swelled its glutinous covering protected the eyeball from irritation and both the cinder and the seed could soon be washed out </s>
<s> another way to remove small objects from the eye was to have the person look cross-eyed </s>
<s> the particle would then move toward the nose where it could be wiped out with a wisp of cotton </s>
<s> shingles were cured by gentian an old drug used in combinations </s>
<s> for erysipelas a mixture of one dram borax and one ounce glycerine was applied to the afflicted part on linen cloth </s>
<s> winter itch was treated by applying strong apple cider in which pulverized bloodroot had been steeped </s>
<s> to cure fungus growths on mouth or hands people made a strong tea by using a handful of sassafras bark in a quart of water </s>
<s> they drank half a cup of this morning and night and they also washed and soaked their hands in the same solution </s>
<s> six treatments cured one case which lasted a month and had defied other remedies </s>
<s> frostbite was treated by putting the feet and hands in ice water or by rubbing them with snow </s>
<s> now one hears that heat and hot water are used instead </s>
<s> another remedy was oil of eucalyptus used as well for chilblains </s>
<s> chilblains were also treated with tincture of capsicum or cabbage leaves </s>
<s> boils have always been a source of much trouble </s>
<s> a german informant gave me a sure cure made by combining rye flour and molasses into a poultice </s>
<s> another poultice was made from the inner bark of the elm tree steeped in water until it formed a sticky gummy solution </s>
<s> this was also used for sores </s>
<s> another frequent pioneer difficulty caused by wearing rough and heavy shoes and boots was corns </s>
<s> another common cure was to soak the feet five or ten minutes in warm water then to apply a solution of equal parts of soda and common brown soap on a kid bandage overnight </s>
<s> this softened the skin so that in the morning when the bandage was removed the corn could be scraped off and a bit of corn plaster put on </s>
<s> there were many cures for warts </s>
<s> one young girl told me how her mother removed a wart from her finger by soaking a copper penny in vinegar for three days and then painting the finger with the liquid several times </s>
<s> another wart removal method was to rub each wart with a bean split open and then to bury the bean halves under the drip of the house for seven days </s>
<s> wetting a wart with this saliva on wakening the first thing in the morning was supposed to cause it to disappear after only a few treatments and strangely enough many warts did just that </s>
<s> one wart cure was to wrap it in a hair from a blonde gypsy </s>
<s> another was to soak raw beef in vinegar for twenty-four hours tie it on the wart and wear it for a week </s>
<s> a simpler method was to tie a thread tightly around the wart at its base and wear it this way </s>
<s> i know this worked </s>
<s> one person recommended to me washing the wart with sulphur water </s>
<s> another said it should be rubbed with a cut potato three times daily </s>
<s> another common method was to cut an onion in two and place each half on the wart for a moment </s>
<s> the onion was then fastened together with string and placed beneath a dripping eave </s>
<s> as the onion decayed so did the wart </s>
<s> sore muscles were relieved by an arnica rub </s>
<s> leg cramps one person tells me were relieved by standing barefoot with the weight of the body on the heel and pressing down hard </s>
<s> this does give relief as i can testify </s>
<s> one doctor prescribed a tablespoon of whiskey or brandy before each meal for leg cramps </s>
<s> for sprains and swellings one pint of cider vinegar and half a pint of spirits of turpentine added to three well beaten eggs was said to give speedy relief </s>
<s> in instances where both of these are persons or firms with integrity the situation is ideal </s>
<s> it may on occasion be anything but that </s>
<s> a good negociant or shipper will not only be the man or the firm which has cornered the wines from the best vineyards or the best parts of them </s>
<s> these are the wines the french themselves use for everyday drinking for even in france virtually no one drinks the grands crus on a meal-to-meal basis </s>
<s> the grands crus are expensive and even doting palates tire of them </s>
<s> and certainly in the case of the beginner or the comparatively uninitiated wine drinker the palate and the capacity for appreciation will not be ready for the grands crus as a steady diet without frequent recourse to crus of less renown </s>
<s> there is nothing infra dig about a good blend from a good shipper </s>
<s> wine waiters are something else again </s>
<s> especially if one is travelling or dining out a great deal their importance mounts </s>
<s> most of them the world over operate on the same principle by which justice is administered in france and some other latin countries the customer is to be considered guilty of abysmal ignorance until proven otherwise with the burden of proof on the customer himself </s>
<s> this is the only valid and extenuating argument that may be advanced in defense of the reprehensible attitude of the common wine waiter </s>
<s> faced on the one hand with an always exhaustible supply of his best wines and on the other by a clientele usually equipped with inexhaustible pocketbooks it is a wonder indeed that all wine waiters are not afflicted with chronic ambivalence </s>
<s> only then perhaps will he reveal his jewels and his bargains </s>
<s> wine bought from a dealer should ideally be allowed to rest for several weeks before it is served </s>
<s> this is especially true of red wines and a practice which though not always practicable is well worth the effort </s>
<s> it does no harm for wine to stand on end for a matter of days but in terms of months and years it is fatal </s>
<s> wine stored for a long time should be on its side </s>
<s> otherwise the cork dries and air enters to spoil it </s>
<s> when stacking wine on its side in a bin care should always be taken to be sure there is no air bubble left next to the cork </s>
<s> fat bottles such as burgundies have a way of rolling around in the bin and often need little props such as a bit of cardboard or a chip of wood to hold them in the proper reclining posture </s>
<s> too much dampness in the cellar rots the corks again with ill effects </s>
<s> if it smells of cork one has grounds for suspicion </s>
<s> seasonal rises or drops in temperature are bad for wine they age it prematurely </s>
<s> the ideal storage temperature for long periods is about fifty-five degrees with an allowable range of five degrees above or below this provided there are no sudden or frequent changes </s>
<s> prolonged vibration is also undesirable </s>
<s> light especially daylight is always bad for wine </s>
<s> all in all though there is a good deal of nonsense expended over the preparations thought necessary for ordinary wine drinking </s>
<s> many people go to extreme lengths in decanting chilling or warming or banishing without further investigation any bottle with so much as a slightly suspicious cork </s>
<s> no one should wish to deny these purists the obvious pleasure they derive from all this and to give fair warning where warning is due no one who becomes fond of wines ever avoids acquiring some degree of purism </s>
<s> but the fact remains that in most restaurants including some of the best of paris and bordeaux and dijon the bottle is frankly and simply brought from the cellar to the table when ordered and all the conditioning or preparation it ever receives takes place while the chef is preparing the meal </s>
<s> for those who live in a winter climate there is nothing better than a bucket of water and snow </s>
<s> though by no means an ideal procedure a red wine may similarly be brought from the cellar to the dining room and opened twenty minutes or so before serving time </s>
<s> it may be a bit cold when poured </s>
<s> but again as one will have observed at any restaurant worth its salt wine should be served in a large tulip-shaped glass which is never filled more than half full </s>
<s> the only cardinal sin which may be committed in warming a wine is to force it by putting it next to the stove or in front of an open fire </s>
<s> very old red wines often require several hours of aeration and any red wine brought from the cellar within half an hour of mealtime should be uncorked and allowed some air </s>
<s> but white wines never </s>
<s> white wines should be opened when served having been previously chilled in proportion to their sweetness </s>
<s> thus sauternes or barsacs should be very cold </s>
<s> a pouilly-fuisse or a chablis somewhat less cold </s>
<s> the fragrance and taste of any white wine will die a lingering death when it is allowed to warm or is exposed for long to the air </s>
<s> if this must be done they should always be corked and kept in a cool place </s>
<s> it should be remembered that their lasting qualities are appreciably shorter than those of milk </s>
<s> a few red wines notably those of the beaujolais are better consumed at cellar temperature </s>
<s> thus red wine must if possible never be disturbed or shaken </s>
<s> very old red wine is often decanted so that the puckering bitter elements which have settled to the bottom will not be mingled with the wine itself </s>
<s> a tug-of-war between an old bottle and an inefficient corkscrew may do as much harm as a week at sea </s>
<s> the cork should be pulled gradually and smoothly and the lip of the bottle wiped afterward </s>
<s> many people use wicker cradles for old red wine lifting the bottle carefully from the bin into the cradle and eventually to the table without disturbing the sediment </s>
<s> another school frowns on such a shortcut and insists that after leaving the bin an old red wine should first stand on end for several days to allow the sediment to roll to the very bottom after which the bottle may be gently eased to a tilted position on its side in the cradle </s>
<s> in france when one wishes to entertain at a restaurant and serve truly fine old red wines one visits the restaurant well ahead of time chooses the wines and with the advice of the manager and his chef builds the menu around them </s>
<s> the wine waiter will see to it that the bottles are taken from the bin and opened at least in time to warm and aerate preferably allowed to stand on end for as long as possible and perhaps in the case of very old wines be decanted </s>
<s> decanting old wine aerates it fully </s>
<s> for in the process of decanting the bottle is only tilted once instead of several or more times at the table hence a minimum of the undesirable mixture of wine and dregs </s>
<s> though there are many exceptions which we have noted in preceding pages white wine is as a rule best consumed between two and six years old and red wines nowadays between three and ten </s>
<s> red wines of good years tend to mature later and to keep longer </s>
<s> the average claret is notably longer-lived than its opposite number red burgundy </s>
<s> some clarets do not come into their own until they are ten or fifteen years of age or even more </s>
<s> if a red bordeaux of a good name and year is bitter or acid or cloying and muddy-tasting leave it alone for a while </s>
<s> most of the wines of beaujolais on the other hand should be drunk while very young </s>

<s> his sudden unannounced appearance at the borden home was strange in that he did not carry an iota of baggage with him although he clearly intended to stay overnight if not longer </s>
<s> lizzie stated during the inquest that while her father and uncle were in the sitting room the afternoon before the murders she had been disturbed by their voices and had closed her door even though it was a very hot day </s>
<s> it is evident that lizzie did not tell everything she overheard between her father and her uncle morse </s>
<s> at that time jennings had a young law associate named arthur s phillips </s>
<s> a few years ago not too long before his death phillips revealed in a newspaper story that he had always suspected morse of the murders </s>
<s> he said morse and borden had quarreled violently in the house that day information which must have come from lizzie </s>
<s> it was obviously the sound of this argument that caused lizzie to close her door </s>
<s> notice knowlton did not say that he would have obtained a conviction in the trial of lizzie borden </s>
<s> it is known that morse did associate with a group of itinerant horse traders who made their headquarters at westport a town not far from fall river </s>
<s> they were a vagabond lot and considered to be shady and undesirable characters </s>
<s> fall river police did go to westport to see if they could get any information against morse and possibly find an accomplice whom he might have hired from among these men </s>
<s> these officers found no incriminating information </s>
<s> the woman in the house where the niece was staying backed up his story and said she left when he did to shop for her dinner </s>
<s> fall river is not a fashionable town </s>
<s> the dinner hour there was twelve noon </s>
<s> they interviewed the conductor of the streetcar morse said he had taken but the man did not remember morse as a passenger </s>
<s> questioned further morse said that there had been four or five priests riding on the same car with him </s>
<s> bridget testified she saw him leave through the side door </s>
<s> morse said borden let him out and locked the screen door </s>
<s> from that point on he said he went to the post office and then walked leisurely to where his niece was staying more than a mile away </s>
<s> he met nobody he knew on this walk </s>
<s> there is no accounting of his movements in this long gap of time which covers the early hours when mrs borden was killed </s>
<s> she said it was after she returned from her vomiting spell in the back yard that mrs borden told her to wash the windows </s>
<s> this was long after morse had left the house </s>
<s> he knew the house fairly well he had been there on two previous visits during the past three or four months alone </s>
<s> the screen door was unlocked for some ten or fifteen minutes while bridget was sick in the back </s>
<s> it was unlocked all the time she was washing windows </s>
<s> morse could have returned openly while bridget was sick in the back yard and gone up to the room he had occupied </s>
<s> mrs borden would not have been alarmed if she saw morse with an ax or hatchet in his hand </s>
<s> he had been to the farm the previous day and he could have said they needed the ax or hatchet at the farm </s>
<s> mrs borden would have had no reason to disbelieve him and he could have approached close enough to her to swing before she could cry out </s>
<s> he could have left for weybosset street after her murder and made it in plenty of time by using the streetcar </s>
<s> with lizzie in the barn the screen door unlocked and bridget upstairs in her attic room he would have had free and easy access to the house </s>
<s> with the second murder over he could have left hidden the weapon in some vacant lot or an abandoned cistern in the neighborhood </s>
<s> his unconcerned stroll down the side of the house to a pear tree with crowds already gathering in front of the building and sawyer guarding the side door was odd </s>
<s> there was no close examination of his clothes for bloodstains and certainly no scientific test was made of them </s>
<s> and for a man who traveled around without any change of clothing a few more stains on his dark suit may very well have gone unnoticed </s>
<s> the motive may have been the mysterious quarrel </s>
<s> there was no financial gain for morse in the murders </s>
<s> on the other side of the ledger is the fact that he did see his niece and the woman with whom she was staying </s>
<s> the time would have been shortly after the murder of mrs borden and they noticed nothing unusual in his behavior </s>
<s> he said he had promised mrs borden to return in time for dinner and that was close to the time when he did turn up at the borden house </s>
<s> he wrote </s>
<s> neither had any interest in the deaths </s>
<s> that was his complete discussion of bridget sullivan as a possible suspect </s>
<s> although pearson disbelieved almost everything lizzie said and read a sinister purpose into almost everything she did he happily accepted her statement about bridget as the whole truth </s>
<s> he felt nothing further need be said about the servant girl </s>
<s> lizzie actually never named any suspect </s>
<s> she told police about the prospective tenant she had heard quarreling with her father some weeks before the murders but she said she thought he was from out of town because she heard him mention something about talking to his partner </s>
<s> and much as she detested hiram harrington she also did not accuse him </s>
<s> at the inquest she was asked specifically whether she knew anybody her father had bad feelings toward or who had bad feelings toward her father </s>
<s> asked who this was she named harrington </s>
<s> her statement certainly was true </s>
<s> when i interviewed kirby who as a boy picked up pears in the borden yard i asked if anybody else in the household besides lizzie and morse had been under any suspicion at the time of the murders </s>
<s> he said he had not heard of anybody else </s>
<s> i inquired </s>
<s> kirby was of course reflecting the opinion that existed at the time of murders </s>
<s> everyone somehow manages to overlook completely the fact that as far as we know there were exactly two people in and about the house at the time of both murders lizzie borden and bridget sullivan </s>
<s> all the officials on the case seem to have been afflicted with a similar myopia as far as bridget was concerned although records in police files contain many reports of servants who have murdered their employers </s>
<s> true it is no longer cricket for the butler to be the killer in mystery fiction but we are dealing here with actual people in real life and not imaginary characters and situations </s>
<s> the actions of bridget should be examined since she was there and opportunity did exist if only to establish her innocence </s>
<s> there are also other factors that require closer examination </s>
<s> the people who believe and retell the legend have apparently never troubled to read the trial testimony and do not know that the maid changed her testimony on several key points always to the detriment of lizzie </s>
<s> if bridget did get any bundles of cash the last person who would have rewarded her for services rendered would have been lizzie borden </s>
<s> bridget was born in ireland one of fourteen children </s>
<s> she was apparently the pioneer in her family because she had no close relatives in this country at that time </s>
<s> she worked as a domestic first in newport for a year and then in south bethlehem pennsylvania for another year </s>
<s> she finally settled in fall river and after being employed for a time by a mrs reed was hired by the bordens </s>
<s> i have previously described how during the week of the murder bridget spent the first few hot days scrubbing and ironing clothes </s>
<s> her father james upton was the upton mentioned by hawthorne in the famous introduction to the scarlet letter as one of those who came into the old custom house to do business with him as the surveyor of the port </s>
<s> a gentleman of the old school mr upton possessed intellectual power ample means and withal was a devoted christian </s>
<s> the daughter profited from his interest in scientific and philosophical subjects </s>
<s> her mother also was a person of superior mind and broad interests </s>
<s> there is clear evidence that lucy from childhood had an unusual mind </s>
<s> she possessed an observant eye a retentive memory and a critical faculty </s>
<s> when she was nine years old she wrote a description of a store she had visited </s>
<s> lucy upton was graduated from the salem high school when few colleges only oberlin and elmira were open to women </s>
<s> and she had an appetite for learning that could not be denied </s>
<s> a picture of her in high school comes from a younger schoolmate albert s flint friend of her brother winslow and later like winslow a noted astronomer </s>
<s> the study of greek was the distinctive mark of boys destined to go to college and lucy upton too expected to go to college and take the full classical course offered to men </s>
<s> but even so lucy could not give up her intellectual pursuits </s>
<s> do you think i might profitably study some of the history you do perhaps two weeks behind you </s>
<s> whatever was the science in the high school course for the time being that was my favorite study </s>
<s> her study of history was persistently pursued </s>
<s> more chapters of guizot </s>
<s> she discussed in her letters to winslow some of the questions that came to her as she studied alone </s>
<s> she played chess with him by postcard </s>
<s> there was another family interest also </s>
<s> winslow had musical talents as had his father before him </s>
<s> at different times he served as glee-club and choir leader and as organist </s>
<s> and it was lucy upton who first started the idea of a regular course in music at spelman college </s>
<s> winslow upton after graduation from brown university and two years of graduate study accepted a position at the harvard observatory </s>
<s> for three years he was connected with the us naval observatory and with the us signal corps </s>
<s> the six expeditions to study eclipses of the sun of which he was a member took him to colorado virginia and california as well as to the south pacific and to russia </s>
<s> lucy was a lively part of the household </s>
<s> moreover she had physical as well as mental vigor </s>
<s> while in washington dc lucy upton held positions in the us census office and in the pension bureau </s>
<s> after the months in europe she returned to boston and became active in church and community life </s>
<s> here was a cause she believed in </s>
<s> she served for a number of years without pay beyond her travel and maintenance </s>
<s> her students have spoken of the exacting standards of scholarship and of manners and conduct she expected and achieved from the students </s>
<s> her great love of flowers and plants and birds </s>
<s> and her close knowledge of individual students </s>
<s> and as graduates gratefully recall she drew on her purse as well </s>
<s> many a student was able to remain at spelman only because of her unobtrusive help </s>
<s> miss upton and miss packard as a matter of fact had many tastes in common </s>
<s> both had eager and inquiring minds </s>
<s> and both believed that intellectual growth must go hand in hand with the development of sturdy character and christian zeal </s>
<s> both loved the out-of-doors including mountain climbing and horseback riding </s>
<s> so strenuous it was physically with its days of horseback riding over rough roads that it seems an amazing feat of endurance for both miss packard and miss upton </s>
<s> yet they thrived on it </s>
<s> such were the qualities of the acting-president of the seminary after the death of miss giles </s>
<s> she noted that no student had been withdrawn through loss of confidence </s>
<s> that the enrollment showed an increase of boarding students as was desired </s>
<s> she urged the importance of more thorough preparation for admission </s>
<s> with the fund in hand the debt on the boilers had been paid </s>
<s> rockefeller and packard halls had been renovated </s>
<s> walks laid </s>
<s> miss upton spoke gratefully of the response of spelman graduates and negro friends in helping to raise the fund and their continuing efforts to raise money for greatly needed current expenses </s>
<s> she spoke also with deep thankfulness of the many individuals and agencies whose interest and efforts through the years had made the work so fruitful in results </s>
<s> the daughters of spelman she said had never known or thought of spelman without her </s>
<s> now the school was indeed bereft </s>
<s> and when school closed she was unable to travel to massachusetts </s>
<s> she remained in atlanta through june and july </s>
<s> she died on august sixth </s>
<s> but she decided to stay at spelman </s>
<s> soon the office work claimed all her time </s>
<s> she was closely associated with the founders in all their trials and hardships </s>
<s> quiet and energetic cheerful and calm she too was a power in the development of the seminary </s>
<s> the books of the school hold a memorial to her </s>
<s> and so do the hearts of students and of teachers </s>
<s> with infinite patience she responded to every call no matter at what cost to herself and to her all went for she was sure to have the needed information or word of cheer </s>
<s> in a few school districts one finds a link between school and job </s>
<s> in those vocational programs organized with smith-hughes money there may be a close tie between the labor union and a local employer on the one hand and the vocational teacher on the other </s>
<s> the apprentice program will involve further education on a part-time basis usually at night perhaps using some of the same equipment of the high school </s>
<s> these opportunities are to be found in certain cities in such crafts as auto mechanics carpentry drafting electrical work tool-and-die work and sheet-metal work </s>
<s> formally organized vocational programs supported by federal funds allow high school students to gain experience in a field of work which is likely to lead to a full-time job on graduation </s>
<s> in both cases the student attends school half-time and works in a regular job the other half </s>
<s> he receives remuneration for his work </s>
<s> in a few places cooperative programs between schools and employers in clerical work have shown the same possibilities for allowing the student while still in school to develop skills which are immediately marketable upon graduation </s>
<s> in general however it may be said that when a boy or a girl leaves the high school the school authorities play little or no part in the decision of what happens next </s>
<s> if the student drops out of high school the break with the school is even more complete </s>
<s> indeed in some periods of our history and in some neighborhoods the job opportunities have been so good that undoubtedly a great many boys who were potential members of the professions quit school at an early age and went to work </s>
<s> statistically this has represented a loss to the nation although one must admit that in an individual case the decision in retrospect may have been a wise one </s>
<s> i make no attempt to measure the enduring satisfaction and material well-being of a man who went to work on graduation from high school and was highly successful in the business which he entered </s>
<s> but in the next decades the nation needs to educate for the professions all the potential professional talent </s>
<s> in a later chapter dealing with the suburban school i shall discuss the importance of arranging a program for the academically talented and highly gifted youth in any high school where he is found </s>
<s> in the negro neighborhoods and also to some extent in the mixed neighborhoods the problem may be one of identification and motivation </s>
<s> undoubtedly far more can be done in the lower grades in this regard in the negro schools </s>
<s> however the teacher can only go so far if the attitude of the community and the family is anti-intellectual </s>
<s> and the fact remains that there are today few shining examples of negroes in positions of intellectual leadership </s>
<s> this is not due to any policy of discrimination on the part of the northern universities </s>
<s> quite the contrary as i can testify from personal experience as a former university president </s>
<s> rather we see here another vicious circle </s>
<s> the absence of successful negroes in the world of scholarship and science has tended to tamp down enthusiasm among negro youth for academic careers </s>
<s> i believe the situation is improving but the success stories need to be heavily publicized </s>
<s> here again we run into the roadblock that negroes do not like to be designated as negroes in the press </s>
<s> this is a problem to which leaders of opinion both negro and white should devote far more attention </s>
<s> it is at least as important as the more dramatic attempts to break down barriers of inequality in the south </s>
<s> vocational education </s>
<s> i should like to underline four points i made in my first report with respect to vocational education </s>
<s> first and foremost vocational courses should not replace courses which are essential parts of the required academic program for graduation </s>
<s> however for slow learners and prospective dropouts these courses ought to begin earlier </s>
<s> third the significance of the vocational courses is that those enrolled are keenly interested in the work </s>
<s> they realize the relevance of what they are learning to their future careers and this sense of purpose is carried over to the academic courses which they are studying at the same time </s>
<s> fourth the type of vocational training programs should be related to the employment opportunities in the general locality </s>
<s> this last point is important because if high school pupils are aware that few if any graduates who have chosen a certain vocational program have obtained a job as a consequence of the training the whole idea of relevance disappears </s>
<s> those who because of population mobility and the reputed desire of employers to train their own employees would limit vocational education to general rather than specific skills ought to bear in mind the importance of motivation in any kind of school experience </s>
<s> i intend to include under the term all the practical courses open to boys and girls </s>
<s> practically all of these practical skills are of such a nature that a degree of mastery can be obtained in high school sufficient to enable the youth to get a job at once on the basis of the skill </s>
<s> they are in this sense skills marketable immediately on graduation from high school </s>
<s> to be sure in tool-and-die work and in the building trades the first job must be often on an apprentice basis but two years of half-time vocational training enables the young man thus to anticipate one year of apprentice status </s>
<s> similarly a girl who graduates with a good working knowledge of stenography and the use of clerical machines and who is able to get a job at once may wish to improve her skill and knowledge by a year or two of further study in a community college or secretarial school </s>
<s> of course it can be argued that an ability to write english correctly and with some degree of elegance is a marketable skill </s>
<s> so too is the mathematical competence of a college graduate who has majored in mathematics </s>
<s> in spite of the shading of one type of course into another i believe it is useful to talk about vocational courses as apart from academic courses </s>
<s> perhaps a course in typewriting might be regarded as the exception which proves the rule </s>
<s> today many college bound students try to take a course in personal typing as they feel a certain degree of mastery of this skill is almost essential for one who proposes to do academic work in college and a professional school </s>
<s> most of our largest cities have one or more separate vocational or technical high schools </s>
<s> in this respect public education in the large cities differs from education in the smaller cities and consolidated school districts </s>
<s> the neighborhood high schools are not strictly speaking comprehensive schools because some of the boys and girls may be attending a vocational or technical high school instead of the local school </s>
<s> indeed one school superintendent in a large city objects to the use of the term comprehensive high school for the senior high schools in his city because these schools do not offer strictly vocational programs </s>
<s> the suburban high school it is worth noting also is not a widely comprehensive high school because of the absence of vocational programs </s>
<s> the reason is that there is a lack of interest on the part of the community </s>
<s> therefore employment and education in all the schools in a metropolitan area are related in different ways from those which are characteristic of the comprehensive high school described in my first report </s>
<s> the separate vocational or technical high schools in the large cities must be reckoned as permanent institutions </s>
<s> by and large their programs are satisfactorily connected both to the employment situation and to the realities of the apprentice system </s>
<s> it is not often realized to what degree certain trades are in many communities closed areas of employment except for a lucky few </s>
<s> it is far more difficult in many communities to obtain admission to an apprentice program which involves union approval than to get into the most selective medical school in the nation </s>
<s> two stories will illustrate what i have in mind </s>
<s> one vocational instructor in a city vocational school speaking of his course in a certain field said he had no difficulty placing all students in jobs outside of the city </s>
<s> in a far distant part of the united states i was talking to an instructor about a boy who in the twelfth grade was doing special work </s>
<s> i asked </s>
<s> in my view there should be a school which offers significant vocational programs for boys within easy reach of every family in a city </s>
<s> ideally these schools should be so located that one or more should be in the area where demand for practical courses is at the highest </s>
<s> an excellent example of a successful location of a new vocational high school is the dunbar vocational high school in chicago </s>
<s> located in a bad slum area now undergoing redevelopment this school and its program are especially tailored to the vocational aims of its students </s>
<s> i discovered in the course of a visit there that almost all the pupils were negroes </s>
<s> they were learning trades as diverse as shoe repairing bricklaying carpentry cabinet making auto mechanics and airplane mechanics </s>
<s> the physical facilities at dunbar are impressive but more impressive is the attitude of the pupils </s>
<s> the soybean seed is the most important leguminous food in the world </s>
<s> in the united states where half of the world crop is grown soybeans are processed for their edible oil </s>
<s> the residue from soybean processing goes mainly into animal feeds </s>
<s> soybeans are extensively processed into a remarkable number of food products in the orient </s>
<s> american chemists seeking to increase exports of soybeans have adapted modern techniques and fermentation methods to improve their use in such traditional japanese foods as tofu and miso and in tempeh of indonesia </s>
<s> they are used mainly for their oil </s>
<s> we produce peanut oil but to a much greater extent we eat the entire seed </s>
<s> blanched peanuts as prepared for making peanut butter or for eating as nuts are roasted seeds whose seedcoats have been rubbed off </s>
<s> cereal grains supplemented with soybeans or dry edible peas or beans comprise about two-thirds or three-fourths of the diet in parts of asia and africa </s>
<s> in western europe and north america where the level of economic development is higher grains and other seed products furnish less than one-third of the food consumed </s>
<s> rather meat and potatoes sugar and dairy products are the main sources of carbohydrate protein oils and fats </s>
<s> people depend less on seeds for foods in australia new zealand and argentina where extensive grazing lands support sheep or cattle and the consumption of meat is high </s>
<s> most of the grain is fed to swine and dairy cows and lesser amounts to beef cattle and poultry </s>
<s> the rest is used for human food and industrial products </s>
<s> more than half of the sorghum and barley seeds we produce and most of the byproducts of the milling of cereals and the crushing of oilseeds are fed to livestock </s>
<s> the demand for food is so great in the world that little arable land can be given over to growing the nonfood crops </s>
<s> seeds grown for industrial uses hold a relatively minor position </s>
<s> oils or liquid fats from the seeds of flax and tung have long been the principal constituents of paints and varnishes for protecting and beautifying the surfaces of wood and metal </s>
<s> these oils develop hard smooth films when they dry and form resinlike substances </s>
<s> the artist who paints in oil uses drying oils to carry the pigments and to protect his finished work for the ages </s>
<s> one of the finest of artists oils comes from poppy seeds </s>
<s> seeds of soybean cotton corn sesame and rape yield semidrying oils </s>
<s> some are used in paints along with drying oils </s>
<s> palm oil protects the surfaces of steel sheets before they are plated with tin </s>
<s> castor oil made from castorbeans has gone out of style as a medicine </s>
<s> this nondrying oil however is now more in demand than ever before as a fine lubricant as a constituent of fluids for hydraulically operated equipment and as a source of chemicals to make plastics </s>
<s> almond oil another nondrying oil was once used extensively in perfumery to extract flower fragrances </s>
<s> it is still used in drugs and cosmetics but it is rather scarce and sometimes is adulterated with oils from peach and plum seeds </s>
<s> liquid fats from all these oilseeds enter into the manufacture of soaps for industry and the household and of glycerin for such industrial uses as making explosives </s>
<s> solid fats from the seeds of the mahua tree the shea tree and the coconut palm are used to make candles in tropical countries </s>
<s> seeds are a main source of starch for industrial and food use in many parts of the world </s>
<s> corn and wheat supply most of the starch in the united states canada and australia </s>
<s> in other countries where cereal grains are not among the principal crops of a region starchy tubers or roots are processed for starch </s>
<s> starch is used in the paper textile and food-processing industries and in a multitude of other manufacturing operations </s>
<s> the discovery during the second world war that guar gum was similar to imported locust gum increased its cultivation in western asia and initiated it in the united states </s>
<s> water-soluble gums are used in foods and drugs and in the manufacture of pulp and paper as thickeners stabilizers or dispersing agents </s>
<s> guar gum thickens salad dressings and stabilizes ice cream </s>
<s> quince seed gum is the main ingredient in wave-setting lotions </s>
<s> locust gum is added to pulp slurries to break up the lumps of fibers in making paper </s>
<s> the seeds of hard fibrous stony fruits called nuts provide highly concentrated foods oils and other materials of value </s>
<s> the kernels of brazil nuts cashews coconuts filberts hazelnuts hickory nuts pecans walnuts and pine nuts are predominantly oily </s>
<s> almonds and pistachio nuts are not so high in oil but are rich in protein </s>
<s> chestnuts are starchy </s>
<s> all nut kernels are rich in protein </s>
<s> coconuts the fruit of the coconut palm have the largest of all known seeds and are grown in south pacific islands as a crop for domestic and export markets </s>
<s> the oil palm of west africa yields edible oil from both the flesh and the seed or kernel of its fruit </s>
<s> other nuts consumed in lesser quantity include the spicy nutmeg </s>
<s> the soap nut which owes its sudsing power to natural saponins </s>
<s> the marking nut used for ink and varnish </s>
<s> the aromatic sassafras nut of south america </s>
<s> and the sweet-smelling cumara nut which is suited for perfumes </s>
<s> a forest crop that has not been extensively cultivated is ivory nuts from the tagua palm </s>
<s> the so-called vegetable ivory is the hard endosperm of the egg-sized seed </s>
<s> it is used for making buttons and other small hard objects of turnery </s>
<s> seeds of the sago palm are used in bermuda to make heads and faces of dolls sold to tourists </s>
<s> the color and shape of seeds have long made them attractive for ornaments and decorations </s>
<s> bead tree seeds are the necklaces of south pacific islanders and the eyes of buddha dolls in cuba </s>
<s> victorian ladies had a fad of stringing unusual seeds to wear as jewelry </s>
<s> handmade christmas wreaths and trees often contain a variety of seeds collected during the year </s>
<s> tradition has assigned medicinal values to seeds because of their alkaloids aromatic oils and highly flavored components </s>
<s> although science has given us more effective materials preparations from anise castorbean colchicum nux vomica mustard fennel and stramonium are familiar to many for the relief of human ailments </s>
<s> flaxseed poultices and mustard plasters still are used by some persons </s>
<s> peanut and sesame oils often are used as carriers or diluents for medicines administered by injection </s>
<s> the common spices flavorings and condiments make up this group </s>
<s> each year millions of pounds of anise caraway mustard celery and coriander and the oils extracted from them are imported </s>
<s> single-seeded dry fruits used for flavoring include several of the carrot family such as cumin dill fennel and angelica </s>
<s> white pepper is the ground seed of the common black pepper fruit </s>
<s> sesame seed which comes from the tall pods of a plant grown in egypt brazil and central america has a toasted-nut flavor and can be used in almost any dish calling for almonds </s>
<s> it is a main flavoring for halvah the candy of the middle east </s>
<s> sesame sticks a snack dip originated in the southwest </s>
<s> beverages are made from seeds the world over </s>
<s> coffee is made from the roasted and ground seeds of the coffee tree </s>
<s> cocoa chocolate and cocoa butter come from the ground seeds of the cacao tree </s>
<s> several soft drinks contain extracts from kola nuts the seed of the kola tree cultivated in the west indies and south america </s>
<s> cereal grains have been used for centuries to prepare fermented beverages </s>
<s> the japanese sake is wine fermented from rice grain </s>
<s> arrack is distilled from fermented rice in india </s>
<s> beer generally fermented from barley is an old alcoholic beverage </s>
<s> brewers today use corn rice and malted barley </s>
<s> distillers use corn malt wheat grain sorghum and rye in making beverage alcohol </s>
<s> seed crops hold a prominent place in the agricultural economy of the united states </s>
<s> hay and pasture are the other chief sources of livestock feed </s>
<s> seeds are the essential raw materials for milling grain baking crushing oilseed refining edible oil brewing distilling and mixing feed </s>
<s> not included was the value of seed oil in paints and varnishes or the value of the coffee and chocolate industries that are based on imported seed or seed products </s>

<s> cattle were inclined to remain in a territory with which they were acquainted </s>

<s> the missionary obligation to proclaim the gospel to all the world was once left to zealous individuals and voluntary societies </s>
<s> but the time came when a church that had no part in the missionary movement was looked upon as deficient in its essential life </s>
<s> the christian education of children too was once hardly more than a sideshow but the day came when a congregation that did not assume full oversight of a church school was thought of as failing in its duty </s>
<s> the most serious weakness of the ecumenical movement today is that it is generally regarded as the responsibility of a few national leaders in each denomination and a few interdenominational executives </s>
<s> most pastors and laymen even though they believe it to be important assume that the ecumenical movement lies outside the province of their parishes </s>
<s> as long as this point of view prevails the ecumenical movement will be lame and halt </s>
<s> the next stage ahead is that of making it thoroughly at home in the local community </s>
<s> the front line of advance is where witnessing and worshiping congregations of different traditions exist side by side </s>
<s> until they see the ecumenical movement in terms of the difference it makes in their own attitudes programs and relationships it will have an inevitable aspect of unreality </s>
<s> as things now stand there is a grievous disparity between the unity in christ which we profess in ecumenical meetings and the complacent separateness of most congregations on any main street in the nation </s>
<s> the ecumenical congregation </s>
<s> the crux of ecumenical advance is an even more personalized matter than the relation between congregations in the same community </s>
<s> the decisive question is what happens within each congregation and finally in the minds and hearts of the individual members </s>
<s> it is here that the local and ecumenical must meet </s>
<s> it is here that the ecumenical must become local and the local become ecumenical </s>
<s> this way of describing the matter is unfortunate </s>
<s> it implies two misconceptions </s>
<s> the truth however is that the ecumenical church is just the local church in its own true character as an integral unit of the whole people of god throughout the world </s>
<s> the other misconception is that our ecumenical problems will be solved if only the knowledge of the church in its world-wide extension and its interdenominational connections now comprehended by many national leaders can be communicated to all congregations </s>
<s> however needed this may be the fundamental problem is not information but active commitment to the total mission of the church of christ in the world </s>
<s> the basic unit in the church of whatever denominational polity is always the congregation </s>
<s> it is hardly possible to emphasize this too much </s>
<s> most people do not realize that the congregation as a gathered fellowship meeting regularly face to face personally sharing in a common experience and expressing that experience in daily relationships with one another is unique </s>
<s> the idea that it is a feature of all religions is entirely mistaken </s>
<s> the jewish synagogue affords a parallel to the christian congregation but hinduism buddhism islam confucianism taoism shintoism although they have sacred scriptures priests spiritual disciplines and places of prayer do not have a congregation as a local household of faith and love </s>
<s> their characteristic experience is that of the individual at an altar or a shrine rather than that of a continuing social group with a distinctive kind of fellowship </s>
<s> how far the fellowship in most local churches falls below what the new testament means by koinonia </s>
<s> what is now called christian fellowship is often little more than the social chumminess of having a gracious time with the kind of people one likes </s>
<s> the koinonia of acts and of the epistles means sharing in a common relation to christ </s>
<s> it is an experience of a new depth of community derived from an awareness of the corporate indwelling of christ in his people </s>
<s> this may mean having fellowship in the church with people with whom on the level of merely human agreeableness we might prefer not to have any association at all </s>
<s> there is a vast difference between the community of reconciliation which the new testament describes and the community of congeniality found in the average church building </s>
<s> whenever a congregation really sees itself as a unit in the universal church in vital relation with the whole body of christ and participating in his mission to the world a necessary foundation-stone of the ecumenical movement has been laid </s>
<s> the antithesis of the ecumenical and the local then no longer exists </s>
<s> the local and the ecumenical are one </s>
<s> of course the perspective of those who are dealing directly with the world-wide problems of the people of god will always be different from the perspective of those who are dealing with the nearby problems of particular persons in a particular place </s>
<s> each viewpoint is valid if it is organically related to the other </s>
<s> neither is adequate if it stands alone </s>
<s> our difficulty arises when either viewpoint shuts out the other </s>
<s> and this is what all too often happens </s>
<s> divergent perspectives </s>

<s> as things stand now the local and the ecumenical tend to compete with each other </s>
<s> on the one hand there are ecumenists who are so stirred by the crises of the church in its encounter with the world at large that they have no eyes for what the church is doing in their own town </s>
<s> they do not escape the pitfall into which charles dickens pictured mrs jellyby as falling </s>
<s> her concern for the natives of borrioboola-gha was so intense that she quite forgot and neglected her son peepy </s>
<s> likewise the ecumenist may become so absorbed in the conflict of the church with the totalitarian state in east germany the precarious situation of the church in revolutionary china and the anguish of the church over apartheid in south africa that he loses close contact with the parish church in its unspectacular but indispensable ministry of worship pastoral service and counseling and christian nurture for a face-to-face group of individuals </s>
<s> on the other hand many a pastor is so absorbed in ministering to the intimate personal needs of individuals in his congregation that he does little or nothing to lead them into a sense of social responsibility and world mission </s>
<s> as a result they go on thinking of the church with introverted and self-centered satisfaction only in connection with the way in which it serves them and their families </s>
<s> the parish lives for itself rather than for the community or the world </s>
<s> the gap between the ecumenical perspective and the parish perspective appears most starkly in a church in any of our comfortable suburbs </s>
<s> it is eminently successful according to all conventional standards </s>
<s> it is growing in numbers </s>
<s> its people are agreeable friends </s>
<s> it has a beautiful edifice </s>
<s> its preaching and its music give refreshment of spirit to men and women living under heavy strain </s>
<s> it provides pastoral care for the sick and troubled </s>
<s> it helps children grow up with at least a nodding acquaintance with the bible </s>
<s> it draws young people into the circle of those who continue the life of the church from generation to generation </s>
<s> and it is easy for the ecumenical enthusiast to lose sight of how basic all this is </s>
<s> all too often its conception of parish ministry and pastoral care includes no responsibility for them in their relation to issues of the most desperate urgency for the life of mankind </s>
<s> it is not stirring them to confront the racial tensions of today with the mind of christ </s>
<s> it is not helping them face the moral crisis involved in the use of nuclear energy </s>
<s> it is not making them sensitive to the sub-christian level of much of our economic and industrial life </s>
<s> it is raising no disturbing question as to what christian stewardship means for the relationship of the richest nation in the world to economically underdeveloped peoples </s>
<s> it is not developing an awareness of the new kind of missionary strategy that is called for as young churches emerge in asia and africa </s>
<s> to put it bluntly many a local church is giving its members only what they consciously want </s>
<s> it is not disturbing them by thoughts of their christian responsibility in relation to the world </s>
<s> we shall not make a decisive advance in the ecumenical movement until such a church begins to see itself not merely as a haven of comfort and peace but as a base of christian witness and mission to the world </s>

<s> our discussion does not utilize all the identity crises postulated by erikson but is intended to demonstrate the utility of his theoretical schema for studying unwed mothers </s>
<s> we hope thereby to emphasize that from a psychological standpoint the effectual prevention of illegitimacy is a continuous long-term process involving the socialization of the female from infancy through adolescence </s>
<s> the adolescent experiences identity crises in terms of time perspective vs time diffusion </s>
<s> experience of this time diffusion ranges from a sense of utter apathy to a feeling of desperate urgency to act immediately </s>
<s> these polar extremes in time diffusion were indicated in some of the comments by unwed mothers reported in earlier chapters </s>
<s> some of these mothers apparently feeling a desperate urgency made on the spur of the moment commitments in love and sex that would have life-long consequences </s>
<s> others displayed utter apathy and indifference to any decision about the past or the future </s>
<s> for many of these unwed mothers the data on their family life and early childhood experiences revealed several indications and sources of their basic mistrust of their parents in particular and of the world in general </s>
<s> the adolescent experiences two closely related crises self-certainty vs an identity consciousness </s>
<s> and role-experimentation vs negative identity </s>
<s> however if the child has been constantly surrounded during nursery and early school age by peer groups </s>
<s> inculcated with the primacy of group acceptance and group standards </s>
<s> her ostensible indifference to and rebellion against suggestions and criticisms by anyone except peer friends during adolescence are the manifestations in her adolescence of her having been indoctrinated in childhood to feel shame if not guilt for failing to behave in a manner acceptable to and judged by the performance of her nursery- and elementary-school peer friends </s>
<s> to be different is to invite shame and doubt </s>
<s> many appeared to regard their sexual behavior as a justifiable means of gaining acceptance from and identification with others </s>
<s> another identity crisis confronting the adolescent involves anticipation of achievement vs work-paralysis </s>
<s> these childhood experiences are sources of the self-certainty that the adolescent needs for experimenting with many roles and for the freedom to fail sometimes in the process of exploring and discovering her skills and abilities </s>
<s> whether to stay financially dependent on her parents or help support herself while attending school </s>
<s> whether to pursue a college education or a job after high school </s>
<s> and whether to attend this or that college and to follow this or that course of study </s>
<s> and in the fact that she bases her decisions about work college carreer and studies on what others are doing rather than on her own sense of identity with given skills abilities likes and dislikes </s>
<s> they attended school and selected courses primarily on the basis of decisions others made </s>
<s> they accepted a job primarily because it was available convenient and paid reasonably </s>
<s> these things both express and at the same time continue contributing to their identity diffusion in an area that could have become a source of developing dignity and self-certainty </s>
<s> as their identity diffusion increased they became more susceptible to sporadic diversions in love and sexual affairs </s>
<s> these affairs temporarily relieved the monotony of school or work activities containing no anticipation of achievement and joy of craftsmanship no sense of dignity derived from a job well done </s>
<s> childhood experiences in learning work and self-discipline habits within a context of developing autonomy and initiative have considerable significance for the prevention of illegitimacy </s>
<s> the excerpts from case histories presented above confirm this significance though through different facets of experience </s>
<s> for example some unwed mothers had had no work experiences household chores and responsibilities during childhood and early adolescence </s>
<s> they subsequently occupied their leisure hours in searching for something exciting and diverting </s>
<s> sex was both </s>
<s> the adolescent also faces the identity crisis that erikson has termed ideological polarization vs diffusion of ideals </s>
<s> this tendency is perhaps most clearly revealed in the literature on religious conversions and experiences of adolescents </s>
<s> the positive development during adolescence of this capacity to think and to feel strongly and with increasing independence and to identify overtly either with or against given ideas values and practices depends to a considerable degree on both previous and present opportunities for developing autonomy initiative and self-certainty </s>
<s> most adolescents have some ideological diffusion at various developmental stages as they experience a proliferation of ideas and values </s>
<s> the diffusion is most pronounced and most likely to become fixed however in those who have had no or very minimal opportunities to develop the autonomy and initiative that could have been directed into constructive expression and so served as sources of developing self-certainty </s>
<s> it is mirrored by the individual willie lohmans whose ideas and behavior patterns are so dependent and relativistic that they always coincide with those of the individual or group present and most important at the moment </s>

<s> they condemned the movie script writers for implying that sex was enjoyable and exhilarating </s>
<s> they criticized parents for never having emphasized traditional concepts of right and wrong </s>

<s> an estimate of one million dollars is probably not excessive </s>
<s> yet the huge amount of money consumed by the selden litigation which many regarded as wasteful indirectly contributed to constructive changes in legal procedure </s>
<s> the duration and other circumstances of the selden case made it a flagrant example of the gross abuses of patent infringement actions </s>
<s> the suit as we have seen came before the courts when patent attorneys inventors and laymen were making mounting demands for reforms in the american patent system </s>
<s> chief among the defects they singled out were the complicated and wearisome procedures in equity </s>
<s> in a long and angry footnote to his opinion judge hough had lent the weight of judicial condemnation to such criticism </s>
<s> he cited the elephantine dimensions of the selden case record </s>
<s> the duplication of testimony and exhibits </s>
<s> the numerous squabbles over minor matters </s>
<s> not least among the members of the patent bar who echoed this powerful indictment were those who had participated in the selden suit </s>
<s> william a redding asserted that if the case had been heard in open court under rules of evidence the testimony would have been completed in sixty days instead of five years </s>
<s> its costive deliberations were likened to those of the british courts of chancery mercilessly caricatured by dickens in bleak house </s>
<s> parker who agreed with much of this criticism did not conceal his dissatisfaction with procedural defects </s>
<s> but he felt that the selden case was being unfairly pilloried </s>
<s> the suit although commonly designated as a single action actually embraced five cases </s>
<s> parker insisted that the size of the record would have been drastically reduced but for an unavoidable duplication of testimony </s>
<s> parker listed the remedies he deemed essential for reducing the cost and mass of testimony </s>
<s> parker called for abolition of the indiscriminate or uncontrolled right of taking depositions before officers of the court who had no authority to limit testimony </s>
<s> the taking of depositions he suggested should be placed under a special court examiner empowered to compel responsive and relevant answers and to exclude immaterial testimony </s>
<s> the revised procedure was acclaimed as a long-overdue reform </s>
<s> under the new rules testimony is taken orally in open court in all cases except those of an extraordinary character </s>
<s> other expeditious methods are designed to prevent prolixity limit delays and reduce the expense of infringement suits </s>
<s> while patent suits are still among the most complex and expensive forms of litigation these rules have saved litigants uncounted sums of money </s>
<s> there is little doubt that they were promulgated by the supreme court as a direct result of the selden patent suit </s>
<s> the trade bodies which came in the wake of the alam were more representative for they never adopted a policy of exclusion </s>
<s> nevertheless it is from the selden organization that the industry inherited its institutional machinery for furthering the broader interests of the trade </s>
<s> one of the chief features of this community of interest is the automotive patents cross-licensing agreement a milestone in the development of american industrial cooperation </s>
<s> its origin lies in the selden patent controversy and its aftermath </s>
<s> from the earliest days of the motor car industry before the alam was established patent infringement loomed as a serious and vexing problem </s>
<s> many patent contests were waged over automobile components and accessories among them tires detachable rims ball bearings license brackets and electric horns </s>
<s> the fluidity and momentum of the young industry abetted a general disregard of patent claims </s>
<s> in this tangle of conflicting claims the patent-sharing scheme adopted by the alam at its founding proved to be the best device for avoiding or mitigating the burdens of incessant litigation </s>
<s> one of the conditions of the pool was a prohibition upon the withholding of patent rights among alam members </s>
<s> within its limits this arrangement had the actual or potential characteristics of a cross-licensing agreement </s>
<s> its positive features outweighed the fact that the pool was an adjunct of a wouldbe monopoly </s>
<s> since the alam holdings embraced only about twenty-five per cent of motor vehicle patents the denial of rights to independent companies did not retard technical progress in unlicensed sectors of the industry </s>
<s> the highly important dyer patents on the sliding gear transmission were held by the alam pool </s>
<s> it was commonplace for auto makers parts-suppliers and dealers to find warning notices and threats of infringement suits in their daily mail </s>
<s> occasionally new enterprise was discouraged by the almost certain prospect of legal complications </s>
<s> by that time it was commonly agreed that patent warfare was sapping constructive achievement and blocking the free exchange of technical information </s>
<s> at this point charles c hanch long an advocate of patent peace in the industry became chairman of the patents committee of the national automobile chamber of commerce successor to the automobile board of trade </s>
<s> the breach created by the selden patent doomed his proposal but hanch did not abandon his scheme </s>
<s> after the demise of the alam the time was propitious for establishing such a pool </s>
<s> most manufacturers were now disposed to heed a proposal for the formal interchange of patents </s>
<s> the plan was supported by frederick p fish counsel for the national automobile chamber of commerce </s>
<s> it will be recalled that in his summation for the alam before judge hough fish had condemned patent litigation as the curse of the american industrial community </s>
<s> he was well aware that some inventors and their allies used their patents solely for nuisance value </s>
<s> the eloquent persuasions of fish guaranteed the adoption of the plan by the members of the automotive trade association </s>
