<s> the trial judge decided that the administrative procedures of the act were fully complied with and refused to require the production of such documents </s>
<s> the court of appeals affirmed </s>
<s> we granted certiorari in view of the importance of the questions in the administration of the act </s>
<s> there followed a customary department of justice hearing at which petitioner appeared </s>
<s> in his report to the attorney general the hearing officer suggested that the petitioner be exempt only from combatant training and service </s>
<s> the appeal board furnished petitioner a copy of the recommendation </s>
<s> upon return of the file to the local board petitioner was again ordered to report for induction and this prosecution followed his failure to do so </s>
<s> but the statement of the local board attributing this claim to petitioner was in his file </s>
<s> he admitted that he knew it was open to him at all times and he could have rebutted it before the hearing officer </s>
<s> this he failed to do asserting that he did not know it to be in his file </s>
<s> apparently he never took the trouble to find out </s>
<s> nevertheless he had ample opportunity to contest the statement before the appeal board </s>
<s> after the recommendation of the department is forwarded to the appeal board that is the appropriate place for a registrant to lodge his denial </s>
<s> this he did </s>
<s> we found in gonzales v united states supra that this was the controlling reason why copies of the recommendation should be furnished a registrant </s>
<s> but there are other contentions which might be considered more difficult </s>
<s> petitioner also claimed at trial the right to inspect the original federal bureau of investigation reports to the department of justice </s>
<s> he alleged no specific procedural errors or evidence withheld </s>
<s> nor did he elaborate just what favorable evidence the federal bureau of investigation reports might disclose </s>
<s> gonzales v united states supra </s>
<s> it is not essentially different from a memorandum of an attorney in the department of justice of which the attorney general receives many and to which he may give his approval or rejection </s>
<s> it is but part of the whole process within the department that goes into the making of the final recommendation to the appeal board </s>
<s> hence the petitioner had full opportunity to traverse the only conclusions of the department on file with the board </s>
<s> having had every opportunity to rebut the finding of the local board before both the hearing officer and the appeal board petitioner cannot now claim that he was denied due process because he did not succeed </s>
<s> in addition petitioner has failed to show any particular need for the report and notes </s>
<s> moreover his testimony at trial never developed any such facts </s>
<s> finally petitioner says that he was entitled to inspect the fbi report during the proceedings before the hearing officer as well as at the trial </s>
<s> even now no such claim is asserted </s>
<s> he bases his present contention on the general right to explore indicating that he hopes to find some discrepancy in the resume </s>
<s> but this is fully answered by united states v nugent supra </s>
<s> even if we were not bound by nugent petitioner here would not be entitled to the report </s>
<s> foreign policy in its total context </s>
<s> with this enlarged role in mind i should like to make a few suggestions what we in the united states do or do not do will make a very large difference in what happens in the rest of the world </s>
<s> we in this department must think about foreign policy in its total context </s>
<s> we cannot regard foreign policy as something left over after defense policy or trade policy or fiscal policy has been extracted </s>
<s> foreign policy is the total involvement of the american people with peoples and governments abroad </s>
<s> that means that if we are to achieve a new standard of leadership we must think in terms of the total context of our situation </s>
<s> assistant secretaries of state will now carry an increased burden of active formulation and coordination of policies </s>
<s> means must be found to enable us to keep in touch as regularly and as efficiently as possible with our colleagues in other departments concerned with foreign policy </s>
<s> i think we need to concern ourselves also with the timeliness of action </s>
<s> every policy officer cannot help but be a planning officer </s>
<s> unless we keep our eyes on the horizon ahead we shall fail to bring ourselves on target with the present </s>
<s> the movement of events is so fast the pace so severe that an attempt to peer into the future is essential if we are to think accurately about the present </s>
<s> if there is anything which we can do in the executive branch of the government to speed up the processes by which we come to decisions on matters on which we must act promptly that in itself would be a major contribution to the conduct of our affairs </s>
<s> action taken today is often far more valuable than action taken several months later in response to a situation then out of control </s>
<s> there will of course be times for delay and inaction </s>
<s> what i am suggesting is that when we delay or when we fail to act we do so intentionally and not through inadvertence or through bureaucratic or procedural difficulties </s>
<s> we want to stimulate ideas from the bottom to the top of the department </s>
<s> we want to make sure that our junior colleagues realize that ideas are welcome that initiative goes right down to the bottom and goes all the way to the top </s>
<s> i hope no one expects that only presidential appointees are looked upon as sources of ideas </s>
<s> the responsibility for taking the initiative in generating ideas is that of every officer in the department who has a policy function regardless of rank </s>
<s> further i would hope that we could pay attention to little things </s>
<s> while observing the operations of our government in various parts of the world i have felt that in many situations where our policies were good we have tended to ignore minor problems which spoiled our main effort </s>
<s> to cite only a few examples the wrong man in the wrong position perhaps even in a junior position abroad can be a source of great harm to our policy </s>
<s> the attitudes of a un delegate who experiences difficulty in finding adequate housing in new york city or of a foreign diplomat in similar circumstances in our capital can easily be directed against the united states and all that it stands for </s>
<s> dozens of seemingly small matters go wrong all over the world </s>
<s> sometimes those who know about them are too far down the line to be able to do anything about them </s>
<s> i would hope that we could create the recognition in the department and overseas that those who come across little things going wrong have the responsibility for bringing these to the attention of those who can do something about them </s>
<s> if the department of state is to take primary responsibility for foreign policy in washington it follows that the ambassador is expected to take charge overseas </s>
<s> this does not mean in a purely bureaucratic sense but in an active operational interested responsible fashion </s>
<s> he is expected to know about what is going on among the representatives of other agencies who are stationed in his country </s>
<s> he is expected to supervise to encourage to direct to assist in any way he can </s>
<s> if any official operation abroad begins to go wrong we shall look to the ambassador to find out why and to get suggestions for remedial action </s>
<s> the problems of a policy officer </s>
<s> it occurred to me that you might be interested in some thoughts which i expressed privately in recent years in the hope of clearing up a certain confusion in the public mind about what foreign policy is all about and what it means and of developing a certain compassion for those who are carrying such responsibilities inside government </s>
<s> i tried to do so by calling to their attention some of the problems that a senior departmental policy officer faces </s>
<s> this means practically everybody in this room </s>
<s> whether it will strike home for you or not will be for you to determine </s>
<s> the senior policy officer may be moved to think hard about a problem by any of an infinite variety of stimuli an idea in his own head the suggestions of a colleague a question from the secretary or the president a proposal by another department a communication from a foreign government or an american ambassador abroad the filing of an item for the agenda of the united nations or of any other of dozens of international bodies a news item read at the breakfast table a question to the president or the secretary at a news conference a speech by a senator or congressman an article in a periodical a resolution from a national organization a request for assistance from some private american interests abroad et cetera ad infinitum </s>
<s> the policy officer lives with his antennae alerted for the questions which fall within his range of responsibility </s>
<s> meanwhile he has been thinking about the facts surrounding the problem facts which he knows can never be complete and the general background much of which has already been lost to history </s>
<s> he is appreciative of the expert help available to him and draws these resources into play taking care to examine at least some of the raw material which underlies their frequently policy-oriented conclusions </s>
<s> he knows that he must give the expert his place but he knows that he must also keep him in it </s>
<s> he is already beginning to box the compass of alternative lines of action including doing nothing </s>
<s> he knows that he is thinking about action in relation to a future which can be perceived but dimly through a merciful fog </s>
<s> but he takes his bearings from the great guidelines of policy well-established precedents the commitments of the united states under international charters and treaties basic statutes and well-understood notions of the american people about how we are to conduct ourselves in policy literature such as country papers and national security council papers accumulated in the department </s>
<s> he will not be surprised to find that general principles produce conflicting results in the factual situation with which he is confronted </s>
<s> he must think about which of these principles must take precedence </s>
<s> he will know that general policy papers written months before may not fit his problem because of crucial changes in circumstance </s>
<s> he is aware that every moderately important problem merges imperceptibly into every other problem </s>
<s> he must think of others who have a stake in the question and in its answer </s>
<s> the selection of the wrong tools can mean waste at best and at worst an unwanted inflammation of the problem itself </s>
<s> for if so the path leads through a complex process of parliamentary diplomacy which adds still another dimension to the problem </s>
<s> respect for the opinions of mankind </s>
<s> for the policy officer will know that action can almost never be secret and that in general the effectiveness of policy will be conditioned by the readiness of the country to sustain it </s>
<s> he is interested in public opinion for two reasons first because it is important in itself and second because he knows that the american public cares about a decent respect for the opinions of mankind </s>
<s> we do not want policy officers below the level of presidential appointees to concern themselves too much with problems of domestic politics in recommending foreign policy action </s>
<s> in the first place our business is foreign policy and it is the business of the presidential leadership and his appointees in the department to consider the domestic political aspects of a problem </s>
<s> this is an important consideration </s>
<s> if we sit here reading editorials and looking at public-opinion polls and other reports that cross our desks we should realize that this is raw undigested opinion expressed in the absence of leadership </s>
<s> what the american people will do turns in large degree on their leadership </s>
<s> we cannot test public opinion until the president and the leaders of the country have gone to the public to explain what is required and have asked them for support for the necessary action </s>
<s> and the policy officer has the hounds of time snapping at his heels </s>
<s> while there should be no general age limit or restriction to one sex there will be particular projects requiring special maturity and some open only to men or to women </s>
<s> the peace corps should not pay the expenses of a wife or family unless the wife is also accepted for full-time peace corps work on the same project </s>
<s> there should be no draft exemption because of peace corps service </s>
<s> in most cases service in the corps will probably be considered a ground for temporary deferment </s>
<s> peace corps volunteers obviously should not be paid what they might earn in comparable activities in the united states </s>
<s> nor would it be possible in many cases for them to live in health or any effectiveness on what their counterparts abroad are paid </s>
<s> the guiding principle indeed should not be anything like compensation for individual services </s>
<s> rather the principle should be akin to that of the allowance </s>
<s> peace corps volunteers should be given just enough to provide a minimum decent standard of living </s>
<s> they should live in modest circumstances avoiding all conspicuous consumption </s>
<s> wherever possible they should live with their host country counterparts </s>
<s> some special health requirements might have to be met </s>
<s> for example it probably will be necessary for the corps to have authority to pay medical expenses of volunteers </s>
<s> perhaps existing public health service state department and armed services medical facilities can be utilized </s>
<s> for readjustment to the us volunteers should be given some separation allowance at the end of their overseas service based on the length of time served </s>
<s> the idea of a peace corps has captured the imagination of a great many people </s>
<s> support for it cuts across party regional ethnic and other lines </s>
<s> for this the peace corps should be administered by a small new alive agency operating as one component in our whole overseas operation </s>
<s> pending the reorganization of our foreign aid structure and program the peace corps should be established as an agency in the department of state </s>
<s> when the aid operations are reorganized the peace corps should remain a semi-autonomous functional unit </s>
<s> in this way the peace corps can be launched with its own identity and spirit and yet receive the necessary assistance from those now responsible for united states foreign policy and our overseas operations </s>
<s> nor should we lose the opportunity to use this summer for training on university campuses </s>
<s> if launched in a careful but determined way within the next few weeks the peace corps could have several hundred persons in training this summer for placement next fall </s>
<s> within a year or two several thousand might be in service </s>
<s> it can then grow steadily as it proves itself and as the need for it is demonstrated </s>
<s> in the first year there should probably be considerable emphasis on teaching projects </s>
<s> the need here is most clearly felt and our capacity to recruit and train qualified volunteers in a short period of time is greatest </s>
<s> although the need for outside trained manpower exists in every newly developing nation the readiness to receive such manpower or to receive it from the united states will vary from country to country </s>
<s> a certain skepticism about the coming of americans is to be expected in many quarters </s>
<s> unfriendly political groups will no doubt do everything in their power to promote active hostility </s>
<s> but there are indications that many developing nations will welcome peace corps volunteers and that if the volunteers are well chosen they will soon demonstrate their value and make many friends </s>
<s> it is important however that the peace corps be advanced not as an arm of the cold war but as a contribution to the world community </s>
<s> in presenting it to other governments and to the united nations we could propose that every nation consider the formation of its own peace corps and that the united nations sponsor the idea and form an international coordinating committee </s>
<s> we should hope that peace corps projects will be truly international and that our citizens will find themselves working alongside citizens of the host country and also volunteers from other lands </s>
<s> in any case our peace corps personnel should be offered as technician helpers in development projects of the un and other international agencies </s>
<s> the peace corps is not a diplomatic or propaganda venture but a genuine experiment in international partnership </s>
<s> our aim must be to learn as much as we teach </s>
<s> the peace corps offers an opportunity to bring home to the united states the problems of the world as well as an opportunity to meet urgent host country needs for trained manpower </s>
<s> if presented in this spirit the response and the results will be immeasurably better </s>
<s> if it is decided to make a small shift which may be required from military aid or special assistance funds in order to carry out the purposes of the mutual security act through this new peaceful program this will be a hopeful sign to the world </s>
<s> congress should then be asked to give the peace corps a firm legislative foundation for the next fiscal year </s>
<s> specifically congress should consider authorizing the peace corps to receive contributions from american businesses unions civic organizations and the public at large </s>
<s> for this must be the project of the whole american people </s>
<s> an advisory council of outstanding public figures with experience in world affairs should be formed to give the program continuing guidance and to afford a focal point for public understanding </s>
<s> the extent to which participating bodies such as u s voluntary agencies universities international organizations and the host country or institutions in the host country can and should share the cost of the peace corps programs must be fully explored </s>
<s> no matter how well conceived and efficiently run there probably will be failures </s>
<s> these could be costly and have a serious effect both at home and abroad </s>
<s> but as the popular response suggests the potentiality of the peace corps is very great </s>
<s> it can contribute to the development of critical countries and regions </s>
<s> it can promote international cooperation and good will toward this country </s>
<s> it can also contribute to the education of america and to more intelligent american participation in the world </s>
<s> with thousands of young americans going to work in developing areas millions of americans will become more directly involved in the world than ever before </s>
<s> with colleges and universities carrying a large part of the program and with students looking toward peace corps service there will be an impact on educational curriculum and student seriousness </s>
<s> to the congress of the united states </s>
<s> i have today signed an executive order establishing a peace corps on a temporary pilot basis </s>
<s> the temporary peace corps will be a source of information and experience to aid us in formulating more effective plans for a permanent organization </s>
<s> in addition by starting the peace corps now we will be able to begin training young men and women for overseas duty this summer with the objective of placing them in overseas positions by late fall </s>
<s> this temporary peace corps is being established under existing authority in the mutual security act and will be located in the department of state </s>
<s> its initial expenses will be paid from appropriations currently available for our foreign aid program </s>
<s> throughout the world the people of the newly developing nations are struggling for economic and social progress which reflects their deepest desires </s>
<s> our own freedom and the future of freedom around the world depend in a very real sense on their ability to build growing and independent nations where men can live in dignity liberated from the bonds of hunger ignorance and poverty </s>
<s> this organization will differ from existing assistance programs in that its members will supplement technical advisers by offering the specific skills needed by developing nations if they are to put technical advice to work </s>
<s> they will help provide the skilled manpower necessary to carry out the development projects planned by the host governments acting at a working level and serving at great personal sacrifice </s>
<s> there is little doubt that the number of those who wish to serve will be far greater than our capacity to absorb them </s>
<s> wildlife habitat resources </s>
<s> the long-range objective of habitat management is to make it fully productive so as to support fish and game populations to contribute to the need for public use and enjoyment </s>
<s> revise and complete wildlife habitat management and improvement plans for all administrative units assuring proper coordination between wildlife habitat management and other resources </s>
<s> protection </s>
<s> the total adverse impact of disease insects fire weather destructive animals and other forces on the uses and values of forest resources is not generally recognized </s>
<s> they kill and destroy retard or prevent reproduction and growth impair and damage values and disrupt uses </s>
<s> these destructive forces also have a seriously adverse effect upon the watersheds and their life-supporting waterflows and upon the other renewable forest resources </s>
<s> the long-range objective is to hold the damage from destructive agencies below the level which would seriously interfere with intensive management of the national forest system under principles of multiple use and high-level sustained yield of products and services </s>
<s> this can be accomplished substantially by a continued trend toward better facilities and techniques for fire control and more resources to cope with critical fire periods and a more intensive application of a program of prevention detection and control of insect and disease infestations </s>
<s> in addition to direct protection measures more intensive management of timber resources will assist in reduction of losses from insects and disease </s>
<s> protection from insects and disease </s>
<s> the initial suppression activities would cover about twice the acreage currently being treated </s>
<s> the objective is to achieve sufficient effectiveness of control on all of the area now under treatment plus the additional acres so that after the initial period only maintenance control will be needed </s>
<s> initiating a program to control dwarf mistletoe on several hundred thousand acres of selected better stands of young softwood sawtimber on better growing sites </s>
<s> coordination of pest control objectives with timber management activities to reduce losses </s>
<s> protection from fire </s>
<s> expansion modernization and development of fire control to a proficiency and strength of force which will prevent as many fires as possible and suppress fires before they spread beyond permitted standards </s>
<s> this is to be accomplished by nearly doubling the present level of preventive effort detection skilled fire-fighting crews and equipment use </s>
<s> this will include a stepped-up program of training and development of personnel </s>
<s> adoption and use of new and modern techniques being developed for prevention for suppression of fires while small and for stopping large fires while running and burning intensely </s>
<s> reduction of hazardous fuel conditions to minimize the chances of large fires developing and spreading to high-value areas </s>
<s> protection from other damage </s>
<s> these areas comprise about half of the total area of rodent infestation on the national forests </s>
<s> control would be limited to those rodents for which economical means of control are known </s>
<s> roads and trails </s>
<s> the transportation system which serves the national forests is a complex of highways and access roads and trails under various ownerships and jurisdictions </s>
<s> this system is divided into a forest highway system administered by the secretary of commerce and a forest development road and trail system administered by the secretary of agriculture </s>
<s> both of these systems are essential for the production development and use of the national forests </s>
<s> these are mostly through highways that carry traffic going from one destination to another </s>
<s> because administration of the forest highway system is a responsibility of the secretary of commerce with maintenance provided by the states and counties this development program for the national forests does not include estimates of the funds needed to maintain the forest highway system nor to construct the additions to it that are needed </s>
<s> these roads are largely of less than highway standards and usually carry traffic which is related to use of the national forests </s>
<s> construction and maintenance of this system is a responsibility of the secretary of agriculture </s>
<s> the ultimate trail system will be of value primarily for recreation and wildlife utilization and fire protection </s>
<s> it will be carefully planned to maintain optimum service to these important resources and watersheds </s>
<s> the protection of forage timber and wildlife resources from fire insects and disease </s>
<s> the balanced use of recreation hunting and fishing areas </s>
<s> the volume of timber that can be marketed especially for small sales and the support of dependent communities and small business enterprises </s>
<s> the level of salvage cutting in dead and dying timber stands and the opportunity to promptly salvage losses resulting from fire windstorm insects and disease </s>
<s> the protection of watershed lands from erosion and overgrazing by animals </s>
<s> the existence of road systems permits an intensity of management and use for all national forest purposes that is not otherwise possible </s>
<s> furthermore roads that give access to national forest timber are investments which pay their own way over a period of years </s>
<s> use of these roads by the public results in substantial benefits to the localities the roads serve </s>
<s> the long-range objective of this department is to provide and maintain a system of forest development roads and trails which will adequately service the national forest system at the levels needed to meet expected needs and optimum production of products and services </s>
<s> land adjustment land purchase land use </s>
<s> within the units in the national forest system the pattern of land ownership is quite irregular </s>
<s> in some units national forest ownership is well blocked together </s>
<s> in many others the previous patenting of land under the public land laws or the way in which land was available for purchase resulted in a scattered pattern of ownership </s>
<s> one consequence is the occurrence of occasional conflicts because private owners of some inholdings object to public programs of use on neighboring national forest or other federal land or because such ownerships are developed for uses that are not compatible with use for the public of neighboring national forest land </s>
<s> some privately held inholdings are a source of direct damage to these federal lands </s>
<s> and some which are suitable for tree growing and for other national forest purposes are unmanaged or in need of expensive rehabilitation and are contributing nothing to the economy </s>
<s> there are no reasonable prospects that these conditions will be corrected or changed </s>
<s> lands in this last category are situated largely in the mountainous portions of the eastern states </s>
<s> the long-range objective is to bring about consolidation of ownership through use of land exchange authority and through purchase on a moderate scale of inholdings which comprise key tracts for recognized national forest programs such as recreation development or which are a source of damage to lands in national forests and national grasslands </s>
<s> strategy and tactics of the us military forces are now undergoing one of the greatest transitions in history </s>
<s> the change of emphasis from conventional-type to missile-type warfare must be made with care mindful that the one type of warfare cannot be safely neglected in favor of the other </s>
<s> our military forces must be capable of contending successfully with any contingency which may be forced upon us from limited emergencies to all-out nuclear general war </s>
<s> forces and military personnel strength </s>
<s> if the reserve components are to serve effectively in time of war their basic organization and objectives must conform to the changing character and missions of the active forces </s>
<s> quality and combat readiness must take precedence over mere numbers </s>
<s> under modern conditions this is especially true of the ready reserve </s>
<s> i have requested the secretary of defense to reexamine the roles and missions of the reserve components in relation to those of the active forces and in the light of the changing requirements of modern warfare </s>
<s> last year the congress discontinued its previously imposed minimum personnel strength limitations on the army reserve </s>
<s> i strongly recommend to the congress the avoidance of mandatory floors on the size of the reserve components so that we may have the flexibility to make adjustments in keeping with military necessity </s>
<s> these strengths are considered adequate to meet the essential roles and missions of the reserves in support of our national security objectives </s>
<s> military personnel costs </s>
<s> traditionally rates of pay for retired military personnel have been proportionate to current rates of pay for active personnel </s>
<s> i endorse pending legislation that will restore the traditional relationship between retired and active duty pay rates </s>
<s> operation and maintenance </s>
<s> the increase stems largely from the growing complexity of and higher degree of maintenance required for newer weapons and equipment </s>
<s> a substantial increase is estimated in the cost of operating additional communications systems in the air defense program as well as in all programs where speed and security of communications are essential </s>
<s> further increases arise from the civilian employee health program enacted by the congress last year </s>
<s> in total these increases in operating costs outweigh the savings that result from declining programs and from economy measures such as reduced numbers of units and installations smaller inventories of major equipment and improvements in the supply and distribution systems of the armed forces </s>
<s> this section prevents the military departments and the office of civil and defense mobilization from carrying out certain transactions involving real property unless they come into agreement with the committees on armed services of the senate and the house of representatives </s>
<s> as i have stated previously the attorney general has advised me that this section violates fundamental constitutional principles </s>
<s> accordingly if it is not repealed by the congress at its present session i shall have no alternative thereafter but to direct the secretary of defense to disregard the section unless a court of competent jurisdiction determines otherwise </s>
<s> basic long-line communications in alaska are now provided through federal facilities operated by the army air force and federal aviation agency </s>
<s> the growing communications needs of this new state can best be met as they have in other states through the operation and development of such facilities by private enterprise </s>
<s> legislation has already been proposed to authorize the sale of these government-owned systems in alaska and its early enactment is desirable </s>
<s> procurement research and construction </s>
<s> the decreases which are largely in construction and in aircraft procurement are offset in part by increases for research and development and for procurement of other military equipment such as tanks vehicles guns and electronic devices </s>
<s> these contrasting trends in procurement reflect the anticipated changes in the composition and missions of our armed forces in the years ahead </s>
<s> the department of defense appropriation acts for the past several years have contained a rider which limits competitive bidding by firms in other countries on certain military supply items </s>
<s> as i have repeatedly stated this provision is much more restrictive than the general law popularly known as the buy american act </s>
<s> i urge once again that the congress not reenact this rider </s>
<s> the task of providing a reasonable level of military strength without endangering other vital aspects of our security is greatly complicated by the swift pace of scientific progress </s>
<s> the last few years have witnessed what have been perhaps the most rapid advances in military technology in history </s>
<s> some weapons systems have become obsolescent while still in production and some while still under development </s>
<s> furthermore unexpectedly rapid progress or a technological break-through on any one weapon system in itself often diminishes the relative importance of other competitive systems </s>
<s> this has necessitated a continuous review and reevaluation of the defense program in order to redirect resources to the newer and more important weapons systems and to eliminate or reduce effort on weapons systems which have been overtaken by events </s>
<s> thus in the last few years a number of programs which looked very promising at the time their development was commenced have since been completely eliminated </s>
<s> the substantial progress being made in ballistic missile technology is rapidly shifting the main threat from manned bombers to missiles </s>
<s> meanwhile other air defense forces are being made effective as described later in this message </s>
<s> the size and scope of other important programs have been reduced from earlier plans </s>
<s> notable in this category are the jupiter and thor intermediate range ballistic missiles which have been successfully developed produced and deployed but the relative importance of which has diminished with the increasing availability of the atlas intercontinental ballistic missile </s>
<s> the impact of technological factors is also illustrated by the history of the high-energy fuel program </s>
<s> this project was started at a time when there was a critical need for a high-energy fuel to provide an extra margin of range for high performance aircraft particularly our heavy bombers </s>
<s> continuing technical problems involved in the use of this fuel coupled with significant improvements in aircraft range through other means have now raised serious questions about the value of the high-energy fuel program </s>
<s> as a result the scope of this project has been sharply curtailed </s>
<s> these examples underscore the importance of even more searching evaluations of new major development programs and even more penetrating and far-ranging analyses of the potentialities of future technology </s>
<s> the cost of developing a major weapon system is now so enormous that the greatest care must be exercised in selecting new systems for development in determining the most satisfactory rate of development and in deciding the proper time at which either to place a system into production or to abandon it </s>
<s> strategic forces </s>
<s> the first capability is represented by a combination of manned bombers carrier-based aircraft and intercontinental and intermediate range missiles </s>
<s> the second capability is represented by our deployed ground naval and air forces in essential forward areas together with ready reserves capable of effecting early emergency reinforcement </s>
<s> the strategic air command is the principal element of our long-range nuclear capability </s>
<s> by that time we should be in a much better position to determine the value of that aircraft as a weapon system </s>
<s> in the coming fiscal year additional quantities of atlas titan and polaris missiles also will be procured </s>
<s> the united states recognizes the desire of india to accumulate as quickly as possible a substantial part of the one million ton reserve stock of rice provided for in this agreement to assist in stabilizing the internal markets for this commodity in india </s>
<s> the terms and conditions of the loan and other provisions will be set forth in a separate agreement by the two governments </s>
<s> the two governments agree that they will take reasonable precautions to assure that all sales or purchases of surplus agricultural commodities pursuant to the agreement will not displace usual marketings of the united states of america in these commodities or unduly disrupt world prices of agricultural commodities or normal patterns of commercial trade with friendly countries </s>
<s> in carrying out this agreement the two governments will seek to assure to the extent practicable conditions of commerce permitting private traders to function effectively and will use their best endeavors to develop and extend continuous market demand for agricultural commodities </s>
<s> the government of india agrees to furnish upon request of the united states of america information on the progress of the program particularly with respect to the arrival and condition of commodities and the provisions for the maintenance of usual marketings and information relating to exports of the same or like commodities </s>
<s> the two governments will upon the request of either of them consult regarding any matter relating to the application of this agreement or to the operation of arrangements carried out pursuant to this agreement </s>

<s> the secretary department of economic affairs or his designate will act for the government of india and the president of the export-import bank of washington or his designate will act for the export-import bank of washington </s>
<s> upon receipt of an application which the export-import bank is prepared to consider the export-import bank will inform the department of economic affairs of the identity of the applicant the nature of the proposed business the amount of the proposed loan and the general purposes for which the loan proceeds would be expended </s>
<s> when the export-import bank is prepared to act favorably upon an application it will so notify the department of economic affairs and will indicate the interest rate and the repayment period which would be used under the proposed loan </s>
<s> the interest rate will be similar to those prevailing in india on comparable loans and the maturities will be consistent with the purposes of the financing </s>
<s> within sixty days after the receipt of notice that the export-import bank is prepared to act favorably upon an application the department of economic affairs will indicate to the export-import bank whether or not the department of economic affairs has any objection to the proposed loan </s>
<s> unless within the sixty-day period the export-import bank has received such a communication from the department of economic affairs it shall be understood that the department of economic affairs has no objection to the proposed loan </s>
<s> when the export-import bank approves or declines the proposed loan it will notify the department of economic affairs </s>

<s> whenever two or more standard broadcast stations operate simultaneously on the same or closely adjacent frequencies each interferes to some extent with reception of the other </s>
<s> other factors playing a part in the extent of am service and interference are the frequency involved the time of year the position of the year in the sunspot cycle ground conductivity along the transmission path atmospheric and manmade noise and others </s>
<s> with the existence of these many factors some of them variable it obviously has never been and is not now possible for the commission to make assignments of am stations on a case-to-case basis which will insure against any interference in any circumstances </s>
<s> this is a phenomenon familiar to all radio listeners resulting from reflection of skywave signals at night from the ionized layer in the upper atmosphere known as the ionosphere </s>
<s> all am stations radiate both skywave and groundwave signals at all hours </s>
<s> but during the middle daytime hours these skywave radiations are not reflected in any substantial quantity and during this portion of the day both skywave service and skywave interference are in general negligible </s>
<s> because of the difference between daytime and nighttime propagation conditions it has been necessary to evolve different allocation structures for daytime and nighttime broadcasting in the am band with many more stations operating during the day than at night </s>
<s> however in this case as elsewhere it was necessary to arrive at a single standard to be applied to all situations representing an averaging of conditions and thus to fix particular points in time which would be considered the dividing points between daytime and nighttime conditions </s>
<s> it was determined that the hours of sunrise and sunset respectively should be used for this purpose </s>
<s> these curves were derived by an analysis of extensive skywave measurement data </s>
<s> it was recognized that skywave signals because of their reflected nature are of great variability and subject to wide fluctuations in strength </s>
<s> allocation policies </s>
<s> as mentioned the allocation of am stations represents a balance between protection against interference and the provision of opportunity for an adequate number of stations </s>
<s> the rules and policies to be applied in this process of course must be based on objectives which represent what is to be desired if radio service is to be of maximum use to the nation </s>
<s> to provide some service to all listeners </s>
<s> to provide as many choices of service to as many listeners as possible </s>
<s> to provide service of local origin to as many listeners as possible </s>
<s> since broadcast frequencies are very limited in number these objectives are to some extent inconsistent in that not all of them can be fully realized and to the extent that each is realized there is a corresponding reduction of the possibilities for fullest achievement of the others </s>
<s> accordingly the commission has recognized that an optimum allocation pattern for one frequency does not necessarily represent the best pattern for other frequencies and has assigned different frequencies for use by different classes of stations </s>
<s> the other objectives were subordinated to it </s>
<s> but nighttime operation by stations of other classes of course entails skywave interference to groundwave service interference which is substantial unless steps are taken to minimize it </s>
<s> as mentioned the primary allocation objective to be followed in the allocation of stations on clear channels is the provision of widespread service free from destructive interference </s>
<s> during nighttime hours because of the intense skywave propagation then prevailing no large number of stations can be permitted to operate on one of these channels if the wide area service for which these frequencies are assigned is to be rendered satisfactorily by the dominant stations which must be relied upon to render it </s>
<s> in the daytime on the other hand since skywave transmission is relatively inefficient it is possible to assign a substantially larger number of stations on these channels </s>
<s> the history of the proceeding </s>
<s> since then there has been a notable increase in the number of stations and also the accumulation of additional data and the development of new techniques for using it leading to a better understanding of propagation phenomena </s>

<s> adjusted gross income </s>
<s> the deductions allowed in determining adjusted gross income put all taxpayers on a comparable basis </s>
<s> some deductions are subtracted from gross income to determine adjusted gross income </s>
<s> other deductions are subtracted only from adjusted gross income in arriving at taxable income </s>
<s> to compute your adjusted gross income you total all items of income </s>
<s> businessmen deduct all ordinary and necessary expenses attributable to a trade or business </s>
<s> rents or royalties </s>
<s> if you hold property for the production of rents or royalties you subtract in computing adjusted gross income ordinary and necessary expenses and certain other deductions attributable to the property </s>
<s> outside salesmen deduct all expenses attributable to earning a salary commission or other compensation </s>
<s> employees deduct expenses of travel meals and lodging while away from home in connection with the performance of their services as employees </s>
<s> they also deduct transportation expenses incurred in connection with the performance of services as employees even though they are not away from home </s>
<s> sick pay if included in your gross income is deducted in arriving at adjusted gross income </s>
<s> if your sick pay is not included in your gross income you may not deduct it </s>
<s> if you are a life tenant you deduct allowable depreciation and depletion </s>
<s> if you are an income beneficiary of property held in trust or an heir legatee or devisee you may deduct allowable depreciation and depletion if not deductible by the estate or trust </s>
<s> deductible losses on sales or exchanges of property are allowable in determining your adjusted gross income </s>
<s> certain other deductions are not allowed in determining adjusted gross income </s>
<s> these deductions may not be claimed if you elect to use the standard deduction or tax table </s>
<s> a minor is subject to tax on his own earnings even though his parent may under local law have the right to them and might actually have received the money </s>
<s> his income is not required to be included in the return of his parent </s>
<s> exemption also allowed parent </s>
<s> example </s>
<s> since you contributed more than half of his support you may also claim an exemption for him on your return </s>
<s> he may get a tax refund </s>
<s> if your child works for you you may deduct reasonable wages you paid to him for services he rendered in your business </s>
<s> you may deduct these payments even though your child uses the money to purchase his own clothing or other necessities which you are normally obligated to furnish him and even though you may be entitled to his services </s>

<s> up until that time it had been possible to make cutters for making gear teeth but they were good for only one sharpening </s>
<s> as soon as the time came for re-sharpening the precise form of the gear tooth was lost and a new cutter had to be made </s>

<s> the shift in sentiment from excessive optimism early in the year to the present mood of caution has probably been a good thing in that it has prevented the accumulation of the burdensome inventories that have characterized many previous swings in the business cycle </s>
<s> this caution has been particularly noticeable in a tendency of retailers and distributors to shift the inventory burden back on the supplier and the fact stocks at retail are low in many lines has escaped attention because of the presence of higher stocks at the manufacturing level </s>
<s> in the electronics industry this tendency is well illustrated by inventories of tv sets </s>
<s> home entertainment sales up </s>
<s> separate phonographs also had a good year reflecting the growing popularity of stereo sound and the same tendency on the part of the consumer to upgrade that characterized the radio-tv market </s>

<s> introduction </s>
<s> it has recently become practical to use the radio emission of the moon and planets as a new source of information about these bodies and their atmospheres </s>
<s> when sufficiently accurate and complete measurements are available it will be possible to set limits on the thermal and electrical characteristics of the surface and subsurface materials of the moon </s>
<s> observations of the radio emission of a planet which has an extensive atmosphere will probe the atmosphere to a greater extent than those using shorter wave lengths and should in some cases give otherwise unobtainable information about the characteristics of the solid surface </s>
<s> radio observations of venus and jupiter have already supplied unexpected experimental data on the physical conditions of these planets </s>
<s> this result suggests a very high temperature at the solid surface of the planet although there is the possibility that the observed radiation may be a combination of both thermal and non-thermal components and that the observed spectrum is that of a black body merely by coincidence </s>
<s> for the case of jupiter the radio emission spectrum is definitely not like the spectrum of a black-body radiator and it seems very likely that the radiation reaching the earth is a combination of thermal radiation from the atmosphere and non-thermal components </s>
<s> of the remaining planets only mars and saturn have been observed as radio sources and not very much information is available </s>
<s> the low intensity of the radiation from saturn has limited observations but again the measured radiation seems to be consistent with a thermal origin </s>
<s> no attempts to measure the radio emission of the remaining planets have been reported and because of their distances small diameters or low temperatures the thermal radiation at radio wave lengths reaching the earth from these sources is expected to be of very low intensity </s>
<s> in spite of this the very large radio reflectors and improved amplifying techniques which are now becoming available should make it possible to observe the radio emission of most of the planets in a few years </s>
<s> they deduced from their measurements that the radio emission from the whole disk of the moon varied during a lunation in a roughly sinusoidal fashion </s>
<s> piddington and minnett explained their observations by pointing out that rocklike materials which are likely to make up the surface of the moon would be partially transparent to radio waves although opaque to infrared radiation </s>
<s> the infrared emission could then be assumed to originate at the surface of the moon while the radio emission originates at some depth beneath the surface where the temperature variation due to solar radiation is reduced in amplitude and shifted in phase </s>
<s> since the absorption of radio waves in rocklike material varies with wave length it should be possible to sample the temperature variation at different depths beneath the surface and possibly detect changes in the structure or composition of the lunar surface material </s>
<s> the observable characteristics of planetary radio radiation are the intensity the polarization and the direction of arrival of the waves </s>
<s> this is much smaller than the highest resolution of even the very large reflectors now under construction and consequently the radio emission of different regions of the disk cannot be resolved </s>
<s> it should be possible however to put useful limits on the diameters of the radio sources by observing with large reflectors or with interferometers </s>
<s> measurements of polarization are presently limited by apparatus sensitivity and will remain difficult because of the low intensity of the planetary radiation at the earth </s>
<s> there have been few measurements specifically for the determination of the polarization of planetary radiation </s>
<s> other than this very significant result most of the information now available about the radio emission of the planets is restricted to the intensity of the radiation </s>
<s> the concept of apparent black-body temperature is used to describe the radiation received from the moon and the planets </s>
<s> the received radiation is compared with the radiation from a hypothetical black body which subtends the same solid angle as the visible disk of the planet </s>
<s> the apparent black-body disk temperature is the temperature which must be assumed for the black body in order that the intensity of its radiation should equal that of the observed radiation </s>
<s> the use of this concept does not specify the origin of the radiation and only if the planet really radiates as a black body will the apparent black-body temperature correspond to the physical temperature of the emitting material </s>
<s> the radio radiation of the sun which is reflected from the moon and planets should be negligible compared with their thermal emission at centimeter wave lengths except possibly at times of exceptional outbursts of solar radio noise </s>
<s> therefore neglecting the extreme outbursts reflected solar radiation is not expected to cause sizable errors in the measurements of planetary radiation in the centimeter- and decimeter-wave-length range </s>
<s> the moon </s>
<s> not all the observers have used the same procedures or made the same assumptions about the lunar brightness distribution when reducing the data and this together with differences in the methods of calibrating the antennae and receivers must account for much of the disagreement in the measured radio brightness temperatures </s>
<s> these observations indicate that the lunar maria heat up more rapidly and also cool off more rapidly than do the mountainous regions </s>
<s> mare imbrium seems to be an exception and remains cooler than the regions which surround it </s>
<s> these contour diagrams also suggest a rather rapid falloff in the radio brightness with latitude </s>
<s> such high-resolution observations as these are needed at several wave lengths in order that the radio emission of the moon can be properly interpreted </s>
<s> the result of the observations is af where the phase angle q is measured in degrees from new moon and the probable errors include absolute as well as relative errors </s>
<s> in the discussion which follows the time average of the radio emission will be referred to as the constant component and the superimposed periodic variation will be called the variable component </s>

<s> introduction </s>
<s> the high heat fluxes existing at the electrode surfaces of electric arcs necessitate extensive cooling to prevent electrode ablation </s>
<s> the cooling requirements are particularly severe at the anode </s>
<s> the higher heat transfer rates at the anode compared with those at the cathode can be explained by the physical phenomena occurring in free burning arcs </s>
<s> in plasma generators the superimposed forced convection may modify the picture somewhat </s>
<s> this energy transfer depends on the current the temperature in the arc column the anode material and the conditions in the anode sheath </s>
<s> heat transfer by molecular conduction as well as by radiation from the arc column </s>
<s> the heat transfer to the anode in free burning arcs is enhanced by a hot gas jet flowing from the cathode towards the anode with velocities up af </s>
<s> hence the flow conditions at the anode of free burning arcs resemble those near a stagnation point </s>
<s> it is apparent from the above and from experimental evidence that the cooling requirements for the anode of free burning arcs are large compared with those for the cathode </s>
<s> the gas flow through a plasma generator will modify these conditions </s>
<s> however the anode is still the part receiving the largest heat flux </s>
<s> an attempt to improve the life of the anodes or the efficiency of the plasma generators must therefore aim at a reduction of the anode loss </s>
<s> the use of high voltages and low currents by proper design to reduce electron heat transfer to the anode for a given power output </s>
<s> continuous motion of the arc contact area at the anode by flow or magnetic forces </s>
<s> feedback of the energy transferred to the anode by applying gas transpiration through the anode </s>
<s> the purpose of the present study is to study the thermal conditions and to establish an energy balance for a transpiration cooled anode as well as the effect of blowing on the arc voltage </s>
<s> a detailed study of this latter phenomenon was not attempted in this paper </s>
<s> argon was used as a blowing gas to exclude any effects of dissociation or chemical reaction </s>
<s> the anode material was porous graphite </s>
<s> sintered porous metals should be usable in principle </s>
<s> however technical difficulties arise by melting at local hot spots </s>
<s> the experimental arrangement as described below is based on the geometry of free burning arcs </s>
<s> experimental apparatus </s>
<s> this tube could be adjusted in its axial direction by an electric drive to establish the required electrode spacing </s>
<s> the transpiring gas ejected from the anode formed a jet directed axially towards the cathode below </s>
<s> this small pore size was required to ensure uniformity of the flow leaving the anode </s>
<s> a shielded thermocouple was used to measure the upstream temperature of the transpiring gas </s>
<s> it was exposed to a high velocity gas jet </s>
<s> a plug and a tube with holes in its cylindrical walls divided the chamber above the porous plug into two parts </s>
<s> this arrangement had the purpose to prevent heated gas to reach the thermocouple by natural convection </s>
<s> three thermocouples were placed at different locations in the aluminum disk surrounding the anode holder to determine its temperature </s>
<s> in this design the anode holder is water cooled and the heat losses by conduction from the anode were determined by measuring the temperature rise of the coolant </s>
<s> in addition the inner surface of the carbon shield was covered with aluminum foil to reduce radiation </s>
<s> temperatures of the shield and of the surface of the water-cooled anode holder were measured by thermocouples to account for heat received by the coolant but not originating from the anode plug </s>
<s> the argon flow from commercial bottles was regulated by a pressure regulator and measured with a gas flow rator </s>
<s> the power source was a commercial d c rectifier </s>
<s> the arc voltage was measured with a voltmeter whose terminals were connected to the anode and cathode holders </s>
<s> because of the falling characteristic of the rectifier no ballast resistor was required for stability of operation </s>
<s> a high frequency starter was used to start the arc </s>
<s> experimental procedure and error analysis </s>
<s> transpiration cooled anode with carbon anode holder </s>
<s> the heat losses of the holder were to be reduced as far as possible and they should be such that an accurate heat balance can be made </s>
<s> the argon flow through the porous anode was varied systematically between af and af </s>
<s> the lower limit was determined by the fact that for smaller flow rates the arc started to strike to the anode holder instead of to the porous graphite plug and that it became highly unstable </s>
<s> this region which had a higher temperature than the rest of the anode surface changed size and location continuously </s>
<s> for each mass flow rate the arc voltage was measured </s>
<s> to measure the surface temperature of the anode plug the surface was scanned with a pyrometer </s>
<s> as it turned out a very hot region occurred on the plug </s>
<s> its temperature was denoted by af </s>
<s> the size of this hot region was estimated by eye </s>
<s> the rest of the surface had a temperature which decreased towards the outer diameter of the plug </s>
<s> the mean temperature of this region was approximated by the temperature measured halfways between the edge of the hot spot and the rim of the plug </s>
<s> it was denoted by af </s>

<s> it consists of two blocks with flat surfaces held apart by shims </s>

<s> a tape of cellulose acetate is pulled between the blocks and the tape pulls the fluid or paste with it between the parallel faces of the blocks </s>
<s> in normal use weights are hung on the end of the tape and allowed to pull the tape and the material to be tested between the blocks </s>

<s> although there were only four fluids tested it was apparent that there were two distinct types </s>
<s> two of the fluids showed a high-positive normal pressure when undergoing shear and two showed small negative pressures which were negligible in comparison with the amount of the positive pressures generated by the other two </s>
<s> a system had to be used which did not depend upon the feeding of the fluid into the manometer if measurements of the normal pressure were to be made in a reasonable time </s>
<s> a back pressure was then introduced and the rise or fall of the material in the manometer indicated which was greater the normal pressure in the block or the back pressure </s>
<s> the actual pressure was not determined because the pressure was beyond the upper limit of the apparatus on hand </s>
<s> these are fluids which one would expect to be less viscoelastic or more newtonian because of their lower molecular weight </s>
<s> it is presumed that this negative head was associated with some geometric factor of the assembly since different readings were obtained with the same fluid and the only apparent difference was the assembly and disassembly of the apparatus </s>
<s> this negative pressure is not explained by the velocity head af since this is not sufficient to explain the readings by several magnitudes </s>
<s> these experiments can be considered exploratory only </s>
<s> however they do demonstrate the presence of large normal pressures in the presence of flat shear fields which were forecast by the theory in the first part of the paper </s>
<s> they also give information which will aid in the design of a more satisfactory instrument for the measurement of the normal pressures </s>
<s> such an instrument would be useful for the characterization of many commercial materials as well as theoretical studies </s>
<s> the elasticity is a parameter of fluids which is not subject to simple measurement at present and it is a parameter which is probably varying in an unknown manner with many commercial materials </s>
<s> the actual change af caused by a shear field is calculated by multiplying the pressure differential times the volume just as it is for any gravitational or osmotic pressure head </s>
<s> if the volume is the molal volume then af is obtained on a molal basis which is the customary terminology of the chemists </s>
<s> although the af calculation is obvious by analogy with that for gravitational field and osmotic pressure it is interesting to confirm it by a method which can be generalized to include related effects </s>
<s> af is the work necessary to fill the manometer column from the reference height to h </s>
<s> the total volume of the system above the reference height is af and h can be eliminated to obtain an equation for the total potential energy of the system in terms of h </s>
<s> the minimum total potential energy is found by taking the derivative with respect to h and equating to zero </s>
<s> this gives af which is the pressure </s>
<s> this is interesting for it combines both the thermodynamic concept of a minimum gibbs function for equilibrium and minimum mechanical potential energy for equilibrium </s>
<s> this method can be extended to include the concentration differences caused by shear fields </s>
<s> the relation between osmotic pressure and the gibbs function may also be developed in an analogous way </s>
<s> this can be justified thermodynamically in this case and this will be done in a separate paper which is being prepared </s>

<s> if the mechanics are similar we can also infer that the thermodynamics will also be similar </s>
<s> the concept of the strain energy as a gibbs function difference af and exerting a force normal to the shearing face is compatible with the information obtained from optical birefringence studies of fluids undergoing shear </s>
<s> from this and the force of deformation it should be possible to calculate the elastic energy of deformation which should be equal to the af calculated from the pressure normal to the shearing face </s>
<s> there is another means which should show the direction and relative value of the stresses in viscoelastic fluids that is not mentioned as such in the literature and that is the shape of the suspended drops of low viscosity fluids in shear fields </s>
<s> these droplets appear to be ellipsoids and it is mathematically convenient to assume that they are </s>
<s> if they are not ellipsoids the conclusions will be a reasonable approximation </s>
<s> the direction of the tension of minimum pressure is of course given by the direction of the major axis of the ellipsoids </s>
<s> these are reasonable assumptions with low viscosity fluids suspended in high viscosity fluids which are subjected to low rates of shear </s>
<s> this formula is given by rumscheidt and mason </s>
<s> if a is the major axis of an ellipsoid and b and c are the other two axes the radius of curvature in the ab plane at the end of the axis af and the difference in pressure along the a and b axes is af </s>
<s> there are no data published in the literature on the shape of low viscosity drops to confirm the above formulas </s>

<s> its value was af from the above data </s>
<s> this appears to be high as would be expected from the appreciable viscosity of the material in the drops </s>
<s> it is appropriate to call attention to certain thermodynamic properties of an ideal gas that are analogous to rubber-like deformation </s>
<s> the internal energy of an ideal gas depends on temperature only and is independent of pressure or volume </s>
<s> in other words if an ideal gas is compressed and kept at constant temperature the work done in compressing it is completely converted into heat and transferred to the surrounding heat sink </s>
<s> this means that work equals q which in turn equals af </s>
<s> this is known as conformational entropy </s>
<s> this conformational entropy is in this case equal to the usual entropy for there are no other changes or other energies involved </s>
<s> note that though the ideal gas itself contains no additional energy the compressed gas does exert an increased pressure </s>
<s> the energy for any isothermal work done by the perfect gas must come as thermal energy from its surroundings </s>
<s> a proton magnetic resonance study of polycrystalline af as a function of magnetic field and temperature is presented </s>
<s> af is paramagnetic and electron paramagnetic dipole as well as nuclear dipole effects lead to line broadening </s>
<s> the lines are asymmetric and over the range of field af gauss and temperature af the asymmetry increases with increasing af and decreasing t </s>
<s> an isotropic resonance shift of af to lower applied fields indicates a weak isotropic hyperfine contact interaction </s>
<s> the general theory of resonance shifts is used to derive a general expression for the second moment af of a polycrystalline paramagnetic sample and is specialized to af </s>
<s> the theory predicts a linear dependence of af on af where j is the experimentally determined curie-weiss constant </s>
<s> the experimental second moment af conforms to the relation af in agreement with theory </s>
<s> the paramagnetic dipole effects provide some information on the particle shapes </s>
<s> the nuclear dipole effects provide some information on the motions of the hydrogen nuclei but the symmetry of the af bond in af remains in doubt </s>
<s> introduction </s>
<s> the magnetic moment of an unpaired electron associated nearby may have a tremendous influence on the magnetic resonance properties of nuclei </s>
<s> it is important to consider and experimentally verify this influence since quantitative nuclear resonance is becoming increasingly used in investigations of structure </s>
<s> af appeared to be well suited for the study of these matters since it is a normal paramagnet with three unpaired electrons on the chromium its crystal structure is very simple and the unknown position of the hydrogen in the strong af bond provides structural interest </s>
<s> we first discuss the af bond in af </s>
<s> we then outline the theory of the interaction of paramagnetic dipoles with nuclei and show that the theory is in excellent agreement with experiment </s>
<s> indeed it is possible to separate electron paramagnetic from nuclear effects </s>
<s> the information provided by the electron paramagnetic effects is then discussed and finally the nuclear effects are interpreted in terms of various motional-modified models of the af bond in af </s>
<s> af bond in af </s>
<s> theoretical studies of the hydrogen bond generally agree that the af bond will be linear in the absence of peculiarities of packing in the solid </s>
<s> moreover it will be asymmetric until a certain critical af distance is reached below which it will become symmetric </s>
<s> there is ample evidence from many sources that the af bond in af is symmetric </s>
<s> there is evidence though less convincing than for af that the af bond in nickel dimethylglyoxime is symmetric </s>
<s> douglass has studied the crystal structure of af by x-ray diffraction </s>
<s> he finds the structure contains an af bond with the af distance of af </s>
<s> there is then the possibility that this af bond is symmetric although douglass was unable to determine its symmetry from his x-ray data </s>
<s> douglass found af to be trigonal laue symmetry af with af af </s>
<s> x-ray and experimental density showed one formula unit in the unit cell corresponding to a paramagnetic ion density of af </s>
<s> the x-ray data did not permit douglass to determine uniquely the space group but a negative test for piezoelectricity led him to assume a center of symmetry </s>
<s> under this assumption the space group must be af and the following are the positions of the atoms in the unit cell </s>
<s> af </s>
<s> this space group requires the hydrogen bond to be symmetric </s>
<s> douglass found powder intensity calculations and measurements to agree best for af </s>
<s> these data lead to a structure in which sheets of cr atoms lie between two sheets of o atoms </s>
<s> the o atoms in each sheet are close packed and each cr atom is surrounded by a distorted octahedron of o atoms </s>
<s> the separate layers are joined together by hydrogen bonds </s>
<s> the gross details of the structure appear reasonable </s>
<s> the structure appears to be unique among ooh compounds but is the same as that assumed by af </s>
<s> the bond angles and distances are all within the expected limits and the volume per oxygen is about normal </s>
<s> hence it is difficult to conceive of a packing of the atoms in this material in which the oxygen atoms are far from geometrical equivalence </s>

<s> polyphosphates gave renewed life to soap products at a time when surfactants were a threat though expensive and these same polyphosphates spelled the decline of soap usage when the synergism between polyphosphates and synthetic detergent actives was recognized and exploited </s>
<s> the market today for detergent builders is quite diverse </s>
<s> the best known field of application for builders is in heavy-duty spray-dried detergent formulations for household use </s>
<s> in the household market there are also low-sudsing detergent formulations based on nonionic actives with about the same amount of phosphate builder </s>
<s> light-duty synthetic detergents with much less builder </s>
<s> and the dwindling built-soap powders as well as soap flakes and granules none of which are now nationally advertised </s>
<s> the better quality products in both of these lines contain phosphate builders </s>
<s> in addition many of the hard-surface cleaners used for walls and woodwork had their genesis in trisodium orthophosphate which is still the major ingredient of a number of such products </s>
<s> many scouring powders now also contain phosphates </s>
<s> the cleaning process </s>
<s> cleaning or detergent action is entirely a matter of surfaces </s>
<s> wet cleaning involves an aqueous medium a solid substrate soil to be removed and the detergent or surface-active material </s>
<s> an oversimplified differentiation between soft- and hard-surface cleaning lies in the magnitude and kind of surface involved </s>
<s> one gram of cotton has been found to have a specific surface area of af </s>
<s> even here there is room for some variation for metal surfaces vary in smoothness absorptive capacity and chemical reactivity </s>
<s> spring used a brush surface-analyzer in a metal-cleaning study and showed considerable differences in soil removal depending upon surface roughness </s>
<s> there are considerable differences between the requirements for textile and hard-surface cleaning </s>
<s> exclusive of esthetic values such as high- or low-foam level perfume content etc the requirements for the organic active used in washing textiles are high </s>
<s> no matter how they are formulated a large number of organic actives are simply not suitable for this application since they do not give adequate soil removal </s>
<s> this is best demonstrated by practical washing tests in which cloth articles are repeatedly washed with the same detergent formulation </s>
<s> a good formulation will keep the clothes clean and white after many washings </s>
<s> since practical washing procedures are both lengthy and expensive a number of laboratory tests have been developed for the numerical evaluation of detergents </s>
<s> harris has indicated that two devices the launder-ometer and terg-o-tometer are most widely used for rapid detergent testing and he has listed the commercially available standard soiled fabrics </s>
<s> also given are several laboratory wash procedures in general use </s>
<s> the soiled fabrics used for rapid testing of detergent formulations are made in such a way that only part of the soil is removed by even the best detergent formulation in a single wash </s>
<s> soil redeposition is evaluated by washing clean swatches with the dirty ones </s>
<s> as is the case with the surface-active agent the requirements for builders to be used in detergent compositions for washing textiles are also high </s>
<s> large numbers of potential builders have been investigated but none have been found to be as effective as the polyphosphates over the relatively wide range of conditions met in practice </s>
<s> the problems of hard-surface cleaning are not nearly as complex </s>
<s> in hard-surface cleaning the inorganic salts are more important than the organic active </s>
<s> indeed when the proper inorganic constituents are employed practically any wetting or surface-active agent will do a reasonably good job when present in sufficient amount in a hard-surface cleaning formulation </s>
<s> hydroxides orthophosphates borates carbonates and silicates are important inorganic ingredients of hard-surface cleaners </s>
<s> in addition the polyphosphates are also used probably acting more as peptizing agents than anything else </s>
<s> the importance of the inorganic constituents in hard-surface cleaning has been emphasized in a number of papers </s>
<s> physical chemistry of washing </s>
<s> although there is no question but that the process of washing fabrics involves a number of phenomena which are related together in an extremely complicated way and that these phenomena and their interrelations are not well understood at the present this section attempts to present briefly an up-to-date picture of the physical chemistry of washing either fabrics or hard surfaces </s>
<s> dirt which is here defined as particulate material which is usually inorganic and is very often extremely finely divided so as to exhibit colloidal properties </s>
<s> stains which include the wide variety of nonparticulate materials which give color even when present in very low concentration on the soiled object </s>
<s> miscellaneous soils which primarily include sticky substances and colorless liquids which evaporate to leave a residue </s>
<s> the dirt on the soiled objects is mechanically held by surface irregularities to some extent </s>
<s> this is a theoretically complicated dipole interaction which causes any extremely small uncharged particle to agglomerate with other small uncharged particles or to stick to an uncharged surface </s>
<s> obviously if colloidal particles bear charges of opposite sign or if one kind is charged and the other kind is not the attraction will be intensified and the tendency to agglomerate will be greatly reinforced </s>
<s> likewise a charged particle will tend to stick to an uncharged surface and vice versa and a charged particle will be very strongly attracted to a surface exhibiting an opposite charge </s>
<s> in addition dirt particles can be held onto a soiled surface by sticky substances or by the surface tension of liquids including liquid greases </s>
<s> greases stains and miscellaneous soils are usually sorbed onto the soiled surface </s>
<s> in most cases these soils are taken up as liquids through capillary action </s>
<s> in an essentially static system an oil cannot be replaced by water on a surface unless the interfacial tensions of the water phase are reduced by a surface-active agent </s>
<s> the washing process whereby soils are removed consists basically of applying mechanical action to loosen the dirt particles and dried matter in the presence of water which helps to float off the debris and acts to some extent as a dissolving and solvating agent </s>
<s> greasy soils are hardly removed by washing in plain water </s>
<s> and natural waters in addition often contain impurities such as calcium salts which can react with soils to make them more difficult to remove </s>
<s> therefore detergents are used </s>
<s> the detergent active is that substance which primarily acts to remove greasy soils </s>
<s> the other constituents in a built detergent assist in this and in the removal of dirty stains and the hydrophilic sticky or dried soils </s>
<s> as is well known detergent actives belong to the chemical class consisting of moderately high molecular weight and highly polar molecules which exhibit the property of forming micelles in solution </s>
<s> physicochemical investigations of anionic surfactants including the soaps have shown that there is little polymerization or agglomeration of the chain anions below a certain region of concentration called the critical micelle concentration </s>
<s> micelles can imbibe and hold a considerable amount of oleophilic substances so that the micelle volume may be increased as much as approximately two-fold </s>
