<s> although the matter has not been unequivocally demonstrated the available data show that micelles in themselves do not contribute significantly to the detergency process </s>
<s> in the cleaning process sorbed greasy soils become coated in this manner with an oriented film of surfactant </s>
<s> then during washing the greasy soil rolls back at the edges so that emulsified droplets can disengage themselves from the sorbed oil mass with the aid of mechanical action and enter the aqueous phase </s>
<s> obviously a substance which is permanently or temporarily sorbed on the surface in place of the soil will tend to accelerate this process and effectively push off the greasy soil </s>
<s> substances other than detergent actives also tend to be strongly sorbed from aqueous media onto surfaces of other contiguous condensed phases </s>
<s> this is particularly true of highly charged ions especially those ions which fall into the class of polyelectrolytes </s>
<s> thus for aqueous media we can think of the idealized organic active as an oleophilic or hydrophobic surface-active agent and of an idealized builder as a oleophobic or hydrophilic surface-active agent </s>
<s> the charged particles then repel each other and are also repelled from the charged surface which almost invariably bears a negative charge under washing conditions </s>
<s> the negatively charged dirt particles then leave the surface and go into the aqueous phase </s>
<s> this hypothesis is evolved in analogy to the demonstrated action of organic actives in detergency </s>
<s> the crude picture of the detergency process thus far developed can be represented as af </s>
<s> the influence of mechanical action on the particles of free soil may be compared to that of kinetic energy on a molecular scale </s>
<s> freed soil must be dispersed and protected against flocculation </s>
<s> cleaned cloth must be protected against the redeposition of dispersed soil </s>
<s> it is evident that the requirements imposed by these effects upon any one detergent constituent acting alone are severe </s>
<s> and indeed there is no more reason to separate the interrelated roles of the active builder antiredeposition agent etc than there is to assign individual actions to each of the numerous isomers making up a given commercial organic active </s>
<s> despite extensive attempts to obtain highly pure reagents serious difficulty was experienced in obtaining reproducible rates of reaction </s>
<s> it appears possible to set a lower limit of about af for the activation energy of the abstraction of a chlorine atom from a carbon tetrachloride molecule by a chlorine atom to form af radical </s>
<s> the rate of the gas phase exchange reaction appears to be proportional to the first power of the absorbed light intensity indicating that the radical intermediates are removed at the walls or by reaction with an impurity rather than by bimolecular radical combination reactions </s>
<s> introduction </s>
<s> because of the simplicity of the molecules isotopic exchange reactions between elemental halogens and the corresponding carbon tetrahalides would appear to offer particularly fruitful possibilities for obtaining unambiguous basic kinetic data </s>
<s> it would appear that it should be possible to determine unique mechanisms for the thermal and photochemical reactions in both the liquid and gas phases and to determine values for activation energies of some of the intermediate reactions of atoms and free radicals as well as information on the heat of dissociation of the carbon-halogen bond </s>
<s> the reaction of chlorine with carbon tetrachloride seemed particularly suited for such studies </s>
<s> it should be possible to prepare very pure chlorine by oxidation of inorganic chlorides on a vacuum system followed by multiple distillation of the liquid </s>
<s> it should be possible to free carbon tetrachloride of any interfering substances by the usual purification methods followed by prechlorination prior to addition of radioactive chlorine </s>
<s> furthermore the exchange would not be expected to be sensitive to trace amounts of impurities because it would not be apt to be a chain reaction since the activation energy for abstraction of chlorine by a chlorine atom would be expected to be too high </s>
<s> also it would be expected that af would compete very effectively with any impurities as a scavenger for af radicals </s>
<s> contrary to these expectations we have found it impossible to obtain the degree of reproducibility one would wish even with extensive efforts to prepare especially pure reagents </s>
<s> we are reporting these investigations here briefly because of their relevancy to problems of the study of apparently simple exchange reactions of chlorine and because the results furnish some information on the activation energy for abstraction of chlorine atoms from carbon tetrachloride </s>
<s> experimental </s>
<s> reagents </s>
<s> of several methods employed for tagging chlorine with radiochlorine the exchange of inactive chlorine with tagged aluminum chloride at room temperature was found to be the most satisfactory </s>
<s> to prepare the latter silver chloride was precipitated from a solution containing af obtained from the oak ridge national laboratory </s>
<s> the silver chloride was fused under vacuum in the presence of aluminum chips with the resultant product of af which was sublimed into a flask on the vacuum line </s>
<s> previously purified chlorine was subsequently admitted and the exchange was allowed to take place </s>
<s> purified inactive chlorine was then added from one of the tubes described above and the mixture frozen out and sealed off in a flask equipped with a break seal </s>
<s> this chlorine-carbon tetrachloride solution was illuminated for a day following which the flask was resealed onto a vacuum system and the excess chlorine distilled off </s>
<s> the required amount of carbon tetrachloride was distilled into a series of reaction cells on a manifold on a vacuum line </s>
<s> the desired amounts of inactive chlorine and radioactive chlorine were likewise condensed in these cells on the vacuum line following which they were frozen down and the manifold as a whole was sealed off </s>
<s> the contents of the manifold for liquid phase experiments were then mixed by shaking redistributed to the reaction tubes frozen down and each tube was then sealed off </s>
<s> the reactants for the gas phase experiments were first frozen out in a side-arm attached to the manifold and then allowed to distil slowly into the manifold of pre-cooled reaction cells before sealing off </s>
<s> this method in general solved the problem of obtaining fairly equal concentrations of reactants in each of the six cells from a set </s>
<s> reaction conditions and analysis </s>
<s> these cells were used rather than square pyrex tubing because of the tendency of the latter to shatter when thawing frozen carbon tetrachloride </s>
<s> the round cells were reproducibly positioned in the light beam which entered the thermostated mineral oil-bath through a window </s>
<s> the light was filtered by the soft glass window of the thermostat thus ensuring that only light absorbed by the chlorine and not by the carbon tetrachloride could enter the reaction cell </s>
<s> relative incident light intensities were measured with a thermopile potentiometer system </s>
<s> changes of intensity on the cell were achieved by use of a wire screen and by varying the distance of the light source from the cell </s>
<s> after titration of the liberated af with af aliquots of the aqueous and of the organic phase were counted in a solution-type geiger tube </s>
<s> in the liquid phase runs the amount of carbon tetrachloride in each reaction tube was determined by weighing the tube before opening and weighing the fragments after emptying </s>
<s> results </s>
<s> the thermal reaction </s>
<s> following observation of the fact that the reaction rates of supposedly identical reaction mixtures prepared on the same filling manifold and exposed under identical conditions often differed by several hundred per cent a systematic series of experiments was undertaken to see whether the difficulty could be ascribed to the method of preparing the chlorine to the effects of oxygen or moisture or to the effect of surface to volume ratio in the reaction tubes </s>
<s> in addition to the method described in the section above chlorine and radiochlorine were prepared by the electrolysis of a af eutectic on the vacuum line and by exchange of af with molten af </s>
<s> calcium hydride was substituted for af as a drying agent for carbon tetrachloride </s>
<s> no correlation between these variables and the irreproducibility of the results was found </s>
<s> in most cases the chlorine concentration was about af </s>
<s> the liquid phase photochemical reaction </s>
<s> the liquid phase photochemical exchange between chlorine and carbon tetrachloride was more reproducible than the thermal exchange although still erratic </s>
<s> the improvement was most noticeable in the greater consistency among reaction cells prepared as a group on the same manifold </s>
<s> rather large differences were still found between reaction cells from different manifold fillings </s>
<s> in all cases there was readily measurable exchange after as little as one hour of illumination </s>
<s> it was possible to make estimates of the quantum yield by observing the extent of reduction of a uranyl oxalate actinometer solution illuminated for a known time in a typical reaction cell and making appropriate conversions based on the differences in the absorption spectra of uranyl oxalate and of chlorine and considering the spectral distribution of the light source </s>
<s> exchange was also observed in these cells which had chlorine present at af </s>
<s> the photochemical exchange in the gas phase </s>
<s> further the corpuscular radiation ie the solar-wind protons must sputter away the surface atoms of the dust and cause a slow diminution in size with a resultant increase in both the poynting-robertson effect and the ratio of the repulsive force to the gravitational force </s>
<s> the poynting-robertson effect causes the semi-major axis of orbits to diminish more rapidly than the semi-minor axis with a consequent tendency toward circular orbits as the particles move toward the sun </s>
<s> also planetary gravitational attraction increases the dust concentration near the plane of the ecliptic as the sun is approached </s>
<s> if such is the case the particles within a distance of about af of the earth will have relative to the earth a kinetic energy less than their potential energy and they will be captured into orbits about the earth </s>
<s> this effect can give rise to a blanket of micrometeorites around the earth </s>
<s> since there is a continual loss of micrometeoritic material in space because of the radiation effects there must be a continual replenishment otherwise micrometeorites would have disappeared from interplanetary space </s>
<s> there are several possible sources </s>
<s> asteroidal collisions are also thought to contribute material </s>
<s> it is also possible that some of the dust in the vicinity of the earth originated from meteoritic impacts upon the moon </s>
<s> one cannot make a very satisfactory guess about the micrometeorite flux in space </s>
<s> even in the neighborhood of the earth where information has been obtained both directly and indirectly the derived flux values vary by at least four orders of magnitude </s>
<s> this large discrepancy demonstrates the inadequacies of the experimental methods and the lack of understanding of the various phenomena involved </s>
<s> at greater distances from the sun the situation is still less certain </s>
<s> there are several sources of evidence on the micrometeorite environment </s>
<s> direct information has been obtained from rockets and satellites equipped with impact sensors </s>
<s> in addition the size distribution obtained from visual and radar observations of meteors may be extrapolated to the micrometeorite domain </s>
<s> from the brightness of the f component of the solar corona and the brightness of the zodiacal light an estimate of the particle sizes concentrations and spatial distribution can be derived for regions of space near the ecliptic plane </s>
<s> another important source of evidence only recently receiving much attention is the analysis of atmospheric dust for a meteoritic component </s>
<s> the cores of deep-sea sediments and content of collectors in remote regions are valuable in this category </s>
<s> the data provide a measure of the total mass of cosmic material incident upon the earth </s>
<s> these instruments are installed on rockets satellites and space probes </s>
<s> these vehicles with large sensitive areas have collected data for long enough times to give reliable impact rates for the periods of exposure </s>
<s> many other vehicles with smaller sensitive-area exposure-time products contribute some information </s>
<s> this mass threshold was derived from the detector calibration and an assumed impact velocity of af </s>
<s> the data show daily and diurnal variations </s>
<s> for the next two days the impact rate was af </s>
<s> the data for the first day indicate a meteor stream with a very high concentration of particles and may have led to the high estimates of micrometeorite flux </s>
<s> the data have not yet been analyzed for diurnal variations </s>
<s> space probes have yielded little information </s>
<s> with detectors sensitive to three mass intervals and based on a few counts the second and third russian space probes indicate that the flux of the smallest particles detected is less than that of larger ones </s>
<s> being based on so few events these results are of dubious validity </s>
<s> the calibration of piezoelectric sensors in terms of the particle parameters is very uncertain </s>
<s> many workers believe that the response is proportional to the incident momentum of the particles a relation deduced from laboratory results linearly extrapolated to meteoritic velocities </s>
<s> however one must expect that vaporization and ejection of material by hypervelocity impacts would cause a deviation from a linear relationship </s>
<s> in the united states most of the sensors are calibrated by dropping small spheres on their sensitive surfaces </s>
<s> the russian experimenters claim that only a small fraction of the impulse from the sensors is caused by the incident momentum with the remainder being momentum of ejected material from the sensor </s>
<s> there is a difference in the experimental arrangement in that the us microphones are attached directly to the vehicle skin while the russian instruments are isolated from the skin </s>
<s> the threshold mass is derived from the momentum threshold with the assumption of a mean impact velocity of af in the us work and af in the ussr work </s>
<s> however the conversion from mass to size is unreliable since many photographic meteors give evidence of a fluffy loosely bound meteorite structure with densities as low as af </s>
<s> to what extent such low density applies to micrometeorites is unknown </s>
<s> the velocity value used is also open to some question </s>
<s> if a substantial fraction of the dust is orbiting about the earth only about one third the above-mentioned average velocity should be used in deriving the mass </s>
<s> zodiacal light and the gegenschein give some evidence for such a dust blanket a phenomenon also to be expected if the dust before capture is in circular orbits about the sun as indicated by the trend of the smaller visible meteors </s>
<s> the diurnal variation in the observed flux may be partly due to the dependence of the detector sensitivity on the incident velocity </s>
<s> the flux of micrometeorites in the neighborhood of the earth can be estimated by extrapolation from radar and visual meteor data </s>
<s> the radius is calculated from the mass by assuming spheres of density af except for the smallest particles which must have a higher mass density to remain in the solar system in the presence of solar-radiation pressure </s>
<s> the flux values are for all particles with masses greater than the given mass and are based on an estimate of the numbers of visual meteors </s>
<s> the unshielded flux is given in the last column </s>
<s> these figures constitute the best estimate for the flux in interplanetary space near the earth </s>
<s> of course if there is a dust blanket around the earth the fluxes in interplanetary space should be less than the figures given here </s>
<s> note that the mass scale is one to two orders of magnitude greater than some previously used </s>
<s> the older scales were based on theoretical estimates of the conversion efficiency of kinetic energy into light </s>
<s> extrapolation of this relationship through the thirtieth magnitude covers the range of micrometeorites </s>
<s> the approximate equation is af where n is the number of af with electron line-density greater than or equal to af and q is proportional to the mass of the meteorite </s>
<s> at the fifteenth magnitude af and at the twenty-fifth magnitude af </s>
<s> the extrapolation may be in error for several reasons </s>
<s> the observational data determining the concentration distribution have a range of error which is magnified in the extension into the micrometeorite region </s>
<s> the solar-electromagnetic- and corpuscular-radiation pressure and the associated poynting-robertson effect increase in effectiveness as the particle size decreases and modify the distribution and limit sizes to larger than a few microns </s>
<s> indirect indications of micrometeorite flux </s>
<s> this is much higher than the nickel content of terrestrial dusts and sediments and provides a basis for the determination of the meteoritic mass influx </s>
<s> present data indicate an accretion of about af tons per year over the entire globe or about af </s>
<s> biological warfare </s>
<s> biological warfare is the intentional use of living microorganisms or their toxic products for the purpose of destroying or reducing the military effectiveness of man </s>
<s> it is the exploitation of the inherent potential of infectious disease agents by scientific research and development resulting in the production of bw weapons systems </s>
<s> man may also be injured secondarily by damage to his food crops or domestic animals </s>
<s> biological warfare is considered to be primarily a strategic weapon </s>
<s> the major reason for this is that it has no quick-kill effect </s>
<s> the incubation period of infectious disease plus a variable period of illness even before a lethal effect render this weapon unsuitable for hand-to-hand encounter </s>
<s> a man can be an effective fighting machine throughout the incubation period of most infectious diseases </s>
<s> thus an enemy would probably use this weapon for attack on static population centers such as large cities </s>
<s> an important operational procedure in bw for an enemy would be to create an areosol or cloud of agent over the target area </s>
<s> this concept has stimulated much basic research concerning the behavior of particulate biological materials the pathogenesis of respiratory infections the medical management of such diseases and defense against their occurrence </s>
<s> the biological and physical properties of infectious particles have been studied intensively during the past fifteen years </s>
<s> much new equipment and many unique techniques have been developed for the quantitative exposure of experimental animals to aerosols of infectious agents contained in particles of specified dimensional characteristics </s>
<s> much information has been gathered relative to quantitative sampling and assesment techniques </s>
<s> much of the older experimental work on respiratory infections was accomplished by very artificial procedures </s>
<s> the intranasal instillation of a fluid suspension of infectious agent in an anesthetized animal is far different from exposure through natural respiration to aerosolized organisms </s>
<s> the importance of particle size in such aerosols has been thoroughly demonstrated </s>
<s> the natural anatomical and physiological defensive features of the upper respiratory tract such as the turbinates of the nose and the cilia of the trachea and larger bronchi are capable of impinging out the larger particles to which we are ordinarily exposed in our daily existence </s>
<s> this area is highly susceptible to infection </s>
<s> the entrance and retention of infectious particles in the alveoli amounts almost to an intratissue inoculation </s>
<s> in considering bw defense it must be recognized that a number of critical meterological parameters must be met for an aerosol to exhibit optimum effect </s>
<s> for example bright sunlight is rapidly destructive for living microorganisms suspended in air </s>
<s> there are optimal humidity requirements for various agents when airborne </s>
<s> neutral or inversion meteorological conditions are necessary for a cloud to travel along the surface </s>
<s> it will rise during lapse conditions </s>
<s> certain other properties of small particles in addition to those already mentioned in connection with penetration of the respiratory tract are noteworthy in defense considerations </s>
<s> the smaller the particle the further it will travel downwind before settling out </s>
<s> an aerosol of such small particles moreover diffuses through structures in much the same manner as a gas </s>
<s> there may be a number of secondary effects resulting from diffusion through buildings such as widespread contamination of kitchens restaurants food stores hospitals etc </s>
<s> depending on the organism there may be multiplication in some food or beverage products ie in milk for example </s>
<s> the secondary consequences from this could be very serious and must be taken into consideration in planning for defense </s>
<s> something of the behavior of clouds of small particles can be illustrated by the following field trials </s>
<s> in the first trial an inert substance was disseminated from a boat travelling some ten miles off shore under appropriately selected meteorological conditions </s>
<s> this material fluoresces under ultraviolet light which facilitates its sampling and assessment </s>
<s> these dosages could have been increased by increasing the source strength which was small in this case </s>
<s> the behavior of a biological aerosol on a much smaller scale is illustrated by a specific field trial conducted with a non-pathogenic organism </s>
<s> an aqueous suspension of the spores of b subtilis var niger generally known as bacillus globigii was aerosolized using commercially available nozzles </s>
<s> the spraying operation was conducted from the rear deck of a small naval vessel cruising two miles off-shore and vertical to an on-sure breeze </s>
<s> spraying continued along a two-mile course </s>
<s> a network of sampling stations had been set up on shore </s>
<s> these were located at the homes of government employees in government offices buildings and reservations within the trial area </s>
<s> a rough attempt was made to characterize the vertical profile of the cloud by taking samples from outside the windows on the first ninth and fifteenth floors of a government office building </s>
<s> all samplers were operated for a period of two hours except one which was operated for four hours </s>
<s> this suggests that the sampling period particularly at the more distant locations should have been increased </s>
<s> it is quite likely that an even greater area was covered particularly downwind </s>
<s> the dosages in the three levels of the vertical profile were af </s>
<s> this was not of course enough sampling to give a satisfactory description of the vertical diffusion of the aerosol </s>
<s> a number of unique medical problems might be created when man is exposed to an infectious agent through the respiratory route rather than by natural portal of entry </s>
<s> some agents have been shown to be much more toxic or infectious to experimental animals when exposed to aerosols of optimum particle size than by the natural portal </s>
<s> botulinal toxin for example is several thousand-fold more toxic by this route than when given per os </s>
<s> in some instances a different clinical disease picture may result from this route of exposure making diagnosis difficult </s>
<s> an enemy would obviously choose an agent that is believed to be highly infectious </s>
<s> agents that are known to cause frequent infections among laboratory workers such as those causing q fever tularemia brucellosis glanders coccidioidomycosis etc belong in this category </s>
<s> an agent would likely be selected which would possess sufficient viability and virulence stability to meet realistic minimal logistic requirements </s>
<s> it is obviously a proper goal of research to improve on this property </s>
<s> in this connection it should be capable of being disseminated without excessive destruction </s>
<s> moreover it should not be so fastidious in its growth requirements as to make production on a militarily significant scale improbable </s>
<s> an aggressor would use an agent against which there was a minimal naturally acquired or artificially induced immunity in a target population </s>
<s> a solid immunity is the one effective circumstance whereby attack by a specific agent can be neutralized </s>
<s> it must be remembered however that there are many agents for which there is no solid immunity and a partial or low-grade immunity may be broken by an appropriate dose of agent </s>
<s> there is a broad spectrum of organisms from which selection for a specified military purpose might be made </s>
<s> an enemy might choose an acutely debilitating microorganism a chronic disease producer or one causing a high rate of lethality </s>
<s> it is possible that certain mutational forms may be produced such as antibiotic resistant strains </s>
<s> mutants may also be developed with changes in biochemical properties that are of importance in identification </s>
<s> all of these considerations are of critical importance in considering defense and medical management </s>
<s> biological agents are of course highly host-specific </s>
<s> they do not destroy physical structures as is true of high explosives </s>
<s> this may be of overriding importance in considering military objectives </s>
<s> the question of epidemic disease merits some discussion </s>
<s> only a limited effort has been devoted to this problem </s>
<s> some of those who question the value of bw have assumed that the only potential would be in the establishment of epidemics </s>
<s> they then point out that with our present lack of knowledge of all the factors concerned in the rise and fall of epidemics it is unlikely that a planned episode could be initiated </s>
<s> this is why this approach to bw defense has not been given major attention </s>
<s> our major problem is what an enemy might accomplish in an initial attack on a target </s>
<s> this of course does not eliminate from consideration for this purpose agents that are associated naturally with epidemic disease </s>
<s> a hypothetical example will illustrate this point </s>
<s> no epidemic was initiated nor was one expected because the population in city a was not lousy </s>
<s> lousiness is a prerequisite for epidemic typhus </s>
<s> in this case then the military objective was accomplished with an epidemic agent solely through the results secured in the initial attack </s>
<s> this was done with full knowledge that there would be no epidemic </s>
<s> on the other hand a similar attack might have been made on city b whose population was known to be lousy </s>
<s> one might expect some spread of the disease in this case resulting in increased effectiveness of the attack </s>
<s> the major defensive problems are concerned with the possibility of overt military delivery of biological agents from appropriate disseminating devices </s>
<s> it should be no more difficult to deliver such devices than other weapons </s>
<s> if it is possible for an enemy to put an atomic bomb on a city it should be equally possible to put a cloud of biological agent over that city </s>
<s> biological agents are moreover suitable for delivery through enemy sabotage which imposes many problems in defense </s>
<s> a few obvious target areas of great importance might be mentioned </s>
<s> the air conditioning and ventilating systems of large buildings are subject to attack </s>
<s> america is rapidly becoming a nation that uses processed precooked and even predigested foods </s>
<s> this is an enormous industry that is subject to sabotage </s>
<s> one must include the preparation of soft drinks and the processing of milk and milk products </s>
<s> huge industries are involved also in the production of biological products drugs and cosmetics which are liable to this type of attack </s>
<s> a variety of techniques have been directed toward the isolation and study of blood group antibodies </s>
<s> modifications of the last technique have been applied by several groups of investigators </s>
<s> abelson and rawson using a stepwise elution scheme fractionated whole sera containing abo and rh antibodies on diethylaminoethyl deae cellulose and carboxymethyl cellulose </s>
<s> speer and coworkers in a similar study of blood group antibodies of whole sera used a series of gradients for elution from aj </s>
<s> in the present work whole sera have been fractionated by chromatography on deae-cellulose using single gradients similar to those described by sober and peterson and certain chemical and serological properties of the fractions containing antibodies of the abo and rh systems have been described </s>
<s> materials and methods </s>
<s> samples </s>
<s> serum samples were obtained from normal group a group b and group o donors </s>
<s> three of the anti-rh sera used were taken from recently sensitized individuals </s>
<s> these antibody titers were determined by reaction with homozygous af red cells </s>
<s> serological technique </s>
<s> anti-a and anti-b activities were determined in fractions from the sera of group a group b or group o donors by the following tube agglutination methods </s>
<s> in several instances group o cells were also used as controls </s>
<s> all samples were tested by both the saline and albumin methods </s>
<s> the activities of fractions of sera containing rh antibodies were tested by the saline albumin and indirect coombs techniques </s>
<s> homozygous and heterozygous af cells af and homozygous and heterozygous af cells were used to test each sample </s>
<s> however in the interest of clarity and conciseness only the results obtained with homozygous af and homozygous af cells will be presented here </s>
<s> the saline tubes were saved and used for the indirect coombs test in the following manner </s>
<s> the anti-human sera used were prepared by injecting whole human serum into rabbits </s>
<s> chromatography </s>
<s> after dialysis the sample was centrifuged and the supernatant placed on a af cm column of eeae-cellulose equilibrated with starting buffer </s>
<s> paper electrophoresis </s>
<s> because negative pressure dialysis gave better recovery of proteins permitted detection of proteins concentrated from very dilute solutions and was a gentler procedure it was used in all but the earliest experiments </s>
<s> the unstained strips were then marked using the stained ones as a guide and cut transversely so as to separate the various protein bands </s>
<s> ultracentrifugation </s>
<s> sedimentation coefficients were computed as af values and relative amounts of the various components were calculated from the schlieren patterns </s>
<s> other methods will be described below </s>
<s> experimental and results </s>
<s> the insoluble material which precipitated during dialysis against starting buffer always showed intense agglutinin activity regardless of the blood group of the donor </s>
<s> not all these regions exhibited equal agglutinating activity as evidenced by titer and the extent of the active areas </s>
<s> in all cases most of the activity lay in the region of high anionic binding capacity </s>
<s> these fractions were tested for abo agglutinin activity using fractions from group ab plasma as a control </s>
<s> once again both anti-a and anti-b activities were found in the insoluble material precipitated during dialysis </s>
<s> chromatography of whole sera revealed that the areas of rh antibody activity were generally continuous and wide </s>
<s> the incomplete antibody activity appeared in the early part of the chromatogram </s>
<s> the complete in the latter part </s>
<s> the insoluble material resulting from dialysis against starting buffer always showed strong activity </s>
<s> this was later known to be the result of concentrating the minute amount of complete antibody found in these sera </s>
<s> when the insoluble fraction was suspended in a volume of saline equal to that of the original serum sample no complete antibody activity could be detected </s>
<s> apart from the honeybee practically all bees and bumblebees hibernate in a state of torpor </s>
<s> occasionally you may come across one or two bumblebees in the cold season when you are turning over sods in your garden but you have to be a really keen observer to see them at all </s>
<s> they keep their wings and feet pressed tightly against their bodies and in spite of their often colorful attire you may very well mistake them for lumps of dirt </s>
<s> even some of the queens will die before the winter is over falling prey to enemies or disease </s>
<s> now the thing for us to do is to find ourselves a couple of those wonderful flowering currants such as the red ribes sanguineum of our pacific northwest or otherwise a good sloe tree or perhaps some nice pussy willow in bloom preferably one with male or staminate catkins </s>
<s> the blooms of ribes and of the willow and sloe are the places where large numbers of our early insects will assemble honeybees bumblebees and other wild bees and also various kinds of flies </s>
<s> it is a happy buzzing crowd </s>
<s> each male willow catkin is composed of a large number of small flowers </s>
<s> it is not difficult to see that the stamens of the catkin are always arranged in pairs and that each individual flower is nothing but one such pair standing on a green black-tipped little scale </s>
<s> by scrutinizing the flowers one can also notice that the scale bears one or two tiny warts </s>
<s> the staminate willow catkins then provide their visitors with both nectar and pollen </s>
<s> a marvelous arrangement for it provides exactly what the bee queens need to make their beebread a combination of honey and pollen with which the young of all species are fed </s>
<s> the only exception to this is certain bees that have become parasites </s>
<s> i will deal with these later on </s>
<s> quite often honeybees form a majority on the willow catkins </s>
<s> as we have already seen in the first chapter bumblebees are bigger hairier and much more colorful than honeybees exhibiting various combinations of black yellow white and orange </s>
<s> let us not try to key them out at this stage of the game and let us just call them bombus </s>
<s> there must be several dozen species in the united states alone </s>
<s> if you really insist on knowing their names an excellent book on the north american species is bumblebees and their ways by o e plath </s>
<s> if we manage to keep track of a bombus queen after she has left her feeding place we may discover the snug little hideout which she has fixed up for herself when she woke up from her winter sleep </s>
<s> as befits a queen a bumblebee female is rather choosy and may spend considerable time searching for a suitable nesting place </s>
<s> most species seem to prefer a ready-made hollow such as a deserted mouse nest a bird house or the hole made by a woodpecker </s>
<s> some show a definite liking for making their nest in moss </s>
<s> she also builds one or two waxen cups which she fills with honey </s>
<s> then a group of eggs is deposited in a cavity in the beebread loaf and the egg compartment is closed </s>
<s> the queen afterward keeps incubating and guarding her eggs like a mother hen taking a sip from time to time from the rather liquid honey in her honey pots </s>
<s> when the larvae hatch they feed on the beebread although they also receive extra honey meals from their mother </s>
<s> she continues to add to the pollen supply as needed </s>
<s> the larvae kept warm by the queen are full grown in about ten days </s>
<s> each now makes a tough papery cocoon and pupates </s>
<s> after another two weeks the first young emerge four to eight small daughters that begin to play the role of worker bees collecting pollen and nectar in the field and caring for the new young generation while the queen retires to a life of egg laying </s>
<s> the first worker bees do not mate or lay eggs </s>
<s> males and mating females do not emerge until later in the season </s>
<s> the broods of workers that appear later tend to be bigger than the first ones probably because they are better fed </s>
<s> simultaneously males or drones are produced mostly from the unfertilized eggs of workers although a few may be produced by the queen </s>
<s> the young queens and drones leave the nest and mate and after a short period of freedom the fertilized young queens will begin to dig in for the winter </s>
<s> it is an amazing fact that in some species this will happen while the summer is still in full swing for instance in august </s>
<s> the temperature then is still very high </s>
<s> at the old nest the queen will in the early fall cease to lay the fertilized eggs that will produce females </s>
<s> not always though does the development of a bumblebee colony take place in the smooth fashion we have just described </s>
<s> some members of the bee family have become idlers social parasites that live at the expense of their hardworking relatives </s>
<s> female individuals of psithyrus look deceptively like the workers and queens of the bumblebees they victimize </s>
<s> the female parasite spends much time in her efforts to find a nest of her host </s>
<s> when she succeeds she usually manages to slip in unobtrusively to deposit an egg on a completed loaf of beebread before the bumblebees seal the egg compartment </s>
<s> the hosts never seem to recognize that something is amiss so that the compartment afterward is sealed normally </s>
<s> thus the larvae of the intruder can develop at the expense of the rightful inhabitants and the store of beebread </s>
<s> later on they and the mother psithyrus are fed by the bombus workers </s>
<s> worse still in a number of cases it has been claimed that the psithyrus female kills the bombus queen </s>
<s> but let us return after this gruesome interlude to our willow catkins in the spring </s>
<s> there are other wild bees that command our attention </s>
<s> it is almost certain that some of these usually a trifle smaller than the honeybees are andrenas or mining bees </s>
<s> one of my favorites is a armata a species very common in england where it is sometimes referred to as the lawn bee </s>
<s> the females like to burrow in the short turf of well-kept lawns where their little mounds of earth often appear by the hundreds </s>
<s> almost equal in size to a honeybee a armata is much more beautiful in color at least in the female of the species a rich velvety rusty red </s>
<s> the males are much duller </s>
<s> after having mated an andrena female digs a hole straight down into the ground forming a burrow about the size of a lead pencil </s>
<s> the development of the andrena larvae is very rapid so that by the end of spring they have already pupated and become adults </s>
<s> but they are still enclosed in their larval cells and remain there throughout the summer fall and winter </s>
<s> their appearance next spring coincides in an almost uncanny way with the flowering of their host plants </s>
<s> this must be due to a completely identical response to the weather in the plant and the animal </s>
<s> after the male and female andrenas have mated the cycle is repeated </s>
<s> although andrena is gregarious so that we may find hundreds and hundreds of burrows together we must still call it a solitary bee </s>
<s> its life history is much simpler than that of the truly colonial bumblebees and can serve as an example of the life cycle of many other species </s>
<s> after all social life in the group of the bees is by no means general although it certainly is a striking feature </s>
<s> on the basis of its life history we like to think that andrena is more primitive than the bumblebees </s>
<s> the way in which it transports its pollen is not so perfect either </s>
<s> it lacks pollen baskets and possesses only a large number of long branched hairs on its legs on which the pollen grains will collect </s>
<s> still andrena will do a reasonably good job so that an animal with a full pollen load looks like a gay little piece of yellow down floating in the wind </s>
<s> closely related to the andrenas are the nomias or alkali bees </s>
<s> nomia melanderi can be found in tremendous numbers in certain parts of the united states west of the great plains for example in utah and central washington </s>
<s> often the burrows are only an inch or two apart and the bee cities cover several acres </s>
<s> the life history of the alkali bee is similar to that of andrena but the first activity of the adults does not take place until summer and the individuals hibernate in the prepupal stage </s>
<s> in most places there are two generations a year a second brood of adults appearing late in the summer </s>
<s> i must plead guilty to a special sympathy for nomias </s>
<s> this may just be pride in my adopted state of washington but certainly i love to visit their mound cities near yakima and prosser in july or august when the bees are in their most active period </s>
<s> sometimes although by no means always these are indeed alkaline </s>
<s> the thing is that these bees love a fine-grained soil that is moist </s>
<s> yet the water in the ground should not be stagnant either </s>
<s> they dislike dense vegetation </s>
<s> the best chance of course is offered by gently sloping terrain where the water remains close to the surface and where the air is dry so that a high evaporation leaves salty deposits which permit only sparse plant growth </s>
<s> it is hard to understand how he concluded that most snakes do not grow appreciably after attaining maturity </s>
<s> he was working with species of java so perhaps some tropical snakes are unusual in this respect </s>
<s> certain individual giants recorded later did fail to show a reasonable difference after maturity but it is impossible to know whether this is due to captive conditions </s>
<s> additional records of slow growth have been omitted </s>
<s> it is possible to make a few generalizations about the six giants themselves </s>
<s> data on the former are scanty but there can be little doubt that the latter is sometimes born at a length greater than that of any of the others thereby lending support to the belief that the anaconda does indeed attain the greatest length </s>
<s> let us speculate a little on the maximum size of the anaconda </s>
<s> the african rock python a close second is followed in turn by the reticulate python </s>
<s> there are few data on the boa constrictor those for the anaconda are unconvincing and there is nothing at all on the amethystine python </s>
<s> it seems likely that the indian python comes out ahead because records of its growth have been made more carefully and frequently </s>
<s> it responds exceptionally well to captivity and does not reach proportions that make it hard to keep </s>
<s> i cannot make sense out of the figures for post maturity growth </s>
<s> at best the annual increase appears to be a matter of inches rather than feet </s>
<s> until better records have been kept over longer periods of time and much more is known about the maximum dimensions it will be wise to refrain from drawing conclusions </s>
<s> it is often stated that the largest snakes require five years to attain maturity but this apparently is an overestimation </s>
<s> data on the boa constrictor about match this </s>
<s> another approach is to estimate from the rate of growth and the smallest size at maturity </s>
<s> results from this approach amply confirm the direct observations about three years are required there being a possible slight difference between males and females in the time required </s>
<s> only the amethystine python and the anaconda must be excluded for lack or paucity of data </s>
<s> oliver in his summary of the habits of the snakes of the united states could supply data on the maturing period for only three species in addition to the rattlers which i shall consider separately </s>
<s> klauber investigated the rattlesnakes carefully himself and also summarized what others have found </s>
<s> he concluded that in the southern species which are rapidly growing types females mate at the age of two and a half and bear the first young when they are three </s>
<s> other herpetologists have ascertained that in the northern united states the prairie rattlesnake may not give first birth until it is four or even five years old and that the young may be born every other year rather than annually </s>
<s> maximum length </s>
<s> oversized monsters are never brought home either alive or preserved and field measurements are obviously open to doubt because of the universal tendency to exaggerate dimensions </s>
<s> measurements of skins are of little value </s>
<s> every snake hide is noticeably longer than its carcass and intentional stretching presents no difficulty to the unscrupulous explorer </s>
<s> in spite of all the pitfalls there is a certain amount of agreement on some of the giants </s>
<s> the anaconda proves to be the fly in the ointment but the reason for this is not clear </s>
<s> the relatively wild conditions still found in tropical south america might be responsible </s>
<s> there are three levels on which to treat the subject </s>
<s> the first is the strictly scientific which demands concrete proof and therefore may err on the conservative side by waiting for evidence in the flesh </s>
<s> this approach rejects virtually all field measurements </s>
<s> the next level attempts to weigh varied evidence and come to a balanced sensible conclusion </s>
<s> field measurements by experienced explorers are not rejected and even reports of a less scientific nature are duly evaluated </s>
<s> the third level leans on a belief that a lot of smoke means some fire </s>
<s> the argument against this last approach is comparable to that which rejects stories about hoop snakes about snakes that break themselves into many pieces and join up again or even of ghosts that chase people out of graveyards </s>
<s> the mere piling up of testimony does not prove to the scientific mind the existence of hoop snakes joint snakes or ghosts </s>
<s> bernard heuvelmans also treats of the largest snakes but on the third level and is chiefly concerned with the anaconda </s>
<s> his thirteenth chapter includes many exciting accounts of huge serpents with prodigious strength but these seem to be given to complete his picture not to be believed </s>
<s> detailed information on record lengths of the giants is given in the section that follows </s>
<s> growth of the six giants </s>
<s> discussions of the giants one by one will include as far as possible data on these aspects of growth size at which life is started and at which sexual maturity is reached </s>
<s> time required to reach maturity </s>
<s> rate of growth both before and after this crucial stage </s>
<s> definite information on the growth of senile individuals is lacking </s>
<s> anaconda </s>
<s> at birth this species varies considerably in size </s>
<s> the extreme measurements of these fall between the lower limit of the brookfield brood and its average </s>
<s> a difference between subspecies might explain the great range in size </s>
<s> it is very unlikely that either of these anacondas was growing at a normal rate </s>
<s> however as a field measurement it is open to question </s>
<s> it is possible that especially large anacondas will prove to belong to subspecies limited to a small area </s>
<s> in snakes difference in size is a common characteristic of subspecies </s>
<s> boa constrictor </s>
<s> this birth length seems to be typical </s>
<s> when some thirteen records of newly and recently born individuals are collated little or no correlation between length and distribution can be detected </s>
<s> however as so many of the records are not certainly based on newborn snakes these data must be taken tentatively </s>
<s> final conclusions will have to await the measurements of broods from definite localities </s>
<s> i have surprisingly little information on the size and age at maturity </s>
<s> what data there are on growth indicate considerable variation in rate </s>
<s> unfortunately no one has kept complete records of one individual whereas many have been made for a very short period of time </s>
<s> the results are too varied to allow generalization </s>
<s> the bronchus and pulmonary artery in this lung type maintain a close relationship throughout </s>
<s> another marked difference is noted here </s>
<s> the bronchial artery except for a small number of short branches in the hilum contributes none of the pleural blood supply </s>
<s> no bronchial artery-pulmonary artery anastomoses were noted in this group </s>
<s> it is characterized by the presence of incompletely developed secondary lobules </s>
<s> air-drifts from one area to another are therefore conceivable </s>
<s> this relationship however is not maintained centrally </s>
<s> the bronchial artery in its course and distribution differs somewhat from that found in other mammals </s>
<s> this pleural supply is derived both from hilar and interlobular bronchial artery branches </s>
<s> such a dual derivation was strikingly demonstrated during the injection process where initial filling would be noted to occur in several isolated pleural vessels at once </s>
<s> some of these were obviously filling from interlobular branches of the bronchial arteries while others were filling from direct hilar branches following along the pleural surface </s>
<s> with completion of filling net-like anastomoses were noted to be present between these separately derived branches </s>
<s> an unusual increase in the number of bronchial arteries present within the substance of the lung was noted </s>
<s> this was accounted for primarily by the presence of a bronchial artery closely following the pulmonary artery </s>
<s> in distal regions its diameter would be one-fourth to one-fifth that of the pulmonary artery </s>
<s> also three other direct pathways of alveolar bronchial arterial supply were noted via the pleura </s>
<s> through the interlobular septa </s>
<s> discussion </s>
<s> it is evident that many marked and striking differences exist between lungs when an inter-species comparison is made </s>
<s> the significance of these differences has not been studied nor has the existence of corresponding physiologic differences been determined </s>
<s> however the dynamics of airflow from morphologic considerations alone may conceivably be different in the monkey than in the horse </s>
<s> the volume and perhaps even the characteristics of bronchial arterial blood flow might be different in the dog than in the horse </s>
<s> also interlobular air drifts may be all but nonexistent in the cow </s>
<s> probably occur in the horse much as in the human being </s>
<s> a reason for such wide variation in the pulmonary morphology is entirely lacking at present </s>
<s> within certain wide limits anatomy dictates function and if one is permitted to speculate potential pathology should be included in this statement as well </s>
<s> one might also wonder if monkeys are capable of developing bronchiolitis as we know it in man or the horse </s>
<s> in addition it would be difficult to imagine chronic generalized emphysema occurring in a cow considering its marked lobular development but conversely not difficult to imagine this occurring in the horse or the dog </s>
<s> the only area in which one might find major disagreement in this matter is in regard to the alveolar distribution of the bronchial arteries </s>
<s> the meaning of this variation in distribution of the bronchial artery as found in the horse is not clear </s>
<s> however this artery is known to be a nutrient vessel with a distribution primarily to the proximal airways and supportive tissues of the lung </s>
<s> the alveoli and respiratory bronchioles are primarily diffusing tissues </s>
<s> therefore an explanation of this alveolar bronchial artery supply might be the nutritive requirement of an increased amount of supportive tissue not primarily diffusing in nature in the region of the alveolus </s>
<s> if this be true the possibility exists that an occlusive lesion of the bronchial arteries might cause widespread degeneration of supportive tissue similar to that seen in generalized emphysema </s>
<s> our own studies in which bronchial artery-pulmonary artery anastomoses were demonstrated were accomplished by injecting the bronchial artery first with no pressure on the pulmonary artery or vein and then by injecting the pulmonary artery and vein afterwards </s>
<s> it is distinctly possible therefore that simultaneous pressures in all three vessels would have rendered the shunts inoperable and hence uninjectable </s>
<s> in other words the anastomoses between the bronchial artery and pulmonary artery should be considered as functional or demand shunts </s>
<s> in addition little work has been done on a comparative basis in regard to the normal existence of bronchial artery-pulmonary artery anastomoses </s>
<s> the possibility that the absence or presence of these shunts is species-dependent is therefore inferred </s>
<s> certainly the mere fact of failing to demonstrate them in one or another species does not conclusively deny their existence in that species </s>
<s> it is however highly suggestive and agrees well with our own findings in which we also failed to demonstrate normally occurring bronchial artery-pulmonary artery shunts in certain species especially the dog </s>
<s> in conclusion these findings suggest the need for a comparative physiology pathology and histology of mammalian lungs </s>
<s> in addition a detailed interspecies survey of the incidence of generalized pulmonary emphysema in mammals would be interesting and pertinent </s>
<s> also for the present great caution should be exercised in the choice of an experimental animal for pulmonary studies if they are to be applied to man </s>
<s> this is especially so if the dog cat or monkey are to be used in view of their marked anatomical differences from man </s>
<s> finally it is suggested that in many respects the horse lung may be anatomically more comparable to that of the human than any other presently known species </s>
<s> summary </s>
<s> the main subgross anatomical features of the lungs of various mammals are presented </s>
<s> a tabulation of these features permits the lungs to be grouped into three distinctive subgross types </s>
<s> this may be due to the heavy interlobular connective tissue barriers present </s>
<s> the maturity chart for each sex demonstrates clearly that onset is a phenomenon of infancy and early childhood whereas completion is a phenomenon of the later portion of adolescence </s>
<s> third the process of calcification is seen to begin later and to continue much longer for these boys than for the girls a fact which confirms data for other groups of children </s>
<s> the onset profile and completion profile are constructed to serve as norms for children </s>
<s> the upper curve denotes the mean plus one standard deviation and the lower curve represents the mean minus one standard deviation </s>
<s> to summarize the purpose of the skeletal maturity chart each contains two kinds of skeletal maturity norms which show two quite different methods of depicting developmental level of growth centers </s>
<s> first the upper portion requires series of films for every child consisting of those from hand elbow shoulder knee and foot </s>
<s> the lower portion necessitates only films of hand </s>
<s> second the upper portion permits comparison of maturity levels of an equal number of growth centers from the long short and round bones of the five regions </s>
<s> the lower portion permits comparison of maturity levels of short and round bones predominantly since only two long bones are included in hand and wrist as a region </s>
<s> third the upper portion deals with only two indicators of developmental level onset and completion </s>
<s> the lower portion utilizes the full complement of intermediate maturity indicators of each hand center as well as their onset and completion </s>
<s> fourth the two indicators are for the most part widely separated chronologically with the extensive age gap occurring during childhood for all but one growth center </s>
<s> the lower portion provides a rating at any stage between infancy and adulthood </s>
<s> it may be assumed that differences in ratings due to selection of growth centers from specific regions of the body will be small according to existing tables of onset age and completion age for centers throughout the body </s>
<s> accordingly maturity level ratings by means of the upper portion and lower portion of the chart respectively should be somewhat similar since skeletal age assessments are dependent upon onsets during infancy and upon completions during adolescence </s>
<s> it is clear that there are some differences in the ratings but there is substantial agreement </s>
<s> since a skeletal age rating can be made at any age during growth from elbow shoulder knee or foot as well as hand it seems to be the method of choice when one wishes to study most aspects of skeletal developmental progress during childhood </s>
<s> such an indicator or indicators are needed as means of recognizing specific periods of delay in skeletal developmental progress </s>
<s> the differences between onset age and completion age with respect to the corresponding mean age have been brought into juxtaposition by means of a series of arrows </s>
<s> the direction in which the arrow points shows how the maturity level of the growth center was changed at completion from the level at onset </s>
<s> the length of the arrow indicates amount of slowing or acceleration at completion over that at onset and the difference in months can be read roughly by referring the arrow to the age scale along the base of each figure or more precisely by referring to the original data in the appropriate tables </s>
<s> for the boy this epiphysis was markedly delayed at onset but near the mean at completion </s>
<s> in contrast for the girl the epiphysis was slightly advanced at onset and delayed at completion </s>
<s> obviously the slowing for her may have occurred at any point between onset and completion </s>
<s> its completion thus becomes one of the convenient maturity indicators to include in studies of growth dietary patterns and health during adolescence </s>
<s> the growth center depicted here in the distal phalanx of the second finger is listed as the fifth of those in the seven short bones </s>
<s> it is of interest that her menarche was somewhat later than the average for the girls in this group </s>
<s> thus early forecasting of the pubescent stage would appear possible for only seven boys </s>
<s> his arrow crosses the line denoting the mean </s>
<s> b </s>
<s> organification of iodine </s>
<s> the precise mechanism for organification of iodine in the thyroid is not as yet completely understood </s>
<s> however the formation of organically bound iodine mainly mono-iodotyrosine can be accomplished in cell-free systems </s>
<s> this iodoprotein does not appear to be the same as what is normally present in the thyroid and there is no evidence so far that thyroglobulin can be iodinated in vitro by cell-free systems </s>
<s> in addition the iodoamino acid formed in largest quantity in the intact thyroid is di-iodotyrosine </s>
<s> it is not clear whether this system bears any resemblance to the in vivo iodinating mechanism and a system generating peroxide has not been identified in thyroid tissue </s>
<s> on chemical grounds it seems most likely that iodide is first converted to af and then to af as the active iodinating species </s>
<s> iodination of tyrosine however is not enough for the synthesis of hormone </s>
<s> the mono- and di-iodotyrosine must be coupled to form tri-iodothyronine and thyroxine </s>
<s> there is so far no evidence to indicate conclusively that this coupling is under enzymatic control </s>
<s> c </s>
<s> thyroglobulin synthesis </s>
<s> little is known of the synthetic mechanisms for formation of thyroglobulin </s>
<s> its synthesis has not been demonstrated in cell-free systems nor has its synthesis by systems with intact thyroid cells in vitro been unequivocally proven </s>
<s> similar findings have been noted in a patient with congenital absence of the organification enzymes whose thyroid tissue could only concentrate iodide </s>
<s> in addition depending on availability of dietary iodine thyroglobulin may contain varying quantities of iodine </s>
<s> d </s>
<s> secretion </s>
<s> the presence of several proteases and peptidases has been demonstrated in the thyroid </s>
<s> the finding that the concentration of one of these proteases is increased in thyroid glands from tsh-treated animals suggests that this protease may be active in vivo </s>
<s> there is no conclusive evidence yet that either of the proteases has been prepared in highly purified form nor is their specificity known </s>
<s> besides proteolytic enzymes the thyroid possesses de-iodinating enzymes </s>
<s> this de-iodinating enzyme is effective against mono- and di-iodotyrosine but does not de-iodinate thyroxine or tri-iodothyronine </s>
<s> it is assumed that the iodine released from the iodotyrosines remains in the iodide pool of the thyroid where it is oxidised and re-incorporated into thyroglobulin </s>
<s> the thyroxine and tri-iodothyronine released by proteolysis and so escaping de-iodination presumably diffuse into the blood stream </s>
<s> it has been shown that thyroglobulin binds thyroxine but the binding does not appear to be particularly strong </s>
<s> e </s>
<s> antithyroid drugs </s>
<s> antithyroid drugs are of two general types </s>
<s> one type has a small univalent anion of the thiocyanate-perchlorate-fluoro type </s>
<s> this ion inhibits thyroid hormone synthesis by interfering with iodide concentration in the thyroid </s>
<s> it does not appear to affect the iodinating mechanism as such </s>
<s> the other group of antithyroid agents or drugs is typified by thiouracil </s>
<s> these drugs have no effect on the iodide concentrating mechanism but they inhibit organification </s>
<s> on the other hand there are a few antithyroid drugs of this same general type such as resorcinol possessing no reducing activity and possibly acting through formation of a complex with molecular iodine </s>
<s> any of the antithyroid drugs of either type if given in large enough doses for a long period of time will cause goitre owing to inhibition of thyroid hormone synthesis with production of hypothyroidism </s>
<s> the anterior lobe of the pituitary then responds by an increased output of tsh causing the thyroid to enlarge </s>
<s> the effect of drugs that act on the iodide-concentrating mechanism can be counteracted by addition of relatively large amounts of iodine to the diet </s>
<s> the antithyroid drugs of the thiouracil type however are not antagonised by such means </s>
<s> besides those of the thiouracil and resorcinol types certain antithyroid drugs have been found in naturally occurring foods </s>
<s> it is presumed to occur in other members of the brassica family </s>
<s> there it seems that the goitrogen ingested by dairy animals is itself inactive but is converted in the animal to an active goitrogen which is then secreted in the milk </s>
<s> f </s>
<s> dietary influences </s>
<s> besides the presence of goitrogens in the diet the level of iodine itself in the diet plays a major role in governing the activity of the thyroid gland </s>
<s> with lower levels thyroid hypertrophy and increased thyroid blood-flow enable the thyroid to accumulate a larger proportion of the daily intake of iodine </s>
<s> further the gland is able to re-use a larger fraction of the thyroid hormone de-iodinated peripherally </s>
<s> in the presence of a low iodine intake thyroglobulin labelled in vivo with af is found to contain more mono-iodotyrosine than normal the amounts of di-iodotyrosine and iodothyronines being correspondingly reduced </s>
<s> this appears to result from both a reduced amount of the iodine substrate and a more rapid secretion of newly iodinated thyroglobulin </s>
<s> if the deficiency persists long enough it is reasonable to suppose that the af label will reflect the af distribution in the thyroglobulin </s>
<s> similar results might be expected from the influence of drugs or pathological conditions that limit iodide trapping or organification or accelerate thyroglobulin proteolysis </s>
<s> b </s>
<s> the thyroid-stimulating hormone </s>
<s> the hormone has also been called thyrotrophin or thyrotrophic hormone </s>
<s> at the present time we do not know by what biochemical mechanism tsh acts on the thyroid but for bio-assay of the hormone there are a number of properties by which its activity may be estimated including release of iodine from the thyroid increase in thyroid weight increase in mean height of the follicular cells and increase in the thyroidal uptake of af </s>
<s> here we shall restrict discussion to those methods that appear sufficiently sensitive and precise for determining the concentration of tsh in blood </s>
<s> chemical constitution and physical properties of pituitary tsh </s>
<s> after their work other investigators applied salt-fractionation techniques to the problem as well as fractionation with organic solvents such as acetone </s>
<s> the most active preparations obtained by these two groups of investigators appear to be similar in potency composition and physical properties </s>
<s> two problems present themselves in considering any hormone in blood </s>
<s> it is therefore necessary to consider the properties of pituitary tsh if the fragmentary chemical information about blood tsh is to be discussed rationally </s>
<s> whether this abnormal tsh differs chemically from pituitary tsh or is alternatively normal tsh with its period of effectiveness modified by some other blood constituent cannot be decided without chemical study of the activity in the blood of these patients and a comparison of the substance responsible for the blood activity with pituitary aj </s>
<s> in evaluating data on the concentration of tsh in blood one must examine critically the bio-assay methods used to obtain them </s>
<s> we should like to re-emphasise the importance of stating results solely in terms of international units of tsh activity and of avoiding the re-introduction of biological units </s>
<s> for the most part this discussion will be confined to results obtained since the introduction of the reference standard </s>
<s> a </s>
<s> standard preparations and units of thyroid-stimulating activity </s>
<s> introduction </s>
<s> muscle weakness is now recognized as an uncommon though serious complication of steroid therapy with most of the synthetic adrenal corticosteroids in clinical use </s>
<s> although biopsies have shown structural changes in some of the reported cases of steroid-induced weakness this case provides the only example known to us in which necropsy afforded the opportunity for extensive study of multiple muscle groups </s>
<s> the case described in this paper is that of an older man who developed disabling muscular weakness while receiving a variety of steroids for a refractory anemia </s>
<s> report of case </s>
<s> additional findings at this time included cardiomegaly peripheral arteriosclerosis obliterans and cholelithiasis </s>
<s> therapy included digitalization and anticoagulation </s>
<s> later chlorothiazide and salt restriction became necessary to control the edema of chronic congestive failure </s>
<s> at this time a detailed neuromuscular examination revealed diffuse muscle atrophy that was moderate in the hands and feet but marked in the shoulders hips and pelvic girdle with hypoactive deep-tendon reflexes </s>
<s> no fasciculations or sensory defects were found </s>
<s> electromyography revealed no evidence of lower motor neuron disease </s>
<s> thyroid function tests yielded normal results </s>
<s> a schilling test demonstrated normal absorption of vitamin af </s>
<s> serial serum potassium levels remained normal </s>
<s> the clinical impression at this time was either muscular dystrophy or polymyositis </s>
<s> muscle weakness did not improve and the patient needed first a cane then crutches </s>
<s> repeated attempts to withdraw steroids entirely were unsuccessful because increased muscle weakness resulted as well as fever malaise anorexia anxiety and an exacerbation of the anemia </s>
<s> these reactions were interpreted as being manifestations of hypoadrenocorticism </s>
<s> a high-protein diet calcium lactate supplements and norethandrolone failed to change the skeletal complaint or the severe muscle weakness </s>
<s> x-ray films of the vertebral column showed progression of the demineralization </s>
<s> findings at necropsy </s>
<s> there were bilateral pterygia and arcus senilis and the mouth was edentulous </s>
<s> the valves were normal except for thin yellow plaques on the inferior surface of the mitral leaflets </s>
<s> microscopically sections from the posterior base of the left ventricle of the heart showed several large areas of replacement of muscle by fibrous tissue </s>
<s> in addition other sections contained focal areas of recent myocardial necrosis that were infiltrated with neutrophils </s>
<s> many of the myocardial fibers were hypertrophied and had large irregular basophilic nuclei </s>
<s> the intima of the larger coronary arteries was thickened by fibrous tissue containing fusiform clefts and mononuclear cells </s>
<s> the intimal surface of the aorta was covered with confluent yellow-brown hard friable plaques along its entire course and there was a marked narrowing of the orifices of the large major visceral arteries </s>
<s> in particular the orifices of the right renal and celiac arteries were virtually occluded and both calcified common iliac arteries were completely occluded </s>
<s> microscopically there was emphysema fibrosis and vascular congestion </s>
<s> macrophages laden with brown pigment were seen in some of the alveoli and the intima of some of the small arteries was thickened by fibrous tissue </s>
<s> the endothelial cells lining the sinusoids were prominent and many contained large quantities of hemosiderin </s>
<s> some of the sinusoids contained large numbers of nucleated red cells and cells of the granulocytic series were found in small numbers </s>
<s> there were slight fibrosis and marked arteriolosclerosis </s>
<s> microscopically there was hyperemia of the central veins and there was some atrophy of adjacent parenchyma </s>
<s> some liver cord cells contained vacuolated cytoplasm while others had small amounts of brown hemosiderin pigment </s>
<s> a careful search failed to show occlusion of any of the mesenteric vessels </s>
<s> microscopically the mucosa of the stomach showed extensive cytolysis and contained large numbers of gram-negative bacterial rods </s>
<s> the submucosa was focally infiltrated with neutrophils </s>
<s> the mucosa of the jejunum and ileum showed similar changes and in some areas the submucosa was edematous and contained considerable numbers of neutrophils </s>
<s> some of the small vessels were filled with fibrin thrombi and there was extensive interstitial hemorrhage </s>
<s> a section of the colon revealed intense hyperemia and extensive focal ulcerations of the mucosa associated with much fibrin and many neutrophils </s>
<s> cultures taken from the jejunum yielded monilia albicans pseudomonas pyocanea aerobacter aerogenes and streptococcus anhemolyticus </s>
<s> microscopically both kidneys showed many small cortical scars in which there was glomerular and interstitial fibrosis tubular atrophy and an infiltration of lymphocytes and plasma cells </s>
<s> occasional tubules contained hyaline casts admixed with neutrophils </s>
<s> throughout there were marked arteriolosclerosis and hyalinization of afferent glomerular arterioles </s>
<s> these changes were more marked in the atrophic right kidney than in the left </s>
<s> the bone of the vertebral bodies ribs and sternum was soft and was easily compressed </s>
<s> the marrow of the vertebral bodies was pale and showed areas of fatty replacement </s>
<s> microscopically there were many areas of hypercellularity alternating with areas of hypocellularity </s>
<s> the cells of the erythroid myeloid and megakaryocytic series were normal except for their numbers </s>
<s> there was no evidence of fibrosis </s>
<s> the muscles of the extremities chest wall neck and abdominal wall were soft pale and atrophic </s>
<s> microscopic studies of the gastrocnemius pectoralis major transversus abdominis biceps brachii and diaphragm showed atrophy as well as varying degrees of injury ranging from swelling and vacuolization to focal necrosis of the muscle fibers </s>
<s> these changes were most marked in the gastrocnemius and biceps and less evident in the pectoralis diaphragm and transversus </s>
<s> such swollen fibers were deeply eosinophilic contained a few pyknotic nuclei and showed loss of cross-striations obliteration of myofibrils and prominent vacuolization </s>
<s> the necrosis often involved only a portion of the length of a given fiber and usually the immediately adjacent fibers were normal </s>
<s> inflammatory cells were strikingly absent </s>
<s> in association with these changes in the fibers there were striking alterations in the muscle nuclei </s>
<s> in contrast to the nuclear changes described above another change in muscle nuclei was seen usually occurring in fibers that were somewhat smaller than normal but that showed distinct cross-striations and myofibrillae </s>
<s> individual nuclei were usually oval to round though occasionally elongated and frequently small and somewhat pyknotic </s>
<s> these were thought to represent regenerating fibers </s>
<s> trichrome stains failed to show fibrosis in the involved muscles </s>
<s> in all of the sections examined the arterioles and small arteries were essentially normal </s>
<s> purification of the conjugates </s>
<s> preparation of frozen sections </s>
<s> the latter adhesive was found to be much more satisfactory </s>
<s> staining technique </s>
<s> indirect method </s>
<s> as controls other sections were similarly covered with aj </s>
<s> direct method </s>
<s> fluorescence microscopy </s>
<s> results </s>
<s> specificity of staining </s>
<s> indirect method </s>
<s> the intermediate sera were also similarly absorbed with tissue powder </s>
<s> unstained sections mounted in buffered glycerine or sections treated only with ns or af did not show such green fluorescence </s>
<s> sections of crown gall tissue similarly stained with either af and af or ns and af also showed only the light green nonspecific fluorescence </s>
<s> however the nonspecific staining by the af in tumor sections was considered bright enough to be confused with the staining of small amounts of wtv antigen </s>
<s> rinsing the sections with pbs before layering the intermediate sera did not improve the staining reaction </s>
<s> in addition to other treatments treating the sections with normal sheep serum for half an hour before layering af did not reduce nonspecific staining </s>
<s> the only treatment by which nonspecific staining could be satisfactorily removed was by passing the conjugate through a deae-cellulose column </s>
<s> after these treatments the conjugate did not stain healthy or crown gall sweet clover tissues or stained them a very faint green which was easily distinguishable from the bright yellow-green specific staining </s>
<s> the specificity of staining in wtv tumors with af and af but not with ns and af or with antiserum to potato yellow-dwarf virus and af and the absence of such staining in crown gall tumor tissue from sweet-clover indicate that an antigen of wtv was being stained </s>
<s> direct method </s>
<s> in all cases a disturbing amount of nonspecific staining was still present although it was still distinguishable from specific fluorescence </s>
<s> nonspecific staining could be satisfactorily eliminated by passing these conjugates through a deae-cellulose column as described for af </s>
<s> the specificity of staining with af was established as follows af specifically stained tumor sections but not sections of healthy sweet clover stems or of crown gall tumor tissue from sweet clover </s>
<s> sections of tumors incited by wtv were not similarly stained with conjugated normal serum or conjugated antiserum to potato yellow-dwarf virus </s>
<s> this indicates that increase in specificity of af after passing it through deae-cellulose was not merely due to dilution </s>
<s> specific staining by deae-cellulose treated af and af although clearly distinguishable under the microscope from either nonspecific staining or autofluorescence of cells was not satisfactorily photographed to show such differences in spite of many attempts with black and white and color photography </s>
<s> this was chiefly because of the bluish white autofluorescence from the cells </s>
<s> the autofluorescence from the walls of the xylem cells was particularly brilliant </s>
<s> distribution of virus antigen </s>
<s> results of specific staining by the direct and the indirect methods were similar and showed the localization of wtv antigen in certain tissues of tumors </s>
<s> the virus antigen was concentrated in the pseudophloem tissue </s>
<s> frequently a few isolated thick-walled cells or rarely groups of such cells in the xylem region were also specifically stained but there was no such staining in epidermis cortex most xylem cells ray cells or pith </s>
<s> within the pseudophloem cells the distribution of wtv antigen was irregular in the cytoplasm </s>
<s> no antigen was detectable in certain dark spherical areas in most cells </s>
<s> these areas are thought to represent the nuclei </s>
<s> in all cases studied tissues of the stem on which the tumor had developed did not contain detectable amounts of wtv antigen </s>
<s> discussion </s>
<s> in both the direct and indirect methods of staining the conjugates had nonspecifically staining fractions </s>
<s> in the indirect method this was evident from the fact that tumor sections were stained light green even when stained with ns and af or with af only </s>
