<s> use of nomenclature symbols units physical constants </s>
<s> for punched-card or tape storage of information all literature values must be conformed to a common language </s>
<s> in this way a degree of unification of nomenclature symbols and units will be realized </s>
<s> because individual classes of foods differ in their requirements for preservation a number of methods have been developed over the years involving one or a combination of procedures such as dehydration fermentation salting chemical treatment canning refrigeration and freezing </s>
<s> the basic objectives in each instance are to make available supplies of food during the intervals between harvesting or slaughter to minimize losses resulting from the action of microorganisms and insects and to make it possible to transport foods from the area of harvest or production to areas of consumption </s>
<s> in earlier years the preservation of food was essentially related to survival </s>
<s> with the development of nuclear technology isotopic materials and machine radiation sources in recent years the possibilities of applying ionizing radiation to the preservation of foods attracted the attention of investigators in the united states and throughout the world </s>
<s> an early hope that irradiation might be the ultimate answer to practically all food preservation problems was soon dispelled </s>
<s> interest remained however in the possibility that it would serve as a useful supplementary method for counteracting spoilage losses and for preserving some foods at lower over-all costs than freezing or without employing heat or chemicals with their attendant taste alterations </s>
<s> factors responsible for the spoilage of foods </s>
<s> microorganisms are often responsible for the rapid spoilage of foods </s>
<s> of special concern is the growth of bacteria such as clostridium botulinum which generate poisonous products </s>
<s> enzymatic action in stored food produces changes which can adversely affect the appearance of food or its palatability </s>
<s> spoilage by chemical action results from the reaction of one group of components in the food with others or with its environment as in corrosion of the walls of metal containers or the reaction of fats with oxygen in the air to produce rancidity </s>
<s> sprouting is a naturally occurring phenomenon in stored potatoes onions carrots beets and similar root vegetables </s>
<s> insect infestation is a problem of importance chiefly in stored grain </s>
<s> the presence of parasitic organisms such as trichinella spiralis in pork introduces another factor which must be dealt with in food processing </s>
<s> to permit the storage of food for long periods of time a method of preservation must accomplish the destruction of microorganisms and inhibition of enzymatic action </s>
<s> food treated in this manner and protected from recontamination by aseptic methods of packaging and containment presumably could be stored for long periods without refrigeration </s>
<s> less severe thermal treatment as by blanching or scalding serves to inactivate enzymes </s>
<s> general effects of ionizing radiation </s>
<s> ionizing radiation can cause the destruction of microorganisms and insects involved in food spoilage or at lower doses can inhibit their action </s>
<s> it furnishes a means of destroying insects in stored grain products as well as certain parasitic organisms present in meats </s>
<s> because of undesirable flavors odors colors and generally low palatability associated with radiation treatment of this magnitude the inactivation of enzymes is best accomplished prior to irradiation by the conventional heat-processing methods of blanching </s>
<s> radiation does not retard the chemical spoilage of food </s>
<s> it will however inhibit the sprouting of potatoes and other root vegetables </s>
<s> for radiopasteurization to partially destroy microorganisms </s>
<s> preserving foods with ionizing radiation leads to some undesirable side effects particularly at the higher radiation dosages </s>
<s> in this respect the general palatability and individual acceptance of most radiosterilized foods has to date been found to be low in comparison with fresh and commercially processed foods </s>
<s> a number of foods are quite acceptable as regards taste and palatability however at dosages substantially less than sterilization levels </s>
<s> moreover the nutritive value of irradiated foods apparently undergoes little if any change although some of the fat-soluble vitamins are affected by sterilization doses </s>
<s> radiation sources </s>
<s> for irradiation of food the results obtained depend upon the dose rather than the specific type of radiation and x-ray gamma and high-energy electron radiation are suitable </s>
<s> aside from availability and economic considerations each has certain practical advantages </s>
<s> for example gamma rays give deeper penetration but cannot be focused or collimated whereas unidirectional electron beams may be split and directed to both the top and bottom of the food package to be irradiated </s>
<s> selection of a source for commercial irradiation would involve consideration of numerous factors including required dose rate load factor throughput convenience safety and most important costs </s>
<s> of the various particle accelerators the van de graff machines resonant transformers and linear accelerators are the principal ones available for commercial use </s>
<s> costs of the effective energy produced by these sources is a major obstacle in the development of food-preservation processes </s>
<s> conventional energy for processing foods is available in the range of at most a few cents per kwhr for electric power and the equivalent of a few mills per kwhr for process steam </s>
<s> no comparable reductions in the cost of nuclide radiation are foreseen </s>
<s> such projections however appear highly speculative and the capacities involved are far beyond those foreseen for food-preservation facilities </s>
<s> because agricultural activities are seasonal and the areas of production and harvest of many foods are widely scattered geographically and because of the high cost of transporting bulk food items any substantial distance to a central processing location the use of large central processing stations where low-cost radiation facilities approaching the megawatt range might be utilized is inherently impracticable </s>
<s> present status of irradiation preservation of foods </s>
<s> the objective of complete sterilization of foods is to produce a wholesome and palatable product capable of being stored without refrigeration for extended periods of time </s>
<s> chief interest in radiosterilization resides in the military services </s>
<s> for them providing appetizing food under battle or emergency conditions is a paramount consideration </s>
<s> they require completely sterile foods capable of being stored without refrigeration preferably items already cooked and ready to eat </s>
<s> high nutritional value variety palatability and appetizing appearance are important for reasons of morale </s>
<s> foods for rear stations which require cooking but no refrigeration are also of interest </s>
<s> of primary interest are meats </s>
<s> radiopasteurization which produces fewer adverse sensory changes in food products has potential usefulness in prolonging the keeping qualities of fresh and refrigerated food items </s>
<s> thus food so processed might reach more remote markets and permit the consumer to enjoy more produce at peak freshness and palatability </s>
<s> commercial interest is chiefly in this type of treatment as is military interest under peacetime conditions </s>
<s> the present status of food preservation by ionizing radiation is discussed by food classes in the following paragraphs </s>
<s> meats </s>
<s> the radiation processing of meat has received extensive investigation </s>
<s> to date the one meat showing favorable results at sterilization doses is pork </s>
<s> of particular interest to the military services is the demonstration that roast pork after radiosterilization is superior in palatability to available canned pork products </s>
<s> tests with beef have been largely unsuccessful because of the development of off-flavors </s>
<s> partly because low-level heat treatment is needed to inactivate enzymes before radiosterilization treated fresh meats have the appearance of boiled or canned meat </s>
<s> off-flavor is a less severe problem with the radiopasteurization of meats but problems of commercial acceptability remain </s>
<s> however the problem of consumer acceptability remains </s>
<s> the preradiation blanching process discolors the treated beef and liquid accumulates in prepackaged cuts </s>
<s> cooked beef irradiated in the absence of oxygen assumes an unnatural pink color </s>
<s> when lamb and mutton are irradiated at substerilization doses the meat becomes dehydrated the fat becomes chalky and again unnatural changes in color occur </s>
<s> ground meats such as fresh pork sausage and hamburger have a relatively short shelf life under refrigeration and radiopasteurization might be thought to offer distinctly improved keeping qualities </s>
<s> however a major problem here is one of scale of processing </s>
<s> ground meats are usually prepared from scrap meats at the local level whereas irradiation at economic volumes of production would require central processing and distribution facilities </s>
<s> the problems of color change by blanching and liquid accumulation within the package are the same as for solid cuts </s>
<s> the principal potential advantage would be that the finished product could be transported and stored at lower cost under refrigeration instead of being frozen </s>
<s> a refrigerated item could also be heated and served in less time than is required for frozen foods of the same type </s>
<s> competitive processes for preserving meats are by canning and freezing </s>
<s> irradiation using the nuclide source is more expensive than use of an electron accelerator </s>
<s> poultry </s>
<s> results of irradiation tests with poultry have been quite successful </s>
<s> at sterilizing doses good palatability results with a minimum of changes in appearance taste and odor </s>
<s> acceptable taste and odor are retained by the irradiated and refrigerated chicken </s>
<s> seafood </s>
<s> fresh seafood products are extremely perishable </s>
<s> although refrigeration has served to extend the storage life of these products substantially increased consumption might be possible if areas remote from the seacoast could be served adequately </s>
<s> furthermore it has made an exact assessment of the removal mechanisms possible </s>
<s> the force required to accomplish removal is plotted by means of an electronic recorder against distance of removal </s>
<s> since the removal force is a function of coating thickness a differential transformer pickup has been incorporated into the instrument to accurately measure film thickness </s>
<s> this too is recorded against distance by a repeat run over the same track previously cut </s>
<s> a number of adjustment features are included in the hesiometer to facilitate measurement and permit ready removal of coatings deposited on such substrates as iron and other metals glass wood and plastic surfaces </s>
<s> the measurement of topcoats on primers can also readily be carried out </s>
<s> hesiometer results have been found to compare excellently with manual knife scratching tests </s>
<s> if a wedge-shaped coating of increasing thickness is removed from a substrate by an instrument like the hesiometer with a knife of constant rake angle a number of removal mechanisms are often observed which depend upon the thickness of the coating </s>
<s> as the coating becomes thicker the cutting may abruptly change to a cracking type of failure </s>
<s> if the coating becomes still thicker a peeling type failure finally can occur </s>
<s> the molecular forces holding the coating to the substrate are obviously greater than the cohesive strength of the coating and failure occurs by shear along a plane starting at the tip of the knife and extending to the coating surface </s>
<s> here h is the coatings removal force measured parallel to the surface of the substrate and t is the film thickness </s>
<s> it can be seen that the force is characteristic of the removal process and changes abruptly from cutting to cracking to peeling removal </s>
<s> also it can be readily seen that the cutting and peeling types of failure show a steady state response while the cracking mechanism is of a dynamic nature </s>
<s> it should be recalled that these three mechanisms can occur on the same coating deposited upon the same substrate merely as a function of changes in coatings thickness </s>
<s> presumably the interfacial bond strength and gross cohesive properties are identical in each case </s>
<s> cutting mechanism of cohesive failure </s>
<s> it was found that the coating is separated from its substrate entirely by cohesive failure </s>
<s> the action and reaction forces are r and af respectively and are equal and opposite in direction </s>
<s> all the other force vectors are derived from these </s>
<s> af is the force required to cut a coating of thickness t from the substrate </s>
<s> af is the shear force along the shear plane </s>
<s> af and af are the thrust forces acting against coating and knife respectively </s>
<s> af is the normal compressive force acting on the shear plane </s>
<s> af is the friction force between chip and knife surfaces and p is the normal force acting on the face of the knife </s>
<s> consequently both the rake angle of the knife as well as the friction occurring between the back of the removed coating and the front of the knife will determine in large part the detailed mechanism of the cutting removal process </s>
<s> it is difficult to measure the direction and magnitude of r directly </s>
<s> in actual practice the values most readily amenable to measurement are the cutting force af and the shear angle aj </s>
<s> af is instrumentally determined </s>
<s> if the cutting force af is plotted against film thickness a straight line should result passing through the origin and having slope af </s>
<s> blunt knife </s>
<s> one of these is the fact that the knife employed no matter how well sharpened will have a slightly rounded cutting edge </s>
<s> it can be seen that af is a constant and is determined for the most part by the geometry of the knife </s>
<s> the blunter the knife the higher is the value of af </s>
<s> the importance of a hard abrasion-resistant knife material like the carboloy employed in the hesiometer immediately becomes apparent </s>
<s> softer knives would blunt very rapidly making the value of af inexact </s>
<s> in extreme cases of very soft knives this value may even change during the course of a measurement </s>
<s> knife friction </s>
<s> a second factor which enters into the practical measurement of the instrumentally determined cutting force is the frictional resistance caused by the bottom of the knife against the substrate </s>
<s> under equilibrium conditions of cutting the chip exerts a thrust af against the knife which tends to push it into the substrate or lift it away from the substrate depending on the vector direction of af </s>
<s> the resultant friction force af is thus directly proportional to af and consequently also to film thickness </s>
<s> the value of af can readily be assessed by determining the frictional force exerted on the knife while running over the previously stripped coating track under various external loadings </s>
<s> a straight line relationship is usually observed in a plot of af against load l having slope k and af </s>
<s> since the load l under actual cutting conditions is caused by af it can be seen that af </s>
<s> the measured force h in cutting removal of coatings from their substrates consequently can be seen to be the sum of that force required to cut the coating af that due to the bluntness of the knife af and that due to the friction between the bottom of the knife and the substrate af or af </s>
<s> chipping mechanism of cohesive failure </s>
<s> although a large number of coatings systems particularly at low thicknesses fail cohesively by the cutting mechanism frequently a second type of cohesive failure may also take place </s>
<s> this is a chipping dynamic type failure encountered with very brittle coatings resins or very highly pigmented films </s>
<s> the basic difference between the continuous cutting mechanism and that of the chipping mechanism is that instead of shear occurring in the coating ahead of the knife continuously without fracture rupture intermittently occurs along the shear plane </s>
<s> the detailed mechanisms of this type of failure have been studied extensively by merchant for metal cutting and the principles found can be directly applied to coatings </s>
<s> in the next the shear plane angle is high and extends to the inclined work surface </s>
<s> with increasing advance of the knife into the coating the shear plane extends to the coatings surface and the shear angle rapidly decreases </s>
<s> merchant has found that the same basic relationships which describe the geometry and force systems in the case of the cutting mechanism can also be applied to the discontinuous chip formation provided the proper values of instantaneous shear angle and instantaneous chip thickness or cross-sectional area are used </s>
<s> the cracking mechanism </s>
<s> many of the other foamed plastics particularly the styrenes show similar growth potential </s>
<s> and there are even newer foamed plastics that are yet to be evaluated </s>
<s> as this issue goes to press for example one manufacturer has announced an epoxy foam with outstanding buoyancy and impact strength </s>
<s> another reports that a cellular polypropylene primarily for use in wire coating applications is being investigated </s>
<s> on the following pages each of the major commercial foamed plastics is described in detail as to properties applications and methods of processing </s>
<s> it might be well to point out however some of the newer developments that have taken place within the past few months which might have a bearing on the future of the various foamed plastics involved </s>
<s> most manufacturers also seem to be concentrating on formulating fire-resistant or self-extinguishing grades of urethane foam that are aimed specifically at the burgeoning building markets </s>
<s> urethane foam as an insulator is also coming in for a good deal of attention </s>
<s> in one outstanding example whirlpool corp found that by switching to urethane foam insulation they could increase the storage capacity of gas refrigerators to make them competitive with electric models </s>
<s> and in meeting the demands for urethane foam as a garment interlining new adhesives and new methods of laminating foam to a substrate have been developed </s>
<s> new techniques for automatic molding of expandable styrene beads have helped boost that particular material into a number of new consumer applications including picnic chests beverage coolers flower pots and flotation-type swimming toys </s>
<s> sandwich panels for building utility shelters that consist of kraft paper skins and rigid styrene foam cores also aroused interest in the construction field </s>
<s> several companies also saw possibilities in using the technique for extruding or molding vinyl products with a slight cellular core that would reduce costs yet would not affect physical properties of the end product to any great extent </s>
<s> readers interested in additional information on foams are referred to the foamed plastics chart appearing in the technical data section and to the list of references which appears below </s>
<s> urethane foams </s>
<s> the markets that have started to open up for the foam in the past year or so seem to justify the expectations </s>
<s> furniture upholstery as just one example can easily take millions of pounds </s>
<s> foamed refrigerator insulation is under intensive evaluation by every major manufacturer </s>
<s> and use of the foam for garment interlining is only now getting off the ground with volume potential in the offing </s>
<s> basic chemistry </s>
<s> the most important factor in determining what properties the end-product will have is quite naturally the type of hydroxyl-rich compound that is used in its production </s>
<s> originally the main types used were various compositions of polyesters </s>
<s> these are still in wide use today particularly in semi-rigid formulations for such applications as cores for sandwich-type structural panels foamed-in-place insulation automotive safety padding arm rests etc </s>
<s> the polyether glycols are claimed to give flexible urethanes a spring-back action which is much desired in cushioning </s>
<s> although the first polyether foams on the market had to be produced by the two-step prepolymer method today thanks to new catalysts they can be produced by a one-shot technique </s>
<s> it is possible that the polyether foams may soon be molded on a production basis in low-cost molds with more intricate contours and with superior properties to latex foam </s>
<s> the polyester urethane foam is generally produced with adipic acid polyesters </s>
<s> the polyether group generally consists of foams produced with polypropylene glycol or polypropylene glycol modified with a triol </s>
<s> one shot vs prepolymer </s>
<s> in the prepolymer system the isocyanate and resin are mixed anhydrously and no foaming occurs </s>
<s> the foaming can be accomplished at some future time at a different location by the addition of the correct proportion of catalyst in solution </s>
<s> in one-shot the isocyanate polyester or polyether resin catalyst and other additives are mixed directly and a foam is produced immediately </s>
<s> properties </s>
<s> compression strength </s>
<s> the single curve line represents a specific formulation in a test example </s>
<s> thermal conductivity and temperature resistance </s>
<s> in flexible urethane foams we are referring to the range between the highest and lowest temperatures under which the materials primary performance remains functionally useful </s>
<s> in temperature resistance this quality is usually related to specific properties eg flexural tensile strengths etc </s>
<s> these air or gas bubbles make highly functional thermal barriers </s>
<s> flexural strength </s>
<s> this term refers to the ability of a material to resist bending stress and is determined by measuring the load required to cause failure by bending </s>
<s> note that flexural strength is not always improved by simply increasing the density nor is the change always proportional from one formulation to another </s>
<s> where flexural strength is an important factor be sure that your urethane foam processor is aware of it </s>
<s> tensile strength </s>
<s> this property refers to the greatest longitudinal stress or tension a material can endure without tearing apart </s>
<s> processing urethanes </s>
<s> there are many ways of producing a foamed urethane product </s>
<s> the foam can be made into slab stock and cut to shape it can be molded it can be poured-in-place it can be applied by spray guns etc </s>
<s> slab stock is still one of the most important forms of urethane end-product in use today </s>
<s> basically the foam machines that produce such stock consist of two or more pumping units a variable mixer a nozzle carriage assembly and in many cases a conveyor belt to transport and contain the liquid during the reaction process and until it solidifies into foam </s>
<s> the ingredients are fed from tanks through a hose and into the mixer at a predetermined rate </s>
<s> the mixing head moves back and forth slowly across the width of the receptacle </s>
<s> it only takes a few minutes for the foaming action to be completed and after a short cure the material can be cut into lengths as desired </s>
<s> much has been done in the way of ingenious slitters to fabricate the slab stock into finished products </s>
<s> profile cutting machines are available which can split foam to any desired thickness and produce sine triangle trapezoid and other profiles in variable heights dimensions etc </s>
<s> the convoluted sheets can be combined to attain certain cushioning effects mechanically rather than chemically </s>
<s> the low cost and ease of fabrication of the dies for three-dimensional foam cutting plus the wide variety of shapes dimensions and contours that can be tailor-made to customer requirements has made the technique useful for producing case liners materials handling containers packaging and cushioning devices and such novelties as soap dishes toys head rests arch supports and gas pedal covers </s>
<s> molding </s>
<s> although slab stock appeared first it soon became apparent that for the production of cushions with irregular shapes crowned contours or rounded edges the cutting of slab stock is a wasteful and uneconomical process </s>
<s> only by resorting to molding techniques can the cushion manufacturer hope to compete satisfactorily in the established cushion market </s>
<s> satisfactory methods for polyester foams and even prepolymer polyether foams were never fully achieved </s>
<s> this counteracted the gain from having no scrap loss </s>
<s> in addition there were difficulties with the flow and spreading of the foam mixture over the mold surface trouble with lack of gel strength in the rising foam and problems of splits </s>
<s> the introduction of one-shot polyether foam systems aided by the development of new catalysts helped to alleviate some of the problems of closed molding </s>
<s> while there are still many bugs to be ironed out the technique is fast developing </s>
<s> other techniques </s>
<s> simple systems are available that make it possible for urethane foam components to be poured pumped etc into a void where they foam up to fill the void </s>
<s> during the rinsing operation the volume in the tubs gradually increases until overflow from the main drain begins </s>
<s> when all of the rinse water has passed from the reservoir to the tubs the main drains are lowered to permit complete draining of the tubs </s>
<s> the run is complete when all the water has drained off into the waste line </s>
<s> by this procedure rinsing progresses in two stages first by dilution until the time when the drains are separated and thereafter by displacement of the soil-bearing liquor by clean rinse water since soiled liquor squeezed from the specimens at the nip passes directly to waste from the suds box drains </s>
<s> this method of rinsing appears to produce maximum cleansing with minimum soil redeposition </s>
<s> suggested evaluation and classification </s>
<s> evaluation may be made on either a soil-removal or a grease-removal basis as desired </s>
<s> a reflectance-measuring instrument may be desirable to measure cleaning whereas soxhlet extraction is necessary to measure grease removal </s>
<s> purpose and scope </s>
<s> this test method is intended for determining the dimensional changes of woven or knitted fabrics made of fibers other than wool to be expected when the cloth is subjected to laundering procedures commonly used in the commercial laundry and the home </s>
<s> four washing test procedures are established varying in severity from very severe to very mild and are intended to cover the range of practical washing from commercial procedure to hand washing </s>
<s> five drying test procedures are established to cover the range of drying techniques used in the home and commercial laundry </s>
<s> three methods for determining the dimensional restorability characteristics are established for those textiles which require restoration by ironing or wearing after laundering </s>
<s> these tests are not accelerated and must be repeated to evaluate dimensional changes after repeated launderings </s>
<s> the person using these tests must determine which combination of procedures is practical for any specific item in order to evaluate the dimensional changes of textile fabrics or garments after laundering procedures commonly used in the home or commercial laundry </s>
<s> it is possible to identify the test procedure completely with a code consisting of a roman numeral a letter and an arabic number </s>
<s> principle </s>
<s> a specimen or garment is washed in a cylindrical reversing wash wheel dried and subjected to restorative forces where necessary </s>
<s> temperature and time of agitation in the wash wheel are varied to obtain different degrees of severity </s>
<s> drying procedures and application of restorative force procedures are varied to conform with end-use handling during home or commercial laundering </s>
<s> apparatus and materials </s>
<s> there are three fins each approximately three inches wide extending the full length of the inside of the wheel </s>
<s> the water inlets are large enough to permit filling the wheel to an eight-inch level in less than two minutes and the outlet is large enough to permit discharge of this same amount of water in less than two minutes </s>
<s> the machine shall contain an opening for the insertion of a thermometer or other equivalent equipment for determining the temperature of the water during the washing and rinsing procedures </s>
<s> it is equipped with an outside water gauge that will indicate the level of the water in the wheel </s>
<s> a domestic automatic washer that will give equivalent results may be used </s>
<s> the wash wheel is the equipment preferred for the test </s>
<s> two of the clamps are fixed to the edges of the board whereas two clamps travel on guide rails opposite the fixed clamps </s>
<s> the movable clamps travel on carriages which ride the rails and are drawn by dead-weight loading </s>
<s> a perforated aluminum plate used to provide the drying surface is heated by means of a flatiron </s>
<s> each pin is individually sprung to a tensioning member which is driven outwardly in the slot </s>
<s> the tensioning members have a common drive so that the application of restorative force takes place simultaneously in all directions in the plane of the test specimen </s>
<s> the surface of the apparatus in contact with the test specimen is uncluttered and polished so as to be as friction-free as possible </s>
<s> test specimens </s>
<s> three specimens for each sample to be tested are required in order to arrive at a satisfactory average of performance </s>
<s> this is especially true for knitted fabrics </s>
<s> specimens are allowed to reach moisture equilibrium with a standard atmosphere of af and af and then laid out without tension on a flat polished surface care being taken that the fabric is free from wrinkles or creases </s>
<s> fabrics that are badly distorted in their unlaundered state due to faulty finishing may give deceptive dimensional change results when laundered by any procedure </s>
<s> this also holds true if restorative forces are applied </s>
<s> therefore it is recommended that in such cases the sample be replaced or if used the results of dimensional change or dimensional restorability tests be considered as indicative only </s>
<s> the distances may be marked with indelible ink and a fine-point pen by sewing fine threads into the fabric or by a specially designed stamping machine </s>
<s> the marked distances are parallel to the respective yarns </s>
<s> usually the greater the original distances marked the greater will be the accuracy of the test </s>
<s> the distances are at least two inches from any edge of the specimen </s>
<s> mark the specimen at the outer edges of the template with pen and indelible ink </s>
<s> measure and record </s>
<s> garments </s>
<s> critical measurements in length and width directions should be taken before and after washing drying and restorative procedures </s>
<s> procedure </s>
<s> place the specimen in the wash wheel with sufficient other similar fabric to make a dry load of af pounds </s>
<s> start the wash wheel and note the time </s>
<s> this level will be increased by condensed steam </s>
<s> when this water level has been reached inject steam until the temperature is that shown in column aj </s>
<s> drain off the water at such a time that the wheel has become substantially empty of water at the end of the sum of the times shown in columns a and c measured from the time the wash wheel was started </s>
<s> when this water level has been reached inject steam until the temperature is that shown in column aj </s>
<s> drain off the water at such a time that the wheel has become substantially empty of water at the end of the sum of the times shown in columns a c and e measured from the time the wash wheel was started </s>
<s> high-gain photoelectronic image intensification is applied under conditions of low incident light levels whenever the integration time required by a sensor or recording instrument exceeds the limits of practicability </s>
<s> high-gain photoelectronic image intensification may be achieved by several methods </s>
<s> cascading of single stages enclosed in one common envelope </s>
<s> cascading single stages by coupling lens systems is rather inefficient as the lens systems limit the obtainable gain quite severely </s>
<s> channel-type image intensifiers are capable of achieving high-gain values </s>
<s> they suffer however from an inherently low resolution </s>
<s> image intensifiers based upon the multipactor principle appear to hold promise as far as obtainable resolution is concerned </s>
<s> however the unavoidable low-duty cycle restricts the effective gain </s>
<s> tsem tubes have been constructed showing high gain and resolution </s>
<s> however electrostatic focus important for many applications has not been realized for these devices </s>
<s> resolution limitations with electrostatic focus might be anticipated due to chromatic aberrations </s>
<s> furthermore the thin film dynodes appear to have a natural diameter limitation wherever a mesh support cannot be tolerated </s>
<s> cascaded single stages enclosed by a common envelope have been constructed with high gain and high resolution </s>
<s> these tubes may differ both in the choice of the electron optical system and in the design of the coupling members </s>
<s> the electron optical system may be either a magnetic or electrostatic one </s>
<s> the magnification may be smaller equal or larger than unity </s>
<s> as it will be discussed later peripheral defocusing can be improved on by utilizing curved fiber couplers </s>
<s> it should be noted however that the paraxial resolution is quite similar for both electron optical systems </s>
<s> therefore we shall consider in this paper the theoretical gain and resolution capabilities of such tubes </s>
<s> the luminous efficiency and resolution of single stages fiber couplers and finally of the composite tube will be computed </s>
<s> it will be shown theoretically that the high image intensification obtainable with such a tube and contact photography permits the utilization of extremely low incident light levels </s>
<s> the effect of device and quantum noise associated with such low input levels will be described </s>
<s> after these theoretical considerations constructional details of a fiber-coupled double-stage x-ray image intensifier will be discussed </s>
<s> measured performance characteristics for this experimental tube will be listed </s>
<s> the conclusion shall be reached that fiber-coupled double-stage tubes represent a sensible and practical approach to high-gain image intensification </s>
<s> basic design of a fiber-coupled double-stage image intensifier </s>
<s> the tube design which forms the basis of the theoretical discussion shall be described now </s>
<s> the cylindrical focusing electrode permits adjustment of the positive lens part by varying the focusing potential </s>
<s> the anode potential codetermines the gain g and magnification m of the stage </s>

<s> the set of all decisions is called the operating policy or more simply the policy </s>
<s> an optimal policy is one which in some sense gets the best out of the process as a whole by maximizing the value of the product </s>
<s> the specification of the state of the process stream </s>
<s> the specification of the operating variables and the transformation they effect </s>
<s> the specification of the objective function of which the optimization is desired </s>
<s> for a chemical process the first of these might involve the concentrations of the different chemical species and the temperature or pressure of the stream </s>
<s> for the second we might have to choose the volume of reactor or amount of cooling to be supplied </s>
<s> the way in which the transformation of state depends on the operating variables for the main types of reactors is discussed in the next chapter </s>
<s> the objective function is some measure of the increase in value of the stream by processing </s>
<s> the essential characteristic of an optimal policy when the state of the stream is transformed in a sequence of stages with no feedback was first isolated by bellman </s>
<s> he recognized that whatever transformation may be effected in the first stage of an r-stage process the remaining stages must use an optimal af-stage policy with respect to the state resulting from the first stage if there is to be any chance of optimizing the complete process </s>
<s> moreover by systematically varying the operating conditions in the first stage and always using the optimal af-stage policy for the remaining stages we shall eventually find the optimal policy for all r stages </s>
<s> proceeding in this way from one to two and from two to three stages we may gradually build up the policy for any number </s>
<s> at each step of the calculation the operating variables of only one stage need be varied </s>
<s> to see how important this economy is let us suppose that there are m operating variables at each stage and that the state is specified by n variables </s>
<s> to proceed from one stage to the next a sufficient number of feed states must be investigated to allow for interpolation </s>
<s> this number will be of the order of af </s>
<s> if however we are seeking the optimal r-stage policy for a given feed state only one search for a maximum is required at the final step </s>
<s> thus a number of operations of the order of af are required </s>
<s> if all the operating variables were varied simultaneously af operations would be required to do the same job and as r increases this increases very much more rapidly than the number of operations required by the dynamic program </s>
<s> but even more important than this is the fact that the direct search by simultaneously varying all operating conditions has produced only one optimal policy namely that for the given feed state and r stages </s>
<s> in contrast the dynamic program produces this policy and a whole family of policies for any smaller number of stages </s>
<s> if the problem is enlarged to require a complete coverage of feed states af operations are needed by the dynamic program and af by the direct search </s>
<s> but af is vastly larger than r </s>
<s> no optimism is more baseless than that which believes that the high speed of modern digital computers allows for use of the crudest of methods in searching out a result </s>
<s> suppose that af and that the average operation requires only af sec </s>
<s> then the dynamic program would require about a minute whereas the direct search would take more than three millennia </s>
<s> the principle of optimality thus brings a vital organization into the search for the optimal policy of a multistage decision process </s>
<s> this is the principle which we will invoke in every case to set up a functional equation </s>
<s> it appears in a form that is admirably suited to the powers of the digital computer </s>
<s> at the same time every device that can be employed to reduce the number of variables is of the greatest value and it is one of the attractive features of dynamic programming that room is left for ingenuity in using the special features of the problem to this end </s>
<s> these will be numbered in the direction opposite to the flow of the process stream so that stage r is the t stage from the end </s>
<s> let the state of the stream leaving stage r be denoted by a vector af and the operating variables of stage r by af </s>
<s> thus af denotes the state of the feed to the r-stage process and af the state of the product from the last stage </s>
<s> each stage transforms the state af of its feed to the state af in a way that depends on the operating variables af </s>
<s> we write this af </s>
<s> this transformation is uniquely determined by af and we therefore speak of the process as deterministic </s>
<s> in practical situations there will be restrictions on the admissible operating conditions and we regard the vectors as belonging to a fixed and bounded set s </s>
<s> the set of vectors af constitutes the operating policy or more briefly the policy and a policy is admissible if all the af belong to s </s>
<s> thus af </s>
<s> the objective function which is to be maximized is some function usually piecewise continuous of the product state </s>
<s> let this be denoted by af </s>
<s> an optimal policy is an admissible policy af which maximizes the objective function p </s>
<s> let af where the maximization is over all admissible policies af </s>
<s> when it is necessary to be specific we say that the optimal policy is an optimal r-stage policy with respect to the feed state af </s>
<s> for any choice of admissible policy af in the first stage the state of the stream leaving this stage is given by af </s>
<s> this is the feed state of the subsequent af stages which according to the principle of optimality must use an optimal af-stage policy with respect to this state </s>
<s> this will result in a value af of the objective function and when af is chosen correctly this will give af the maximum of the objective function </s>
<s> in finding the optimal r-stage policy from that of af stages only the function af is needed </s>
<s> when af has been found it may be transferred into the storage location of af and the whole calculation repeated </s>
<s> we also see how the results may be presented although if n the number of state variables is large any tabulation will become cumbersome </s>
<s> to extract the optimal r-stage policy with respect to the feed state af we enter section r of this table at the state af and find immediately from the last column the maximum value of the objective function </s>
<s> in the third column is given the optimal policy for stage r and in the fourth the resulting state of the stream when this policy is used </s>
<s> since by the principle of optimality the remaining stages use an optimal af-stage policy with respect to af we may enter section af of the table at this state af and read off the optimal policy for stage af and the resulting state af </s>
<s> proceeding in this way up the table we extract the complete optimal policy and if it is desired we can check on af by evaluating af at the last stage </s>
<s> it may be that the objective function depends not only on af but also on af as when the cost of the operating policy is considered </s>
<s> a form of objective function that we shall often have occasion to consider is af </s>
<s> here p represents the value of the stream in state p and q the cost of operating the stage with conditions q </s>
<s> hence p is the increase in value of the stream minus the cost of operation that is the net profit </s>
<s> if af denotes the net profit from stage r and af then the principle of optimality gives af </s>
<s> this sequence of equations may be started with the remark that with no process af there is no profit ie af </s>
<s> the process in which the outcome of any one stage is known only statistically is also of interest although for chemical reactor design it is not as important as the deterministic process </s>
<s> in this case the stage r operating with conditions af transforms the state of the stream from af to af but only the probability distribution of af is known </s>
<s> this is specified by a distribution function af such that the probability that af lies in some region d of the stage space is af </s>
<s> we cannot now speak of maximizing the value of the objective function since this function is now known only in a probabilistic sense </s>
<s> we can however maximize its expected value </s>
<s> for a single stage we may define af where the maximization is by choice of af </s>
<s> we thus have an optimal policy which maximizes the expected value of the objective function for a given af </s>
<s> if we consider a process in which the outcome of one stage is known before passage to the next then the principle of optimality shows that the policy in subsequent stages should be optimal with respect to the outcome of the first </s>
<s> then af the maximization being over all admissible af and the integration over the whole of stage space </s>
<s> the type of presentation of results used in the deterministic process may be used here except that now the fourth column is redundant </s>
<s> the third column gives the optimal policy but we must wait to see the outcome of stage r and enter the preceding section of the table at this state </s>
<s> the discussion of the optimal policy when the outcome of one stage is not known before passing to the next is a very much more difficult matter </s>
<s> in many cases it is not possible to divide the process into a finite number of discrete stages since the state of the stream is transformed in a continuous manner through the process </s>
<s> the word distance is used here in a rather general sense </s>
<s> it may in fact be the time that will elapse before the end of the process </s>
<s> p denotes the state at any point t and q the vector of operating variables there </s>
<s> a gyro-stabilized platform system using restrained gyros is well suited for automatic leveling because of the characteristics of the gyro-platform-servo combination </s>
<s> the restrained gyro-stabilized platform with reasonable response characteristics operates with an approximate equation of motion neglecting transient effects as follows af where u is a torque applied about the output axis of the controlling gyro </s>
<s> the gyro angular momentum is defined by h </s>
<s> it is assumed that the gyros are designed with electrical torquers so that a torque can be applied about their output axes </s>
<s> if the polarities are correct the platform rotates in such a direction as to reduce the accelerometer output to zero </s>
<s> as the accelerometer output is decreasing the torque applied to the gyro output axis decreases and therefore the rate decreases </s>
<s> finally when the accelerometer output is zero the entire system remains stationary and the platform is by definition leveled </s>
<s> the platform is initially off level by the angle aj </s>
<s> the voltage af is amplified by af and applied to the gyro torquer with scale factor af </s>
<s> finally the gyro-stabilized platform characteristic is represented by af </s>
<s> with these factors included an upper limit is placed on the allowable loop gain by stability considerations </s>
<s> in this type of system a high loop gain is desirable because it provides a fast response time </s>
<s> when the frequency response characteristics of practical components are considered their effect on stability does not present the most serious limit on the system loop gain </s>
<s> the time required for the system to reach a level position is approximately inversely proportional to the servo loop gain </s>
<s> in addition the cutoff frequency for input accelerations is approximately proportional to the servo loop gain </s>
<s> ie high loop gain causes the system to respond to horizontal components of accelerations </s>
<s> this problem usually determines the lower limit of loop gain rather than response time </s>
<s> the equation relating input acceleration to output platform angle is af </s>
<s> in practice the preflight leveling process takes place with the system mounted in the airframe </s>
<s> when the system is arranged for automatic leveling the platform angles respond to any horizontal components of acceleration acting on the accelerometers </s>
<s> there are many such components of acceleration present due to the effect of wind gusts engine noise turbulence around the vehicle etc </s>
<s> one of the greatest problems associated with automatic leveling is establishing a true level in the presence of high-level acceleration noise </s>
<s> one solution to the problem is to operate with a low loop gain and to include low-pass filters </s>
<s> this technique causes the system to respond only to low frequency acceleration components such as the platform tilt </s>
<s> since a lower loop gain and low-pass filtering increases the response time a practical compromise must be reached </s>
<s> one of the most desirable solutions is achieved by the use of a non-linear amplifier for af </s>
<s> the amplifier is designed so that its gain is large for accelerometer signals above a certain threshold level </s>
<s> below this level the amplifier gain af is proportional and is of small value in order to provide adequate noise filtering </s>
<s> the effect is that the platform returns from an off-level position at a rapid rate until it is nearly level at which point the platform is controlled by a proportional servo with low enough frequency response so that the noise has little effect on the leveling process </s>
<s> the platform actually tilts off level so that the accelerometer output when amplified by af will supply the correct current to the gyro torquer to cancel the gyro drift </s>
<s> the amount of platform dip required depends upon the scale factors of the system </s>
<s> practical leveling considerations </s>
<s> the automatic leveling system described in this section is readily adaptable to a gyro-stabilized platform consisting of three integrating gyros </s>
<s> the system requires some switching of flight equipment circuits </s>
<s> however the leveling operation can be maintained and controlled remotely with no mechanical or optical contact with the platform </s>
<s> this leveling system will hold the platform on-level automatically as long as the system is actuated </s>
<s> a useful by-product of this system is that the information necessary to set the gyro drift biases is available from the currents necessary to hold the system in level </s>
<s> the leveling process can be accomplished manually and the results are as satisfactory as those obtained with automatic equipment </s>
<s> the process consists in turning the platform manually until the outputs of both accelerometers are zero </s>
<s> the turning is accomplished by applying voltage to the gyro torquers described above </s>
<s> manual leveling requires an appropriate display of the accelerometer outputs </s>
<s> however skill is required on the part of an operator to level a platform to any degree of accuracy </s>
<s> also it requires more time as compared to the automatic approach </s>
<s> manual leveling is inconvenient if the platform must be maintained accurately level for any prolonged period of time </s>
<s> the operator must continually supply the correct amount of turning current to the gyro torquers so that the effect of gyro drift is canceled </s>
<s> this process is especially difficult since gyro drifting is typically random </s>
<s> platform heading </s>
<s> platform heading consists of orienting the sensitive axis of the accelerometers parallel to the desired coordinate system of the navigator </s>
<s> in simpler terms it amounts to pointing the platform in the proper direction </s>
<s> for purely inertial navigators two techniques are available to accomplish the platform heading use of external or surveying equipment to establish proper heading </s>
<s> use of the characteristics of the platform components for an indication of true heading </s>
<s> the choice of the heading technique is dependent upon the accuracy requirements field conditions and the time available to accomplish the heading </s>
<s> with the gyro-stabilized platform leveled it can be headed in the proper direction by using surveying techniques </s>
<s> the platform accelerometers must be slightly modified for this procedure </s>
<s> before the accelerometers are mounted on the platform the direction of their sensitive axis must be accurately determined </s>
<s> a mirror is mounted on each accelerometer so that the plane of the mirror is perpendicular to the sensitive axis of the unit </s>
<s> transit </s>
<s> a precision transit is set up so that it is aligned with respect to true north </s>
<s> this can be done to a high degree of accuracy by existing surveying techniques </s>
<s> with the transit set up a mirror on one of the accelerometers is sighted and the platform is turned until it is aligned </s>
<s> the sighting procedure includes the use of a fixture for the transit to project a beam of light which is darkened by crossed hairs on the accelerometer mirror </s>
<s> when the platform is aligned the reflected image of the crossed hairs can be seen exactly superimposed upon the original crossed hairs </s>
<s> the images can easily be aligned with a high degree of accuracy </s>
<s> the platform is turned as required by supplying currents to the appropriate gyro torquers </s>
<s> although this technique is simple and satisfactory one practical difficulty does exist the direction of true north must be known for each launch point </s>
<s> however this difficulty is not too serious if it is realized that a surveying team can establish a true north base line with a few days work </s>
<s> in many installations the inertial platform is raised off the ground a considerable height when it is mounted in the vehicle before flight </s>
<s> with this situation it is difficult to sight in on the platform with surveying equipment </s>
<s> if the platform is not too high off the ground a transit can be mounted on a stand to raise it up to the platform </s>
<s> obviously the heading accuracy is lessened by such techniques since errors are introduced because of motion of the stand </s>
<s> autocollimator </s>
<s> the transit can be replaced by an autocollimator </s>
<s> this instrument provides an electrical signal proportional to the angular deviations of the platform and can be used to automatically hold the platform on true heading </s>
<s> the electrical signal from the autocollimator is amplified and supplied to the z-gyro torquer </s>
<s> if the polarity is correct the platform will turn until the heading error angle is zero </s>
<s> information is also available from this autocollimator system to set the drift bias for the z-axis gyro </s>
<s> if the z gyro is drifting a current generated by the autocollimator is delivered to the gyro torquer to cancel the drift </s>
<s> if the drift error is systematic it can be canceled with a bias circuit which can be arranged and adjusted to supply the required compensating current </s>
<s> electrical pickoffs </s>
<s> it is possible to locate an angular electrical pickoff which will indicate the angular deviation between the true heading direction and the platform </s>
<s> essentially the stator or reference portion of the pickoff is established with respect to the true heading direction and the platform is turned either manually or automatically until the angular electrical pickoff signal is reduced to zero </s>
<s> gyrocompass heading </s>
<s> gyrocompass alignment is an automatic heading system which depends upon the characteristic of one gyro to establish true heading </s>
<s> for the case of a purely inertial autonavigator consisting of three restrained gyros a coordinate system is used where the sensitive axis of the x accelerometer is parallel to the east-west direction at the base point and the y accelerometer sensitive axis is parallel to the north-south direction at the base point </s>
<s> the accelerometers are mounted rigidly on the platform </s>
<s> thus if one accelerometer is properly aligned the other is also </s>
<s> the input axis of the appropriate gyros are parallel to the sensitive direction of the accelerometers </s>
<s> the platform is leveled and properly headed so that the x-gyro input axis is parallel to the east-west direction and the y-gyro input axis is parallel to the north-south direction </s>
<s> the input axis of the x gyro when pointing in the east-west direction is always perpendicular to the spin axis of earth </s>
<s> the sensing of this rotation by the x gyro can be utilized to direct the platform into proper heading </s>

<s> scotty did not go back to school </s>
<s> his teacher and his school principal were conferred with and everyone agreed that if he kept up with a certain amount of work at home there was little danger of his losing a term </s>
<s> scotty accepted the decision with indifference and did not enter the arguments </s>

<s> his face was fuller </s>
